story:
Short Summary

Contemporary Sound Of Colombia Salsa es una produccion musical en disco compacto que busca dar relevancia y divulgacion a las nuevas orquesta de salsa en Colombia

The Cd also will include a booklet with the a biography of every band.
spanish and english

What We Need & What You Get

  • The funds reached will pay every artist for the song, the writer who is geeting deep into every band history, the professional designer to illustrate a unique cover (no Fotos), and the translator in english. Naturally, and the most expensive thing, the production of the cd's in the best fabric in Colombia

The Impact

  • Without the contributtion of radio not commercial bands seems to have an end very soon.  Contemporary Sounds Of Colombian Salsa is a project created to encourage new artist to record and to give fans a taste of the talent of the new bands. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
I’m thrilled to announce the release of my first CD with all original music, "Chasing Trains". You'll experience a mix of rock, touch of country, and splash of blues. My gospel roots will come out as well. I am so excited for the opportunity to see these eleven tunes come to life and share them with you! 

This project comes with a cost that I plan to mostly fund myself. However, I am asking for support to help prefund some of the project. You can help by pre-purchasing a CD or contributing at one of the other donor levels below.  Of course, you can donate any other amount if you feel so inclined!! 

Project cost is $8-10k and includes: 

·  Musicians: Rehearsal/Recording Time

·  Studio Time: Recording, Mixing, Mastering

·  CD Photography/Graphic Design, Duplication

·  Merchandise

·  CD Release Party

·  Marketing, Promo, Distribution, Postage


Feel free to pledge multiple times at different levels to get different gifts.  For other payment options, please contact me at judyhhmusic@gmail.com.

Please share with friends or family who may enjoy my music.

Thank you so much for your contribution. I look forward to seeing you at the release party!

Peace,

Judy

story:
By and large, tour is awesome. We've been lucky enough to have some of the best experiences of our lives on tour.

On our trip to Minneapolis, we went to the Triple Rock for their award winning breakfast burritos (I give them a 4) and in the time it took us to eat breakfast, someone had broken into our van.

They didn't have time to make off with any gear, they did however manage to steal a couple laptops and some personal items. Our laptops are how we work from the road and back home, so it extra sucks.

We're trying to raise money to repair the window of our van and hopefully recoup some of our losses.

Tour is awesome, but sometimes these things happen.

story:
Hello!

We are Heroes Turn Human, an alternative pop punk/rock band from the Bay Area. After recording our debut EP "Set Sail for Yesterday" last summer, we are planning to hit the studio again this summer and record number two.

Since last year we have all evolved musically and with the upcoming EP, we hope to reflect our creative development. With your help, it will be possible for us to express ourselves through new original music, and to record these new songs for everyone to enjoy.

The donations that you make will go toward recording time, as well as the mixing and mastering of the album. Additional funds raised will be put toward distribution of the album and additional expenses that come with the recording process. If you are unable to make a donation, but would still like to help us put out the album, please share this link with family and friends. We really appreciate any support. Thank you.

Sincerely,

Heroes Turn Human

Thank you.Sincerely, Heroes Turn Human

story:
I began writing music in 1965 when I was 14 and by the time I graduated high school, I had a large body of songs and played an array of musical instruments. I also had a voice and had already struck out on a performing career, singing at coffeehouses, clubs, parties, rallies... any place that would let me do it! By 1972 I was living in Laurel Canyon and performing on television and radio, at concerts all over LA, and opening for artists like the Doobie Brothers, Peter Gallway, and Leon Russell. In 1978 I went to England where I continued performing and in 1981 I got the attention of Paul McCartney, who gave me some serious consideration. I thought I'd finally get to make an album! Well, that fell through, but undaunted, I continued performing in my home state of California and across the southwestern states, all while being a single mom of a beautiful son with high-functioning autism.

Then in 1992 real life happened. My father was diagnosed with cancer and we moved to Denver so that I could take care of him through his last year. My music fell behind; I couldn't bring myself to touch my guitars. Shortly after Dad's death my mother had a stroke and I brought her from Denver to live with me, where I was her caretaker for four years until she passed. All of this while raising a large second family. All of the stress of being a caretaker took its toll on my own body and I fell to an auto-immune disease that kept me in bed for two years with chronic pain, fatigue, and depression.

Then something wonderful started to happen. I started coming out of it and I began playing music again. Just for myself, but I was playing... and singing... and writing songs! My Muse was back! I'm 63 years old now and am preparing to take my music onto the house concert circuit and share the things I've learned. But I need to record an album, which, these days is no big deal. The only problem is, I can't afford to buy the basic gear I need to do this. Having recording studio experience, I'm prepared to record at home-- I've already designed the jewel case inserts and covers! 

The funds will go toward the purchase of the following items:

  • A good microphone, boom stand, and cables
  • Professional headphones
  • A recorder/mixer
  • Jewel cases & inserts
  • Printing & manufacturing
I'm asking you to help me make my one and only dream come true. I've gladly taken care of everyone else and now I need help to do this one thing before I get too old and decrepit... ;) Will you help?
Thanks so much!
Kaye

story:
Our New EP

We love you for listening to our music, coming to our shows, hanging out with us on younow.com, talking with us on Twitter and being here reading our story.
We are a bi-coastal pop/punk band working hard to make and share music we love with the fans we love!
We have the opportunity to record our next EP with platinum-selling producer Jim Wirt. He produced some of our favorite albums of all time by Something Corporate and Jack's Mannequin, as well as awesome albums by Fiona Apple and Incubus!

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help! This campaign will help us cover the recording and production costs for the EP, and some of the cost of traveling to Cleveland for the project.
You can help us buy pre-ordering the EP! You can also get some of our awesome prizes with additional contributions to the campaign. Everything helps!

Other Ways You Can Help

No spare cash? No problem (same here)! There are other ways you can help.

  • Folllow us on younow.com and see our next live stream!
  • Make some noise on Twitter, Instagram, etc. We are @Almost_July
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you! We love our #AlmostSquad

story:
THE SHORT STORY:

If you're reading this, we probably know each other, so I'll skip my introduction and tell you about Strahan & The Good Neighbors. To put it simply, we are an American Band or if you're into the whole sub-genre thing, then call it American Old School. It's funky but it isn't funk; there's country, soul, and blues in there, but it isn't any of these; it's American, but it's not Americana. Like my favorite bands from the 60s and 70s, we're steeped in old school American music, but we've evolved into something all it's own. I love this band and our new record, and I want to get both out to you. 

Behind the curtains, getting a record out to the masses is a pricey endeavor. It takes many professionals connected in the industry's network of publications and radio stations to move, shake and hustle for any of these said entities to give your work just one listen, let alone consideration for review or airplay. The objective of this campaign is to pay for Public Relations (PR), Promotion, and Radio Placement. It's effectively a non-negotiable investment one has to make in order to be a successful touring band, and to get this music out to you.

Why is it important? Getting our record on the radio, into magazines, online blogs and such, lets people choose for themselves the music that plays on the airwaves, and the bands that play the nearby music venues. Movements of late in music, such as Sturgill Simpson's successful grassroots promotional campaigns, have proven this to be true. We all want to listen to good music! The Good Neighbors and I put in hours, days, weeks (months) on our new album. We're constantly tightening up our set, honing in our individual and collective crafts. We put on a good show and we have a solid record that deserves a chance to be heard.

THE BASIC COSTS (IN A NUT SHELL):

Two Month Americana Radio Campaign: $3500

Radio Tour (solo radio spots) Travel expenses: $2500 

Radio Mail Outs: $600

Three month PR Campaign (20+tour dates): $8250

THE LONG STORY:

All of these elements combined will help The Good Neighbors create a powerful campaign and allow us to get our music out of Austin and out to more national radio stations, publications and reviewers.

  • American Radio Campaign ($3500): This budget is for a two month campaign. We will enter into a contract with a professional in radio placement who is connected, meaning trusted, by the radio stations with whom he or she works. He or she will work on behalf of The Good Neighbors to introduce our music to radio DJs and producers, and essentially vouch for our sound in America and abroad.
  • Radio Tour ($2500): This percentage of funding for a radio tour that takes me, Doug, out on a solo run promoting the album. 5 days per month, I drive around to radio stations for interviews and to perform. This portion of the funds goes towards travel expenses (i.e. moderately priced hotels). This also assures I'm showered for the interview!
  • Radio Mail Outs ($600): These are the rough costs for producing 100 CDs, mailing materials, and postage that will get our album into the ears of radio DJ's within the five state region (NM, TX, OK, AR, LA).
  • Public Relations ($8250): These funds will go toward contracting with a PR agent, again someone connected and trusted by the publications, who sets up record reviews, interviews, and general exposure of the music and tour dates. 

THE REWARDS & YOUR IMPACT:

Perks! My old day job was in health and human services. Since leaving, I've been giving guitar lessons/songwriting guidance via Jail Guitar Doors with my buddy, Johnny Dango. Charity and how it relates to community, has always been important to me. One perk, categorized as "For the Sick, the Troubled, and the Lonely", is an opportunity for me (and you) to give back to the community. You designate the audience (i.e. nursing homes, jails, hospitals, the house-bound, or someone just plain heart broken and sad) and I go pick and sing for them. 
If the goal isn't reached, the money still goes to these services, only they will lessen in scope (i.e., three-month campaign will be one-to-two months, etc.). My plan is still to get the music out there, as much as I can.

THE UPHILL BATTLE:

The costs of "doing business" in the music industry is something that most artists, including myself, never consider. I just want to make good music with people that I enjoy collaborating with -- The Good Neighbors. This campaign is simply a chance for us all to have a shot at being heard, and to give you the opportunity to get music you really want to hear on the radio and in your hometown.

There's always the chance the record will get good reviews but people will continue to slowly trickle into the shows over the next year; however, with consistent tour cycles, we'll continue on. There's a the chance it won't get good reviews or the desired airplay. This is always a possibility. Agents can lead the critics to the record, but they can't twist their hearts into loving it. If that happens, we truck on, simple as that. 

All that said, if the record is given a chance and we are given the opportunity to perform live, I can assure you, the audience WILL see a show they won't soon forget. We go all in!

SUPPORTING YOUR GOOD NEIGHBORS:

Times are tough, and I don't want this to feel like we're asking for a hand out. If financial contributions aren't a possibility, then your simple support is enough. I DON'T WANT ANYONE TO BREAK THE BANK! Give what you can, if you can, and if you can't contribute, it's all good. Help us spread the word on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Email, Snail Mail, come to shows, invite your friends, and give us a listen. 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Greetings! :)  

We are the University of San Carlos Choristers, the oldest school-based choral group in Cebu City, Philippines. This group has been sharing the gift of music since 1965. In fact, this year, we are celebrating our 50th (Golden) Anniversary. 

This group has been giving opportunity for those talented individuals who can't afford to go to school. Each member of this group enjoys a scholarship privileged granted by the school because of his/her talent in music. 

The group has encountered numerous workshops from the past years and through these, the group was able to develop music literacy specifically in the field of choral singing. In fact, the USC Choristers has passed with distinction the Intermediate level choral singing of the ABRSM (The Associate Board of the Royal Schools of Music) of United Kingdom. Indeed, this latest achievement would make the USC Choristers internationally renowned. 

This year, the USC Choristers are blessed to be invited in a worldwide event which is the Sing ‘n Joy International Choir Festival 2015, which will be held in Shunde, China this coming November 4-8, 2015. This event invites choral groups from all over the world to celebrate a festival of music and global harmony. The invitation was sent to the group by Professor Matthias Merzhäuser, a German composer, choir director and one of the choral coaches of the USC Choristers. Professor Matthias has cooperated with an international organization named INTERKULTUR, which is the world's leading organizer of international choir competitions and festivals since 1988. This organization allows him to send one of the choirs he coaches in Cebu to the event. The group’s food and accommodation from November 2-8, 2015 will be provided by the organizers and the airfare and other necessary expenses will be shouldered personally. But the student's will not be able to aid the full amount of airfare to push through this very nice opportunity. 

This event will be a great opportunity for the group to enhance their learning and improve the skills that they have. It will also benefit the choral group for it will be a training ground and a opportunity for us to improve especially that we are scholars in the school. Please take time to consider what the choral group wants to accomplish this November in China. That is to showcase the Cebuano and Carolinian talent and spirit of excellence by being witnesses to the Word through music on an international scale. We believe that we do not only celebrate music but also celebrate life.

We are knocking in your hearts to support us in this event. You will always be in our prayers and you will be part of us in spirit as we represent not only ourselves but the people who have kind hearts like you.

story:
Resumen/Summary

Hola a todos! En nombre de la Orquesta Resistencia Metropolitana y de mi persona, les damos las gracias por interesarse en nuestro proyecto. Actualmente somos una orquesta de salsa en Puerto Rico que esta empezando a adentrarse en el ambiente musical (pueden escuchar nos aquí https://soundcloud.com/jerenluis-guzman/adoracion) Aunque actualmente nos hemos dedicado a trabajar en actividades privadas y de índole benéfica, hemos decidido entrar en una nueva etapa donde necesitaremos la ayuda de nuestra fanaticada.  Estamos cansados de tocar música ya popularizada por otros y por eso queremos que ustedes sean los que nos apoyen en la grabación de los primeros temas para nuestro primer disco. Somos un grupo de jóvenes que queremos marcar el genero de la salsa con un sonido nuevo y distinto, lleno de un mensaje de justicia y perseverancia para todos en general. Actualmente es difícil que el nuevo talento musical de nuestra raza pueda crear y comercializar su trabajo dado a los altos niveles de competencia y poco reconocimiento económico. Sin embargo, haremos todo por recompensarlos a ustedes con la mejor salsa que habrán de escuchar.


Hello Everyone! In the name of the "Resistencia Metropolitana" salsa orchestra and of myself, we thank you for demonstrating interest in our project. Currently, we are a salsa orchestra stationed in Puerto Rico that is starting to get into the music business (you can listen to us in an audio of one of the covers we play, here https://soundcloud.com/jerenluis-guzman/adoracion). Even though we currently have dedicated ourselves to play in private and  charity gigs, we have decided to take our music  to a new level, but we need the help of our fans top get there! We are tired of playing music that has been made famous by others and this is why we want you to be the ones that can help us get the funds needed in order for us to record the first three tracks to our first album! We are a group of young people that want to leave a mark in the salsa genre, exposing a new and unique sound that also contains a message of justice and perseverance for all. It is difficult for the new talents of our race to create and promote their work due to high levels of competition and poor economic recognition. But we promise that we will do everything in our power to compensate you with the best salsa you have ever heard!

Que necesitamos y que ustedes reciben/ What do we need and what do you get

Actualmente, la cantidad de dinero necesaria para financiar un proyecto como este ha bajado en los últimos años en nuestro país dado a los efectos de la última recesión global y problemas económicos que tenemos a nivel local. Sin embargo, esa cantidad sigue siendo considerable para músicos que empezamos con poco pero queremos ofrecer mucho.  Para que tengan una idea, el grabar un solo tema musical puede salir entre $800 y $1,000, tomando en consideración que esto incluye un trabajo bien hecho por parte de los ingenieros de sonido y que una sesión de grabación en el estudio donde grabaríamos, de no hacerse en un día, cuesta aproximadamente $30 por hora y  esta suele tardar más de lo que muchos pueden imaginar. Nosotros tenemos una meta de llegar a una cantidad de $3,500 dado a que la grabación de cada tema nos puede costar unos $900. El resto del dinero se necesitaría para poder contratar al arreglista de la música a ser grabada y para darle una remuneración a los músicos que participarían de nuestra grabación. Ninguna cantidad del dinero a recaudarse en esta campaña se usará para correr con gastos que no tengan que ver con este proyecto. Dentro de nuestros planes si se encuentra comercializar los temas a ser grabados, así que estén pendientes a las redes y los distribuidores digitales para cuando llegue la hora de descargar. Claro, su apoyo no será en vano! Aquellos que apoyen esta campaña van a ser los primeros en poder escuchar nuestros primeros tema y disfrutar de nuestra música. Nosotros nos comprometemos, de no poder llegar a la cantidad de dinero estipulada pero sí recaudar suficiente como para continuar con la grabación de un tema o dos, a hacerle llegar a ustedes la información requerida para que puedan descargar estos libre de costo para ustedes.  


Currently, the amount of funds needed to finance a project like this one isn't as much compared to the pre-recession  period. However, the amount of money needed is still considerable for those of us that are beginning to work in the musical industry. To have an idea, recording one track can cost between $800 and $1,000, taking into account the good work done by the sound engineers that would work on the protect.   We also have to take into account the fact that a recording session in the studio were we would record, if lasting more than a day(which most likely will), can cost us $30 an hour. Our goal is to reach a minimum of $3,500 to finance our project. The recording sessions for each track can cost us aprox. $900. The rest of the money would be used to pay for musical arrangements and the work our musicians would be doing. None of the funds would be used to pay for things that won't have relation with our project. We do plan, however, to promote our music, so be sure to check out when we will announce who will be digitally distributing our music for when the time comes to download! Oh, and you won't support our project in vane! Those who support this project will have early access to our music. And we give you our word that, if we don't reach our goal but have enough funds to have at least one or two recording sessions, we will make that content available. 

Que legado queremos dejar/ What mark will we leave 

Sonará un poco ambicioso hablar de legados cuando nuestra orquesta solo esta empezando con esta campaña. Sin embargo, es importante dejarle saber al pueblo salsero que la nueva generación esta dispuesta a contribuir a sus gustos con sonidos nuevos y acogedores. Es importante demostrarle al mundo que una orquesta como la Resistencia Metropolitana, a través de la música,  esta dispuesta a demostrar apoyo a aquel ser humano que día a día se levanta a buscar como descifrar el mundo.  Más que mero entretenimiento, a la música ser parte integral de las funciones cognoscitivas y el desempeño social del ser humano y al humano ser un ente diseñado para hacer y recibir estipulación a través del sonido, la música se constituye en una necesidad para una vivencia de calidad. La vida humana sin la música no sería la misma y siempre esta ha servido como sistema de comunicación, calmante de dolores y exponente de mensajes de resistencia. La música se ha hecho ver como mero entretenimiento cuando realmente es una herramienta sofisticada de comunicación que es usada por distintas personas con distintas ideas para propagar diferentes mensajes. Algunos la han utilizado con propósitos negativos. Nosotros la utilizaremos para mandar un mensaje de resistencia, justicia y amor para todos en general.


It might sound a bit ambitious to talk about "leaving marks" when we are a salsa orchestra that is just starting to get into the music business. However, it is important to let salsa fans know that there is a new generation  that is willing to appeal to their liking with a slew of new and unique sounds. It is important to show the world that a musical group like "Orquesta Resistencia Metropolitana" is willing to show support to all of those people that wake up every morning in the search of an understanding to our visible world. More that just entertainment, music is an integral part of our cognitive functions and our social involvement. Since we humans are design to send an receive stimulation through sound, music constitutes a necessity in a dignified way of life. Human life wouldn't be the same without music and music has always been used as collective tool for communication, as a way to calm fears and feelings of collective depression, and a way to demonstrate social resistance. Music has been projected to be something of mere entertainment, when in reality it is a sophisticated communication tool that is used by different people to expose different ideas. Some have used it with a negative purpose. We will use it to send a message of resistance, justice and love to all. 


Otras formas en las que nos pueden ayudar/Other ways you can help

  • Entendemos que no todos aquellos que quieran ayudar lo puedan hacer de forma monetaria. Es por esto que le pedimos a aquellos que no puedan ayudar de forma monetaria, lo hagan utilizando las herramientas que les provee indiegogo para compartir nuestra campaña a través de toda la red. De la misma forma, sería un gran favor el que compartan esta página en sus cuentas de redes sociales y le comenten a sus amigos sobre la misma!
  • We understand that not all that wish to help us can do so economically. That is why we ask of those people to help us using the social tools indiegogo provides in our campaign page through the whole internet. It will also be of a great favor if you share this page in your social network accounts. Please tell your friends about us!



Gracias a todos por su auspicio. Prometemos que no serán defraudados!
Thank you all for your patronage! We will not let you down!



- Jeren L. Guzmán-Rivera
Director Musical/Musical Director

story:
Hi - I'm independent Vancouver recording artist Jordan Hart (www.jordanhartsound.com) and I'm looking for your help to produce my first full-length music video to accompany "Body Language"!

So far, we've done a short promo video (with some amazing work from Sammy Golom & Nick Lamb from Media Mountain - http://www.mediamountain.ca/  to highlight the extended beginning to Body Language which you can see in the header of this campaign or here:

https://youtu.be/1HZDXUNBCWA

 but I am seeking some help coming up with the funding for the full-length video. 

You can check out a preview of the full Body Language track here: 

http://www.jordanhartsound.com/music.asp

I just completed the recording & co-producing of two tracks with Ryan Stewart, a Juno Award-winning, multi Platinum-selling songwriter and producer of Carly Rae Jepsen, Victoria Duffield, Bif Naked and others, based out of North Vancouver.  

http://www.ryanstewartsongs.com/artists.html

I have also had the incredible fortune of being signed to a radio promotion deal with FrontSide Group (www.frontsidegroup.com) led by Geoff Goddard & Gary McDonald and we'll be releasing Body Language on Canadian Radio in August.

I am humbled by the offers of support that I have received at various live shows I've done over the last several months so wanted to start this campaign to provide an outlet for people to help out.

There are a lot of really cool perks to be had and I look forward to seeing which ones appeal to you most!

Thanks for visiting this page and I'll see you soon!

Cheers,

Jordan

story:
___________________________
PLEASE DON'T share our music video (TOP), rather SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN - 
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-inside-job-debut-album--2/x/11606248#/
                                                              _______________________________________
WHO IS "The Inside Job"?

We are three individuals [scroll down for pictures] from South Africa in a small region called the "Boland" which is about 60km from the very well known city of Cape Town. We started playing together in May 2009 and did our first gig together in June in a venue (now closed down) called "Corner Bar". Individually we have very different taste in music. It is a dream making music with 3 different viewpoints and hearing the outcome.

To be in a country where rock 'n roll is seen as "white" music only, is already a barrier not easily broken down and because of this it is difficult getting in the right venues, events & festivals.

What we want, is for you to hear our passion, everyone around the world.


          Our dream is to be able to finish a full album and for it to be heard. 

                     

                      On the guitar and vocals is Lionel John (LJ) Maharajah.


                                  

                     On drums is Lionel's sister Melony (Phoenixx) Maharajah.


                                   

                                             On the bass is Shawn Adams.


To our South African friends who would like to contribute (any amount), here is our south african account details below. (please use your full name as the reference) THANK YOU!
      The Inside Job | Capitec Bank | 142 306 826 0 | 470010

                                             _____________


WHY FUNDRAISING? 

 Since we started our journey together almost 6 years ago, we have always tried to do things on our own with the income we generated through shows or individually.

We have realised that we can not do what we have to do on our own, regarding recording a full studio album. 

                      ____________________
“I've heard a lot of bands that's bad and good, but never a group that has the flexibility to stretch beyond the realm of the ordained cathedrals of 'Rocking The Daisies' or 'Oppikoppi'. Don't pass this band by, lest life passes you by...”  Shiloh Noone - Rock Author / FMR Radio / Shindig Magazine ________________________________________

WHAT HAVE WE DONE SO FAR?

We have saved enough money  to buy high quality equipment so that we can create original unfiltered artistic music at home. With the equipment that we have bought, we have started recording our album and are already 50% complete. LJ will also be able to edit the mixes at his home studio. We have already shot the first music video of our album in faith that we will finish it.


                                Here is a video of us on our way to the shoot...


     

     


Watch our first music video 'Out Of This World' below...



WHAT DO WE NEED?
We need to mix, master, package and distribution. We could buy cheap covers and print the covers with an office printer (haha), but we would love to have a high quality recording, mixed, mastered and packaged so that it reflects what is on the disc as well. Below we have made a detailed description of what the costs are...

                   
                      ______________________________
“The Inside Job always leaves me thinking: “Why the hell aren’t they bigger on the local scene?” They are Main Stage quality and organisers should start realising that.” Dee Theart - Radio Sonder Grense (RSG Radio) ____________________________________________

MIX & MASTER - R60 000

We are busy with a 12 track album, which means to mix and master each song will cost at most R5 000/song (Mixing R3900 + Mastering R1100). A mixing engineer makes everything sound great together, making sure the guitar isn't too loud and the voice fits in the mix. Makes the bass not blow your car speaker. The mastering engineer is the polisher. Once the mixing engineer is done, he hands it over to this 'master'. The volume is also greatly increased without distorting the track.

PACKAGING - R5000

For the printing of the covers, cd casing, compact discs, writing of cd's and wrapping of 400 cd's will be around R5000.

DISTRIBUTION - R10 000

This is the most important part for us, to be heard. For us to get our music heard on radio stations, cd's in shops and on Itunes it'll cost minumum R10 000. The reason why we say mimimum is because, we can not distribute enough. It's an on going procedure, but with the sales of our 400 albums, merchandise, etc we can keep it going. 

It all comes down to an amount of R 75, 000 / $ 5, 750

                     _____________________________

“This diversity emerges in a genre-bending blend of rock, pop and funk, and an extensive repertoire of standards and original compositions, presented in an appealing, high-energy package, with lashings of stage presence.”  Maggie Follet, JOURNALIST ____________________________


         PERKS! What you get for helping us out...

If you look on the right hand side of your screen you will see all the perks. We have            made a list of great perks and fan giveaways you'd love! CHECK IT OUT!

WHAT IF... we do not reach our fundraising goal? 

We will use that money to forward this project however possible. If it comes down to it, we will release an album with less tracks on it. 
We pledge to you that we will transparently use every cent raised on this specific album called "Metal & Rust".

THE IMPACT!!!

We have always been firm believers that music can change the world, one person at a time. We believe in our music and that is why we want to make sure it gets heard. Our first single, "Out Of This World" we released in 2013 we had a sold out show and within the first month of releasing it we were contacted by 2 European publishing companies that wanted to help us, but unfortunately things didn't go as planned. It was a massive letdown to hear the news of not completing a publishing deal, but how difficult it may be, we move forward.


RISKS & CHALLENGES? 

Of course there are! Time is always a major factor in any career. The 3 of us are all working and have to keep our head above water, while following our dream. We have cancelled personal events to make sure we keep on performing, bringing in some form of income. We will not give up on reaching our goal.

Melony and Shawn have to drive at least 100km combined to practise or record every single time.

____________________________________________________________________________


          ZA BANK ACCOUNT DETAILS

          If you are from South Africa you can make a payment in this account.
                               The Inside Job | Capitec Bank | 142 306 826 0 | 470010

_____________________________________________________________________________


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you are not able to help us financially, then there are other ways your can help.

You can get the word out about what we are doing and what we want to achieve. Share our social media pages. MAKE NOISE!

You can use the "Indiegogo" share tools! Here are some links you can use and share:

www.facebook.com/theijob

www.twitter.com/theijob

www.instagram.com/theinsidejobofficial

www.youtube.com/theinsidejobvideos


              R E M E M B E R      TO      C H O O S E      Y O U R      P E R K !

                   

                                                                 

                        


SPONSORS

A great photographer/artist and long time friend, Daniel Saaiman is sponsoring us with all the photography. We urge you to please go see and support his work on his website (see links below).

                                                   

                                                       www.danielsaaiman.com
story_txt:
___________________________PLEASE DON'T share our music video (TOP), rather SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN - 

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-inside-job-debut-album--2/x/11606248#/                                                              _______________________________________

WHO IS "The Inside Job"?

We are three individuals [scroll down for pictures] from South Africa in a small region called the "Boland" which is about 60km from the very well known city of Cape Town. We started playing together in May 2009 and did our first gig together in June in a venue (now closed down) called "Corner Bar". Individually we have very different taste in music. It is a dream making music with 3 different viewpoints and hearing the outcome. To be in a country where rock 'n roll is seen as "white" music only, is already a barrier not easily broken down and because of this it is difficult getting in the right venues, events & festivals. What we want, is for you to hear our passion, everyone around the world.
          Our dream is to be able to finish a full album and for it to be heard. 
                     
                      On the guitar and vocals is Lionel John (LJ) Maharajah.




                                                       On drums is Lionel's sister Melony (Phoenixx) Maharajah.



                                   
                                             On the bass is Shawn Adams.


To our South African friends who would like to contribute (any amount), here is our south african account details below. (please use your full name as the reference) THANK YOU!

      The Inside Job | Capitec Bank | 142 306 826 0 | 470010                                             _____________



WHY FUNDRAISING? 

 Since we started our journey together almost 6 years ago, we have always tried to do things on our own with the income we generated through shows or individually.

We have realised that we can not do what we have to do on our own, regarding recording a full studio album. 

                      ____________________
“I've heard a lot of bands that's bad and good, but never a group that has the flexibility to stretch beyond the realm of the ordained cathedrals of 'Rocking The Daisies' or 'Oppikoppi'. Don't pass this band by, lest life passes you by...”  Shiloh Noone - Rock Author / FMR Radio / Shindig Magazine ________________________________________





WHAT HAVE WE DONE SO FAR?
We have saved enough money  to buy high quality equipment so that we can create original unfiltered artistic music at home. With the equipment that we have bought, we have started recording our album and are already 50% complete. LJ will also be able to edit the mixes at his home studio. We have already shot the first music video of our album in faith that we will finish it.                                Here is a video of us on our way to the shoot...

          

Watch our first music video 'Out Of This World' below...

WHAT DO WE NEED?We need to mix, master, package and distribution. We could buy cheap covers and print the covers with an office printer (haha), but we would love to have a high quality recording, mixed, mastered and packaged so that it reflects what is on the disc as well. Below we have made a detailed description of what the costs are...



                   

                      ______________________________
“The Inside Job always leaves me thinking: “Why the hell aren’t they bigger on the local scene?” They are Main Stage quality and organisers should start realising that.” Dee Theart - Radio Sonder Grense (RSG Radio) ____________________________________________






MIX & MASTER - R60 000
We are busy with a 12 track album, which means to mix and master each song will cost at most R5 000/song (Mixing R3900 + Mastering R1100). A mixing engineer makes everything sound great together, making sure the guitar isn't too loud and the voice fits in the mix. Makes the bass not blow your car speaker. The mastering engineer is the polisher. Once the mixing engineer is done, he hands it over to this 'master'. The volume is also greatly increased without distorting the track.
PACKAGING - R5000
For the printing of the covers, cd casing, compact discs, writing of cd's and wrapping of 400 cd's will be around R5000.
DISTRIBUTION - R10 000
This is the most important part for us, to be heard. For us to get our music heard on radio stations, cd's in shops and on Itunes it'll cost minumum R10 000. The reason why we say mimimum is because, we can not distribute enough. It's an on going procedure, but with the sales of our 400 albums, merchandise, etc we can keep it going. 
It all comes down to an amount of R 75, 000 / $ 5, 750                     _____________________________
“This diversity emerges in a genre-bending blend of rock, pop and funk, and an extensive repertoire of standards and original compositions, presented in an appealing, high-energy package, with lashings of stage presence.”  Maggie Follet, JOURNALIST ____________________________



         PERKS! What you get for helping us out...
If you look on the right hand side of your screen you will see all the perks. We have            made a list of great perks and fan giveaways you'd love! CHECK IT OUT!


WHAT IF... we do not reach our fundraising goal? 
We will use that money to forward this project however possible. If it comes down to it, we will release an album with less tracks on it. 

We pledge to you that we will transparently use every cent raised on this specific album called "Metal & Rust".


THE IMPACT!!!
We have always been firm believers that music can change the world, one person at a time. We believe in our music and that is why we want to make sure it gets heard. Our first single, "Out Of This World" we released in 2013 we had a sold out show and within the first month of releasing it we were contacted by 2 European publishing companies that wanted to help us, but unfortunately things didn't go as planned. It was a massive letdown to hear the news of not completing a publishing deal, but how difficult it may be, we move forward.


    


RISKS & CHALLENGES? 

Of course there are! Time is always a major factor in any career. The 3 of us are all working and have to keep our head above water, while following our dream. We have cancelled personal events to make sure we keep on performing, bringing in some form of income. We will not give up on reaching our goal.Melony and Shawn have to drive at least 100km combined to practise or record every single time.____________________________________________________________________________

          ZA BANK ACCOUNT DETAILS
          If you are from South Africa you can make a payment in this account.
                               The Inside Job | Capitec Bank | 142 306 826 0 | 470010


_____________________________________________________________________________   


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you are not able to help us financially, then there are other ways your can help.
You can get the word out about what we are doing and what we want to achieve. Share our social media pages. MAKE NOISE!
You can use the "Indiegogo" share tools! Here are some links you can use and share:
www.facebook.com/theijob
www.twitter.com/theijob
www.instagram.com/theinsidejobofficial
www.youtube.com/theinsidejobvideos

              R E M E M B E R      TO      C H O O S E      Y O U R      P E R K !
                   

                                                                 
                        

SPONSORS
A great photographer/artist and long time friend, Daniel Saaiman is sponsoring us with all the photography. We urge you to please go see and support his work on his website (see links below).
                                                   
                                                       www.danielsaaiman.com

story:
Hi, I'm Lori.

I'm an independent singer/songwriter & worship leader originally from northwest Ohio & am currently based out of Cleveland, OH.  Writing & performing music has been my consistent passion & love for over 15 years, & I can't imagine what life would look like without that God- given desire running through me.  I'm very excited about the new project I'm currently recording called, "Crooked Heart,"& I am inviting you to be a part of the project to help make it a reality so I can share these new songs with you!  

For more info on me and my music, visit www.loritriplett.com

What Your Contributions Go Towards

Being an independent artist means you pay for every single piece of the process out of pocket with no financial backing from a label or other band members, & that adds up fast!  I invite you to please consider helping to fund this new project in any way you can!   The support I receive will help cover the following expenses that go into professionally creating a project like this: Studio engineering & production, hiring studio musicians for instruments I am not playing, mixing, mastering, photography, videography, marketing, artwork, duplication, website, & distribution.  

Benefits for You!

When you get involved, you get to pre-order a copy of the CD at the sale price & you will have access to the completed project before it is released to the general public.  Be sure to check out the other perks I created for you too when you get involved in donating!

What are these songs about?

Click here to learn more about the inspiration behind the project and single "Crooked Heart"  If the link doesn't work for you, go to www.loritriplett.com and click on the "Crooked Heart" tab.

 

I want to get contribute, but I don't want to on this site.  Can I do it a different way?

Absolutely!  If that is your preference, please e-mail me directly at loritriplettmusic@gmail.com & I'm happy to accommodate how you'd like to contribute to the project instead!

 

I can't donate, but I still want to get involved!  What can I do?

Spread the word to your family, friends, & fellow music lovers on social media & by following me on Instagram & Facebook @loritriplettmusic.  Or maybe you have some other type of resource or talent you’d like to offer?   

Anything you'd like to offer is more than appreciated, so please don’t hesitate to get in touch with me if you are interested in helping a different way!  (loritriplettmusic@gmail.com )  Indiegogo also has some great sharing tools you can utilize!  If you prefer to drop something in the mail vs. giving online, please send me an e-mail to discuss & we can make that happen!

 

Risks & Challenges

There is a human element to every project, & so if a production delay, unforeseen road block, or any other halt in the process occurs for any reason, it will be communicated clearly & honestly with you as things progress!  I will modify my plans as needed if I don’t reach my funding goal for any reason.  For example, if I don't meet my goal, I'll record what I can with funds provided.

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP!

I continue to be so touched and grateful to those of you who have supported & encouraged me over the years & the new people who I support me that I continue to meet.  

Thank you for your consideration in supporting this new project! I hope to be able to share these new songs with you soon!  Please do not hesitate to e-mail me directly for any questions at all! 

Much Love,

Lori

www.loritriplett.com 

loritriplettmusic@gmail.com

story:
Vocalist and Composer, Lauren Henderson, prepares her next recording project under the production of Grammy-Nominated Producer and two-time Emmy Winning Jazz Broadcaster, Mark Ruffin.  Henderson's recording project will feature Sullivan Fortner, winner of the American Pianist Association Cole Porter Fellowship in Jazz.  

Ruffin and Henderson have set out to create a diverse yet cohesive and commanding album that features original music, jazz standards, Latin standards, and soulful covers of popular music.  

With your help, they hope to raise $20,000 to record an album that will feature some of the great musicians of our time.  In order to produce high quality art that will reach our audience and aficionados, it's imperative to properly compensate all who participate in the project.  Access to resources that can help us create a clear and captivating professional sound will provide a strong foundation for our project.  

In 2015 the René Marie album produced by Mark Ruffin was nominated for a Grammy.  Last week  it was announced in London that the Charenee Wade record, produced by Mark Ruffin, was nominated for the prestigious British 2016 Jazz FM Awards.  Help up make 2017 the year when it is announced that Lauren Henderson receives a nomination of prestige! 

Thank you in advance for supporting our goals and passion for música.  A contribution of any amount is greatly appreciated and aids in the advancement of young artists, as well as the distribution of their music.

story:
Shalom!

I am Cheri Weiss, a third-year Cantorial student at the Academy for Jewish Religion in Los Angeles and the Cantorial Intern and Choir Director at Congregation Beth El in La Jolla, California.  I have also had the honor of being a High Holy Days Cantor at Temple Emanu-El in Providence, Rhode Island for the past two years and look forward to serving that congregation this year as well.

I  am excited to tell you about my new musical project and am asking for your kind support in helping me complete it.  I am currently recording "Hineni," a compilation of High Holy Days melodies and prayers, at Studio West, a professional recording studio in San Diego.

I was inspired to record this album by my late father-in-law, Howard Weiss (of blessed memory), and others who expressed regret at being unable to attend High Holy Days services for various reasons.  After seeing how a recording I had previously made of the “Kol Nidre” prayer moved others who could not attend services on Erev Yom Kippur, I decided to record an entire album of High Holy Days prayers and melodies.  This would be my way of bringing the spirit and music of these holidays to homebound individuals as well as the many others who love these melodies.

One of my goals is to donate this CD to any individual or organization that wants it and is unable to afford it.  If you know of anyone who is in need and would appreciate receiving the CD at no charge, please let me know.

I am asking for your support of this "Mitzvah project" (a project that reflects the spirit of the commandments of the Torah) by donating to this crowdfunding campaign.  Your generous donations will help pay for recording the melodies, as well as producing and distributing the CD.

This crowd funding campaign and subsequent sales of the CD will help us all in fulfilling the Mitzvahs of “Tzedakah” (Charity) and “Chesed” (Acts of Lovingkindness).

By supporting this crowdfunding campaign, you will receive the various rewards shown on this page as well as my deepest gratitude for your help in making this Mitzvah project a reality.  All donors' names will be printed on the CD insert.

Guest artists will include Cantor Dr. Jonathan Friedmann on cello for "Kol Nidre," Dr. Yochanan Winston on flute for "Avinu Malkenu," Alicia Previn on violin for"Emet," Ruth Weber on vocals and piano for "Hashkivenu," and Diane Benaroya on piano for various prayers.

Please share this project with anyone you think may be interested!

If you prefer to contribute with a check rather than donate online, please contact me at Cheri@Hazzanit.com and I will send you my mailing address.

Thank you so very much for your kindness and generosity and for helping me bring Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur to those unable to attend services and who are too often forgotten.

Blessings,

Cheri Weiss

*Video created by Emma Sasson © 2016

story:
HELLO!

Hi my name is Christina Badra. I am from Levittown, New York and I love to sing. I've been an aspiring singer as long as I can remember. Growing up, I always loved performing for my family and friends and even having my cousins shoot music videos of me in my room. My family knew I was destined to sing and perform and they immediately saw that spark in me before I even did myself. When I finally grew confident that singing was something that I loved and wanted to do for the rest of my life, my parents reached out to producer Anthony Mouzon who then formed a great team of professionals to help support my dream. 
Together this team will help me fulfill my dream to record music, music videos, and perform of course! I am so entirely grateful for the opportunity that I've been given. My dream is to share my talent with the world! Please help me fulfill my dream!  All funds will go towards completion of my debut album

This is what we need & this is what you get!

We are looking to raise $42,000 in order to complete my debut album.  This includes: Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Project costs including studio time, production, songwriting, mixing, and mastering the album, vocal training, dance and choreography, artist development, and marketing and promotion.
  • All contributions of $15 or more receive a copy of the album but we have put together packages that include t-shirts, posters, autographed photos, DVDs, and exclusive invites to listening parties, music videos, shows, and even lunch with me!  
  • All funds will go towards finishing the album. We are looking to reach $42,000 but whatever we raise will contribute to making my debut album become a reality!

Your impact - Our project!

Your involvement is crucial.  All great artists start with a great grass-roots following. I want to build my following one person at a time.  Connections are important. My music isn't just music. It is a piece of me.  Something that I wish to share with the whole world. Everyone who contributes becomes a part of that and in essence, a part of me.  I am not making an album...WE ARE!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please spread the word!  Any amount helps. Please help make my dream a reality!

  • Make sure to visit my Facebook fan page:https://www.facebook.com/Christina-Badra-165762623763033
  • Share this page on your social media for your friends to see!

Thank you so much for your involvement!

story:
Short Summary

Inspector Gadje has been together for five years now, but  we’ve yet to make a album, instead, we've been focusing on delivering the best energy and music to our live performances.  Now we are bringing these two goals together – incredible energy and music on stage professionally recorded as a live album.  Our collaboration with Ismail has taken us to new heights - musically, creatively, culturally, and we just have to share it. 

What we're asking for

Typically Inspector Gadje is a home-grown and independent band.  We do all the music arranging, booking, and management on our own. But this is a heavyweight project and we’ll need your support to make this record.   We’ll have artist fees, recording fees, record production fees, and other costs outside of our usual budget.  Our community has supported us in so many ways – packing the concert halls, spreading the word and the buzz about the band, sharing sweet life celebrations such as wedding, and making so many great memories together. So we are inviting you into the making of this record. 

Join us in our biggest step yet!

story:
What's all this then?

Since 2009, The Fuzzy Bunny Cuddle Time Hour radio show has been filling the Internet and airwaves with its themed music show. And now, it's time to get Fuzzy and go BIG. So, we are striking out on our own and starting our own Internet radio station.

With your generous contributions, we will be able to complete our studio and continue bringing unique programming right to your Bunny ears.

You are making an investment that will yield huge dividends in a future of happy music experiences with Dirk, the Doctor and all our fuzzy friends!

How will your contributions be used?

We need to raise $2500 to purchase equipment to complete the studio, including
  • Microphones and stands
  • Cables
  • A production server
  • A signal processor
  • Internet service
  • Licensing fees for one year
We're offering several donation levels, with fuzzy perks and cuddly incentives, to fit every budget and entice you to be a part of this great project.

Even if we don't reach our full funding goal, all donations will help move the project forward and get us up and streaming asap.

What's to come.

With your help, upon the completion of this campaign, we will acquire the remaining equipment needed, hook up to the broadcast server, and begin sending out a stream from our very own internet radio station. It's a beautiful future and we hope you'll help us get there.

Get your SWAG!

To thank everyone for their tremendous support, we will host a very special THANK YOU party so you can meet your fellow community listeners and pick up your SWAG Bag. And when we say "Party," we mean it. There'll be food, drinks, music, dancing and more fun than you can shake your Bunny ears at.

If, for some horrible reason, you can't make it to the SWAG Bag Event, we'll mail your goodies right to your door.
story_txt:
What's all this then?
 Since 2009, The Fuzzy Bunny Cuddle Time Hour radio show has been filling the Internet and airwaves with its themed music show. And now, it's time to get Fuzzy and go BIG. So, we are striking out on our own and starting our own Internet radio station.
With your generous contributions, we will be able to complete our studio and continue bringing unique programming right to your Bunny ears. 
You are making an investment that will yield huge dividends in a future of happy music experiences with Dirk, the Doctor and all our fuzzy friends!
  How will your contributions be used?  We need to raise $2500 to purchase equipment to complete the studio, including
Microphones and stands

Cables 

A production server

A signal processor
Internet service 

Licensing fees for one year
We're offering several donation levels, with fuzzy perks and cuddly incentives, to fit every budget and entice you to be a part of this great project.
Even if we don't reach our full funding goal, all donations will help move the project forward and get us up and streaming asap.What's to come.

story:
Al cielo y sin escalas*

 - - - - See below for English version - - - - 

Comencé a tocar guitarra a los 9 años de edad y en mis planes nunca imaginé que tendría la oportunidad de grabar un CD. Hoy a mis 24 años de edad y después de muchos años de aprendizaje y experiencias, he podido comenzar este proyecto. 

Mi más grande sueño es poder compartir la música que he creado de una manera en que pueda llegar a muchas personas y que sea de bendición y salvación para todos los que la escuchen. Con tu ayuda podré culminar con éxito este proyecto y seguir trabajando para honra y gloria de nuestro Dios. 

*El título Al cielo y sin escalas no es definitivo.


Acerca del proyecto

Este álbum incluye 10 canciones inéditas con sus pistas correspondientes. Como músico y compositor me he esforzado para que sean canciones que eleven nuestro corazón y que nos ayuden a encontrar las fuerzas y la motivación que necesitamos día con día. 

Pero este proyecto no es solo mío. Gracias a un grupo de amigos es que este proyecto está sucediendo.

Le doy gracias a: 

Dios como fuerza mayor. | Enrique Quezada: campaña en Indiegogo | Nora Fuentes: diseño | Isaac Orozco & Ismir Muñoz: producción de pistas | Distinctive Audio: estudio de grabación | Erick Ruiz: percusiones y saxofón | Moises Inda: piano. 

Por medio de esta campaña y con tu apoyo esperamos juntar la cantidad de          $4, 300 USD para solventar la renta del estudio de grabación, la producción de pistas y las copias a reproducir.


Inversión

    Monto (dlls)

Estudio de Grabación 

    $1, 800

Pistas (Producción)

    $900

Diseño de CD

    $200

Maquila  (1000 CD’s)

    $1, 400

Total

   $4,300

Como equipo, buscamos hacer una total diferencia en cuanto a nuestra música. Queremos que sea música hecha de corazón que nos traslade hacia un mundo mejor para poder sentir siempre la presencia de nuestro Dios en nuestro diario vivir. 


Nuestras metas

Durante todos estos años hemos tenido la oportunidad de viajar a muchas partes de Mexico y Estados Unidos. Hemos podido compartir nuestra música con muchas personas y participado en congresos juveniles alabando el nombre de nuestro Dios.

Nuestro principal objetivo es alabar a Dios con nuestra vida y con nuestra música,  y que podamos llegar a más personas a conocer a Cristo Jesús y entregar su vida. 

Por esta razón, hemos decidido incluir pistas de las 10 canciones. De esta manera, las congregaciones y sus miembros podrán usar estas canciones inéditas en sus servicios de alabanza.

*Todas los apoyos arriba de los $7 USD incluyen una copia digital del álbum. Aquellos que contribuyan $50 USD o más pueden elegir entre recibir una nota o un video de agradecimiento.


Sé parte de este proyecto

Uno de nuestros principales retos es el llegar a todos los rincones del mundo, llevando nuestra música a todas las personas y entregando nuestros talentos y nuestras vidas a Dios día con día. 

Si puedes apoyar con $10, $5 o $1 dólar, te invitamos a hacerlo y te lo agradecemos mucho. Si no puedes ayudar económicamente, hay otras formas de apoyar este proyecto. Hayas donado o no, te invitamos a orar por nosotros para que nuestra música pueda cumplir su principal objetivo de llevar esperanza y alegría a muchos corazones y que por medio de este proyecto muchas personas puedan entregar su corazón a Cristo Jesus.

También puedes ayudarnos compartiendo el link de la campaña con tus amigos por medio de email o de redes sociales. 

¡Ayúdanos a proclamar que Cristo viene pronto y que necesitamos estar listos para su venida!


¡Visita las páginas oficiales de Guillermo Ximenez!

Souncloud

Facebook

Canal en Youtube

Twitter


Al cielo y sin escalas*

I began playing the guitar when I was 9, but I never imagined I'd have the opportunity to make a record. Now, at 24 I've decided it is time to do it. 

I want to share the music I've created in a way that can reach as many people as possible, and I hope this music can be a blessing for everyone who listens to it. Together, we can accomplish this and continue working for God's glory and honor.

*"Al cielo y sin escalas" is only a tentative title.


About this project

This album includes 10 songs with their respective minus-one tracks. As a musician and composer I have tried to write songs that elevate our hearts and help us find strength and motivation for each day. 

But this project is not only mine. Thanks to a group of friends this project can be what it is today.

Thanks to:

God | Enrique Quezada: Indiegogo campaign | Nora Fuentes: design | Isaac Orozco & Ismir Muñoz: backing tracks | Distinctive Audio: recording studio | Erick Ruiz: percussion and saxophone | Moises Inda: piano.

Through this campaign and with your support we hope to raise $4,300 USD to cover the costs of recording studio rental, backing tracks production and CD production.

Expense

    Cost (USD)

Recording studio 

    $1, 800

Backing tracks (production)

    $900

Album artwork

    $200

Production of 1,000 CDs

    $1, 400

Total

   $4,300

As a team, we seek to make a difference in regards to our music. We want it to be truthful in a way that can help us feel God's presence in our lives.


Our goals

Over the years we've had the chance to travel to many different places in Mexico and the United States. We've been able to share our music with many people and participate in youth conferences.

Our main goal is to praise God with our lives and music and to reach more people so they can know Jesus and surrender their lives.

This is why we have decide to include backing tracks, or minus-one tracks. Congregations and their members will be able to use the songs in this album in their worship services.


Be part of this project

One of our main challenges is reaching every corner of the world, taking our music to everyone and giving our talents and lives to God every day.

If you can support us with $10, $5 or $1, we invite you to do it and thank you for it. If you can support us financially, there are other ways in which you can help. Whether you donate or not, we invite you to pray for us so that our music can reach its main goal of giving hope and joy to many hearts and that through this project many can give their lives to Christ.

You can also help us by sharing our campaign's link with your friends through email and social media.

Help us proclaim that Christ is coming soon and that we need to be ready for his second coming!

*All donation above $7 include a digital download. Those who contribute $50 or more can choose between a "thank you" note or video.


Visit Guillermo Ximenez's official social media sites!

Souncloud

Facebook

Youtube channel

Twitter

story:
Greeting ladies and gentleman and welcome to my Indiegogo campaign to raise funds to record and produce my debut album Some Enchanted Evening which is really a snapshot of an era of Musical Theatre on Broadway featuring music which has made an impact on us until this very day.

The choice

Having enjoyed a varied career to date performing all kinds of repertoire, the choice for my first album was not easy. However, after months of consideration, contemplation and the all important market research with friends and family, I decided to record the songs from my new show Some Enchanted Evening so that I could represent myself in a genre that I have grown to love.

Forces

I am thrilled to announce that my pianist for the album will be Christopher Gould who actually played in the show itself. Christopher’s discography includes an English Song disc, The Water is Wide, with mezzo-soprano Diana Moore, and Who are these children?, a recording of Britten songs for BIS records with tenor Daniel Norman. His most recent CD of the Britten Canticles has just been released on Stone records.

The Songs

 Lonely Town                             On The Town                     Leonard Bernstein

Ole Man River                            Show Boat                        Jerome Kern

If I loved You                              Carousel                            Rodgers & Hammerstein

Soliloquy                                     Carousel                            Rodgers & Hammerstein

I Got Plenty O Nuttin               Porgy & Bess                  George Gershwin

Love Walked In                          The Goldwyn Follies     George Gershwin

Just Another Rhumba            Damsel in Distress         George Gershwin

This Nearly was Mine              South Pacific                   Rodgers & Hammerstein

Some Enchanted Evening     South Pacific                   Rodgers & Hammerstein

Joey, Joey, Joey                        The Most Happy Fella  Frank Loesser

Come Home                               Allegro                              Rodgers & Hammerstein

You'll Never Walk Alone         Carousel                          Rodgers & Hammerstein

The Impossible Dream           Man of  La Mancha       Mitch Leigh

How your money will be spent

Your kind support will enable me to record, produce, market and distribute this album properly. I'm keen to share my renditions of these classics with as wide an audience as possible and also feel privileged to be able to say I made it with the help of those who care and appreciate my singing.

So, thank you for your support in which ever way you can show it.

I'll keep you updated throughout the progress!

Have a little listen

Ole Man River https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xoOD-peWxK0

Risks and challenges

We will be recording throughout August 2015 with a release date planned for November 2015. This should cover any delays in the production of the album whilst also allowing plenty of time for the PR company to work its magic ahead of the album launch!

story:
Finally it's time to record my debut solo album!

I want to invite you to share this creative adventure with me, as I collaborate with some incredible musicians to produce this work of art.

I've been writing songs since I was a teenager, and now I'm ready to hit the studio, but I need your support to fund the recording costs. If you pre-buy the album, you will help me to cover the cost of musicians, technical support and studio fees and make this album a high quality opus of song!

There are lots of other exciting rewards available too and I really hope that you will come on board and share this musical journey with me!

What I need 

Recording an album professionally isn't cheap, and I need at least £12,000 to make this happen.

This will cover:

  • Recording studio fees of £175 per day with a professional sound technician. Each song will take several days to record and the estimated recording costs are £7500 in total.
  • This will also include the cost of editing, mixing and mastering, to create a really high quality product for you to enjoy. 
  • Musicians' fees will be £100 per day for recording and £50 per day for rehearsals. This will equate to at least £4500 in total for all the contributors to the album. 

I have colourful visions for these songs - they have been written just on the guitar, but I want to produce eclectic arrangements with lots of diverse instruments, such as hang, African kora, Irish low whistle, shakuhachi flute, piano, accordion, acoustic percussion and full string arrangements. 

The musicians I am privileged to know and will collaborate with on these songs are masters of their instruments, and their skill represents years of work. I want to pay them what they deserve, to reflect their true value as artists. 
And that's where you come in!

By supporting this campaign, you are supporting real, grass roots musicians, to help me create something really special.


What you get 

You can pre-buy the album in a digital or physical format, with the option of a personalised autograph. If you feel able to contribute a little more, you can be credited in the album sleeve as a supporter.

We will be throwing a party to celebrate the album launch! You can come along as an exclusive guest as another reward option.

Or there is an exciting opportunity to join us in the studio and sing backing vocals on one of my songs.

I am also offering to come to your home and run a private workshop or perform a private gig for you and your friends, or write you a personal song or four-part harmony composition.


All supporters contributing more than £10 will also receive a download of the album on MP3.


I am really hoping to reach my entire goal, but if I don't then I will still proceed with the project, just a lot more slowly and with a lower budget. I really want to do these songs justice though, and I am so grateful for any support you can give.




Other ways you can help

If you can't contribute financially, but would still like to support me on this mission, you still can!

Please use the IndieGoGo share tools to spread the word, on Facebook and Twitter, and by email, and traditional word of mouth!

Thank you so much for your support and encouragement. Keep an eye out for updates as the campaign progresses!

story:
LAATIKKO/BOX IS A PROJECT SEARCHING FOR COMMONALITIES: between immigrant stories across time and culture, and between the immigrant journey and our own journeys of change. Haven’t we all left one ‘home’ for another? The project has been and continues to be an internal and artistic journey for me - the assimilation into new sound, new ways of creation, new ways of feeling home - contemplation of the emotions of change: hope, fear, courage, resilience, surrender. It all began with a question: are my feelings similar to those of the immigrants whose stories I read? And if they are, there must be deeper threads of human emotion running through us all, regardless of time and culture. Can we find and acknowledge those threads? Can we look to commonality rather than difference?

Laatikko/Box began as a commission from the Cedar Cultural Center (Minneapolis) in 2014. In September 2014, Laatikko/Box toured the Arrowhead library system and is currently making its way around Minnesota, with support from the MN State Arts Board.

In 2016, I will make an audio recording of Laatikko/Box that melds original music and sound design, north-woods field recordings, interviews with recent immigrants to Minnesota, and the reading of Finnish-American archival material. This campaign is to fund recording, mixing, mastering and printing of the Laatikko/Box album.

If you support the campaign, the reward for your generosity is the recorded album! Different quantities for different donations. Give them to your friends, please! You will receive the Laatikko/Box album(s) by September 2016.

Thank you, I sincerely appreciate your support!
Sara
