It all began with a question: are my feelings similar to those of the immigrants whose stories I read? And if they are, there must be deeper threads of human emotion running through us all, regardless of time and culture. Can we find and acknowledge those threads? Can we look to commonality rather than difference?Laatikko/Box began as a commission from the Cedar Cultural Center (Minneapolis) in 2014. In September 2014, Laatikko/Box toured the Arrowhead library system and is currently making its way around Minnesota, with support from the MN State Arts Board.
In 2016, I will make an audio recording of Laatikko/Box that melds original music and sound design, north-woods field recordings, interviews with
recent immigrants to Minnesota, and the reading of Finnish-American archival
material. This campaign is to fund recording, mixing, mastering and printing of the Laatikko/Box album.
If you support the campaign, the reward for your generosity is the recorded album! Different quantities for different donations. Give them to your friends, please! You will receive the Laatikko/Box album(s) by September 2016.Thank you, I sincerely appreciate your support!Sara

story:
OUR STORY

Housed in a historic residence on New Orleans’ beautiful Esplanade Avenue, THE NEW QUORUM is an artist residency and cultural center designed to bring musicians from across the globe to New Orleans for creative exploration, collaboration with local musicians, workshops with local music students, and public performances for our community.

In addition, THE NEW QUORUM will hold free monthly Salons events in which local musicians, writers, artists, and people of all types can come together to exchange ideas and share their work in a public setting. The Salons will spotlight new music but also feature readings, workshops, conversations, and culinary events.

All activities at THE NEW QUORUM are designed to build community, better connect the people of New Orleans with visiting and local musicians, and to strengthen the cultural exchange that happens every day in our amazing city. Musical collaborations fostered by THE NEW QUORUM will expose local audiences to exciting new sounds while helping New Orleans musicians thrive in the place they call home. 

THE NEW QUORUM’s inaugural month-long artist residency will happen in January 2016. Selected after the completion of an open and competitive application process, five internationally acclaimed musicians (plus a renowned music journalist) will arrive at our facility to develop new works and collaborate with New Orleans musicians.

We have assembled a truly extraordinary, world-class group of artists who will find tremendous inspiration in life and music of our city, and help disseminate New Orleans unique culture across the globe. Here are THE NEW QUORUM’s January 2016 Artists in Residence:

- Wadada Leo Smith, the avant-garde jazz pioneer and Pulitzer Prize Finalist who has been a major force in modern music for more than 40 years

- Nicole Mitchell, composer and performer who has been named Top Jazz Flutist in the Downbeat Magazine Critics’ Poll and by the Jazz Journalist Association each year since 2010

- Lisa E. Harris, Texas-based composer and performer and a featured vocalist on Jason Moran’s 2014 Grammy-nominated album, All Rise: A Joyful Elegy for Fats Waller

- Damon Locks, Chicago-based composer, performer, and visual artist known for his work as a founder of groundbreaking bands including Trenchmouth and The Eternals

- Larry Blumenfeld, Jazz Critic for The Wall Street Journal and author of a work-in-progress book entitled The Fight for New Orleans Jazz Culture Since the Flood

THE NEW QUORUM is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that relies on direct support from arts-centered foundations and individuals who want to support and participate in the cultural life of New Orleans. We need your support to make THE NEW QUORUM a reality.


WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

Your generous donation will help us in the following areas:

- Acquisition of house instruments for use by visiting musicians

- Audio gear including a new PA system for use in free outdoor public performances

- Artist fees for local musicians participating in THE NEW QUORUM’s uniquely collaborative public performance program

- New Orleans-inspired culinary creations for our public Salon events

We’ve put together a variety of perks as a small token of our gratitude for your support of THE NEW QUORUM. As you can see from the perks listed on the right side of this page, the more you contribute, the greater your reward:

- $5 contributors will receive a heartfelt standing ovation at our first public Salon event!

- $10 contributors will receive your name and web link of your choice as part of our published thanks to you on THE NEW QUORUM website.

- $25 contributors will choose between an open-bar pass at THE NEW QUORUM evening event of your choice or handmade, limited-edition CD featuring THE NEW QUORUM-associated artists.

- $50 contributors will receive a package of a dozen Giannios — legendary cookies personally prepared by THE NEW QUORUM Executive Director and Founder Gianna Chachere, shipped to you anywhere in the United States.

- $100 contributors will receive the Louisiana Musicians Map, an original and limited edition work of art by Gene Tomko, printed on heavy stock and suitable for framing. 

- $250 contributors will receive a spot in a cooking class at THE NEW QUORUM in which Gianna Chachere will teach you how to make the perfect roux and her famous Gumbo Z’herbes.

- $1000 contributors will receive a weekend stay for two THE NEW QUORUM, including room and gourmet New Orleans-style meals created by Gianna Chachere. (10 available)

-$5000 contributors will receive a free one-hour house concert at a venue of our choice in the New Orleans area by an ensemble of New Orleans’ top musicians


IMPACT OF YOUR CONTRIBUTION

By supporting THE NEW QUORUM, you contribute directly to the cultural life of New Orleans.  While most artist residencies provide a tranquil and secluded environment, THE NEW QUORUM offers visiting musicians full immersion in our city’s unique culture. Local musicians benefit tremendously from THE NEW QUORUM’s residencies, as they discover musical inspiration, new creative collaborations, and enhanced career opportunities by participating in the program.

New Orleans musicians currently face a wide array of challenges, ranging from a global music industry that now undervalues and underpays artists to the accelerating gentrification in our city, all of which makes it difficult for musicians and artists of all types to survive. Given this reality, it’s imperative that New Orleans musicians seize every opportunity for personal and professional development.

THE NEW QUORUM has assumed an important role in providing that support. Executive Director and Founder Gianna Chachere has more than 20 years executive experience with non-profit organizations. Artists and other local non-profits are quickly coming on board to collaborate with us on fulfilling our mission. Your generous participation helps ensures the program’s success.

THE NEW QUORUM takes its name from The Quorum, the famous 1960s coffee house/artist collective (also located on Esplanade Avenue) that created a successful model for multicultural exchange. The Quorum became a frequent target of segregationist harassment in New Orleans after it opened to persons from all racial backgrounds in 1963. Many musicians, poets, and artists spent time at The Quorum including Ellis Marsalis and Jerry Jeff Walker, among many others.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

There are many ways to support the mission of THE NEW QUORUM. At present, we need volunteers to help staff our upcoming public events. Please visit newquorum.org for details on how you can directly support our mission and make a meaningful contribution to the arts and culture of New Orleans.

You can also help THE NEW QUORUM by spreading the word about our efforts to support music and the arts in New Orleans, and by sharing the link to this INDIEGOGO campaign. Thank you!

story:
The music is what really matters here. It speaks for itself and doesn't need me prattling on about it. Go listen now. Then come back and we'll talk.

http://soundcloud.com/signalmusicdg

The song creation process for me is like witnessing the magic of life unimpeded. Something takes me over and creates it all. My part in it is akin to the kid who claps is hands after a magician pulls a rabbit out of a hat. I never know what the end result is going to be, and I'm always only given the very next step. Once a song is completed I always end up thinking to myself "who created that? it wasn't me but there's no one else in the room!" I never have any idea where a song is headed, but it seems that the more my logical mind stays out of the equation, the better the end result becomes. When I get out of the way and release all attempts at control, the universe never disappoints.  I don't stop working on a song until it literally makes me jump out of my seat and dance around like a crazy person who just found out that it's everyone else who's crazy.

This music comes unfiltered from the magic of life and it is the greatest joy to experience that magic directly every time I sit down to work.

In terms of where i see all this headed, I will echo the words of Jonsi, lead singer of Sigur Ros, "I will change the way people listen to music forever. You don’t think i can? I can and I will."

This music is for you. The funds raised from this campaign will be used to make more of it. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Get the word out about this campaign using the IndieGoGo social share tools that are located on the top right next to the "back it" button. Even if you can't contribute, you can help move this project forward by making some noise about it.  Thank you!!

story:
Khu.éex’

Tlingit tribal member Preston Singletary, an internationally known glass sculptor, honed this sonic vision of collaboration with other major musicians including the legendary Bernie Worrell, Skerik, Stanton Moore, Captain Raab, and tribal members, Clarissa Rizal, Gene Tagaban and Nahaan.

Khu.éex’ (prounced koo-eex) translates to “Potlatch” in the Tlingit language, a Native tribal group from Southeast Alaska. Singletary thought of the name Khu.éex' because of the notion of sharing culture, stories, and music. This is the intent of the project, to present a contemporary interpretation of our culture and release our unique project, "The Wilderness Within",  on double vinyl.

Khu.éex' features spoken word, Native storytelling, and singing, performed with an experimental approach with rock/funk aspects. Our band also performs in traditional regalia and NW coast masks. 

Be part of this collaborative project by helping us release our debut album on double vinyl! Every gift matters, in any amount, to help us towards our goal of raising $25,000. Select your Perk at the right of this page.



Band Members Include:

Bernie Worrell – Keyboards - (Cherokee) A respected elder who has African American and Cherokee ancestry. He has played with countless musicians over the years, but most notably as the founding member of the legendary Parliament-Funkadelic. He has previously played with the Talking Heads and has released many solo records over the years.

Preston Singletary – Bass - (Tlingit) Singletary has become synonymous with the relationship between European glass blowing traditions and Northwest Native art. He is also involved with “A Little Big Band” a Native folk and soul band.

Captain Raab – Guitar - (Blackfoot) Raab has played in the band Red Earth, out of Albuquerque, which is a Native Funk rock band.

Clarissa Rizal –Vocals - (Tlingit) Rizal is a multi media artist and Chilkat/Ravenstail weaver who performs spoken word and sings traditional Native songs.  She has been essential in providing guidance in explaining the songs from a traditional context.

Gene Tagaban –Vocals - (Tlingit) Tagaban performs spoken word, traditional singing and storytelling, as well as playing flute. He is also an influential storyteller, trainer, speaker, mentor and performer within the community.

Skerik – Saxophone - An avant-garde sax player who plays in notable projects including Critters Buggin, Garage a Trois and NW supergroup Mad Season.

Stanton Moore – Drums - An accomplished drummer based out of New Orleans, and has played with a wide variety of musicians. Moore is also noted as the founding member of Galactic.

Nahaan –Vocals - (Tlingit) Nahaan is a Tlingit language teacher, Náakw Dancers leader, traditional Tlingit tattoo artist, and spoken word artist contributing his original songs and words to the Khu.éex’collective.

Randall Dunn - Producer, Audio Engineer - A highly respected producer who has worked with legendary jazz musicians such as John Zorn and Eyvind Kang, as well as working with on the upcoming Thurston Moore album. 



How Khu.éex' Began

Khu.éex’ began with a chance meeting between Bernie Worrell and Preston Singletary through a crowd-funding program where Bernie was raising funds for a tour bus. Preston invited Bernie to perform at his birthday party, where Preston sang Bernie a traditional Native song to welcome him. Bernie sat down with his keyboards and began improvising on the melody that was still lingering in the air. He created a spontaneous, psychedelic and soulful composition right on the spot.

The next day Bernie asked Preston’s band, “A Little Big Band” (a Native funk/soul band) to be the opening act for his show. After the concert Bernie shared with Preston that he had been thinking about his music, had several exciting ideas, and that they should record together. A union was formed.



What We've Done and What We Need

Two years, three recording sessions and three performances later there are four hours of music already recorded. Khu.éex’ has been working hard at Avast Studio in Seattle with the notable Randall Dunn (Engineer/Record Producer of the Cave Singers, Boris, Earth, and a founding member of Master Musicians of Bukkake) to create our unique collaborative music project.

After three inspirational recordings of basic tracks and several days of overdubbing, Khu.éex’ is asking for your vital help to release our album, "The Wilderness Within",   on double vinyl.

In addition to releasing "The Wilderness Within" Khu.éex’ will use funds raised for future production costs for continuing our music. We expect that once funded our album will have a turn around time of 3-5 months. 


Live Video of Khu.éex’


Ways You Can Help

Any amount helps us towards our goal of raising $25,000 to release our album and for future production costs. We're offering a wide variety of unique perks to our contributors. Be part of this amazing collaborative project today by choosing your contribution level, select your Perk listed on the right side of this page. Scroll down for images of Perks.

Unable to contribute financially? You can still help us! Share our story with your friends via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or email a personal note to your friends about us!  Use the share buttons on the upper left of this page. Sharing our story and campaign is a very valuable gift that we appreciate.



 

Thank You For Your Support!

                     Khu.éex’


PERKS: 


$30 - $45 Level: Khu.éex’ Album on Double Vinyl! Receive the debut release of "The Wilderness Within" on black double vinyl at the $30 Level or at the $45 level, receive the album on colored vinyl. Comes with a digital download of album. 


$25 Level: 
Signed CD from Skerik
, "Left For Dead in Seattle" featuring Reggie Watts on vocals and keys, and a variety of other Seattle musicians.


$30 Level: Bernie Worrell "WOO" T-Shirt, Purple design on light grey t-shirt. 
Front: 


Reverse:


$50 Level: Receive a two DVD set, "Creative Techniques for Keyboards: Building Grooves and Layering Sounds" featuring Bernie Worrell.


$100 Level: Unframed silkscreen on paper,  titled "Bear Cub" (with Tlingit translation on lower margin) , signed and numbered by the artist Preston Singletary, from an edition of 100, 11" x 30". 



$100 Level:  Unframed silkscreen on paper, titled "Octopus and Killer Whale" , signed and numbered by the artist Preston Singletary,  from an edition of 100, 15" x 19". 


$100 Level:  “An Ocean Runs Through Us” triptych by the artist Clarissa Rizal.  Signed and numbered, Limited Edition giclee print on canvas, unframed.   Approximate size 7”h x 18”w. Please expect 6-9 weeks for delivery. 

Photo courtesy of the artist.
 
$100 Level: Unframed giclée print on paper of Khu.éex’ band member Bernie Worrell playing music. Pencil signed and dated 2014 by noted Photographer Russell Johnson. Open edition.

Photo: Russell Johnson

SOLD OUT $300 Level: Pendleton Blanket, with the “Raven and the Box of Knowledge” Preston Singletary design, wool/cotton, 64" x 80".



$300 Level: “Moon Mask” by the artist Preston Singletary, cast and sand carved glass, artist signed, 3” x 3” x 1”, open edition. 

Photo: Russell Johnson

$400 Level: Receive one tattoo by local Seattle Tattoo Artist Nahaan, who specializes in “Traditional and contemporary northern style formline, basket patterns, chilkat patterns, done as commission drawings, paintings, tattoos, and prints.”  

Example Tattoo by Nahaan.

$750 Level: "Spirit Face” by the artist Preston Singletary, created in cast and sand carved glass and measuring 4.75" x 6.25” x 1”. Open edition and artist signed.

Photo: Russell Johnson


$3,000 Level: Option #1: Tlingit Berry Basket in Purple with Cedar Brown lip, blown and sand carved glass, signed by the artist Preston Singletary, 6" H x 5" W. 


SOLD $3,000 Level: Option #2: Tlingit Berry Basket in Twilight with Navy lip, by the artist Preston Singletary, 5.25" H x 5.75" W.


$3,000 Level: Option #3: Tlingit Berry Basket in Granite with Grey lip, blown and sand carved glass, signed by the artist Preston Singletary, 5" H x 5" W. 

Photo of glass Tlingit Baskets in granite and purple, each offered at the $3,000 level. 

$5,000 Level: “Killer Whale Totem” created by Preston Singletary in cast glass, and measuring 18" h x 6" w x 6" d, overall including base. Open Edition.



 Photo: Russell Johnson

$30 Level: Bernie Worrell "WOO" T-Shirt, Purple design on light grey t-shirt. 

Front: 



Reverse:


$50 Level: Receive a two DVD set, "Creative Techniques for Keyboards: Building Grooves and Layering Sounds" featuring Bernie Worrell.




$100 Level: Unframed silkscreen on paper,  titled "Bear Cub" (with Tlingit translation on lower margin) , signed and numbered by the artist Preston Singletary, from an edition of 100, 11" x 30". 


$100 Level:  Unframed silkscreen on paper, titled "Octopus and Killer Whale" , signed and numbered by the artist Preston Singletary,  from an edition of 100, 15" x 19". 

$100 Level:  “An Ocean Runs Through Us” triptych by the artist Clarissa Rizal.  Signed and numbered, Limited Edition giclee print on canvas, unframed.   Approximate size 7”h x 18”w. Please expect 6-9 weeks for delivery. 
Photo courtesy of the artist. $100 Level: Unframed giclée print on paper of Khu.éex’ band member Bernie Worrell playing music. Pencil signed and dated 2014 by noted Photographer Russell Johnson. Open edition.
Photo: Russell Johnson

SOLD OUT $300 Level: Pendleton Blanket, with the
“Raven and the Box of Knowledge” Preston Singletary design, wool/cotton, 64" x 80".




$300 Level: “Moon
Mask” by the artist Preston Singletary, cast and sand carved glass, artist signed, 3” x 3” x 1”, open edition. 

Photo: Russell Johnson
$400 Level: Receive one tattoo by local Seattle Tattoo Artist Nahaan, who specializes in “Traditional and contemporary northern style formline, basket patterns, chilkat patterns, done as commission drawings, paintings, tattoos, and prints.”  


Example Tattoo by Nahaan.

$750 Level: "Spirit
Face” by the artist Preston Singletary, created in cast and sand carved glass
and measuring 4.75" x 6.25” x 1”. Open edition and artist signed.

Photo: Russell Johnson

$3,000 Level: Option #1: Tlingit Berry Basket in Purple with Cedar Brown lip, blown and sand carved glass, signed by the artist Preston Singletary, 6" H x 5" W. 




SOLD $3,000 Level: Option #2: Tlingit Berry Basket in Twilight with Navy lip, by the artist Preston Singletary, 5.25" H x 5.75" W.




$3,000 Level: Option #3: Tlingit Berry Basket in Granite with Grey lip, blown and sand carved glass, signed by the artist Preston Singletary, 5" H x 5" W. 



Photo of glass Tlingit Baskets in granite and purple, each offered at the $3,000 level. 

$5,000 Level: “Killer
Whale Totem” created by Preston Singletary in cast glass, and measuring 18" h x 6" w x 6" d, overall including
base. Open Edition.







 Photo: Russell Johnson

story:
After over a decade of touring non-stop with the band Hot Buttered Rum, I am on to my next phase as an artist and have been recording in a studio in Petaluma, CA. I am so excited about this music and I feel I am in the perfect space to bring heart-centered music to a world in much need of light these days.

This recording is a combination of musical styles that I have integrated over the years. Sort of a folk-chamber-grass album with many composed sections and instruments one might not expect to hear such as flute and cello.  These instruments are played with people I work with in Sonoma where I teach a children's orchestra after school 5 days a week. 

I perform on multiple instruments (violin, mandolin, and guitar) and am joined by the amazing Sharon Gilchrist on bass and mandolin, David Thom on guitar, Eliot Peck on vocals, and other special guests have come up to come into the studio to add their magic.

All the songs but one were written in the two years since my son, Koya, was born.

"For My Boy" is full of songs from a father to his son. Any parent will relate to the messages contained which are meant to inspire and encourage a young soul who has just entered this big world.

All funders will be sent a signed CD upon completion regardless of amount contributed.

Original artwork by Alexa Redner who has made beautiful CD covers for me and Hot Buttered Rum.

100$ or more entitles contributor to a music lesson with Aaron.

House Concerts are available if they are within range of Sonoma County. Please contact Aaron to discuss any such idea and see the perks page for details.

After spending 13 years on the road with Hot Buttered Rum, I have enjoyed being home with my family and working on music that comes from the center of my heart. 

The music on this record will please any acoustic music lover and especially those with children. 

Thank you so much for your support!

Aaron Redner

story:
UPDATE!!  2 Days Left!!

We are just two days away from the end of the campaign! 
We would ask that you consider giving to this project.  Every bit helps!
If you give to this campaign, you will not only receive the perk you have chosen, but you will also receive a pre-released version of the song "Follow Me" from this EP!

Finally, we are a 501C3 Nonprofit organization and anything you contribute to this project can be written off your taxes for the year.

Thank you!

The Skinny

New Vine Media recently signed Steven Combs as an artist in 2015.  We were blown away by his great songwriting ability and also his natural talents in singing and playing guitar.  When Steven visited us, he had a slew of songs to show us, which we all loved.  What we have done is picked the 5 best songs and we want to record and release them for you to enjoy!

Here’s where we need your help!

We need $5,000 in order to successfully produce and record this EP. 

Why $5,000??

Well, we have an awesome opportunity to bring in a friend and producer in Evan Seiling.  Evan has been stationed in Nashville for the past few years and has become an excellent producer and engineer.

 When we at New Vine first started talking about making this project a reality, we immediately thought of Evan and what he could bring to the table as a producer and engineer. Some of the money will be devoted to travel expenses to get Evan here, and to also pay for his time with us. 

The rest of the money will go to providing perks for givers and also providing for any production costs we encounter. 

Make sure to check out all the perks to your right!

Help the Homeless 

Here’s the other thing we’re excited to share with you.  We have recently partnered with Second Wind Cottages and the Rescue Mission here in downtown Ithaca.  What that means is that when you give towards our projects, 15% of the funds will be donated to both Second Wind Cottages and the Rescue Mission to help these organizations provide shelter and rehabilitation for the homeless here in Ithaca.

To learn more about Second Wind, click here.

The Impact

We are ecstatic to have such a dynamic artist here with us at New Vine, and we want to do everything we can to create an excellent 5 song EP for Steven. 

You can help us do that!

By giving, you are not only providing money for an EP to be made, but more importantly, providing a creative outlet for Steven.  Steven is not only a great artist, but a great person.  We’ve had many conversations with him and we love his kindness and compassion towards everyone that he comes into contact with.  In helping us to create this, you are helping to enable the spreading of the gospel through Stevens music!

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing is caring!  Any way that you can get the word out about this campaign and helping to create an opportunity for Steven is absolutely appreciated!

Feel free to use the share tools through IndieGoGo in order to help spread the word!

story:
First things first:

Are you here looking for album release party info? 

Counting down until Interfaced releases in my "hometahn."
Wednesday 11/23!  Click here for passes or get them as part of a perk level.

Hey IndieGogo!

I'm Mike Why:  A beatboxin', singin', live-loopin' one mouth music maker from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA.  Thanks for stopping through!  You can scroll towards the bottom to find out more about me, but let's get to all this "one mouth record", "one dollar", and "putting your face on my record" business.

I made a record with my mouth:
Here's Interfaced.

Gotta get a little creative when your only instrument is above the neck.

Interfaced is my first full-length album (the follow-up to my debut 2014 EP Run My Mouth), and every track you can hear playing is made with my voice.

There's a slew of lead and backing vocals sung over more singing -- only this singing sounds like bass, drums, electronica, guitars, harmonica, horns, strings, and any other funny sound I could think of (wind, rain, some kind of Peter Frampton-y thing, some other stuff).

The end result: a pop/rock-style album fused (Interfaced, if you will?) with elements from a dozen or two other styles and genres of music...  Adult contemporary, cafe jazz, classical, disco, dreampop, 80's/90's hip-hop, Latin, R&B, you name it.


Interfaced is now ready for release!

All it needs is your face on the cover (see below), and a dollar (see right here).

One Mouth Music.  One Album.  One Dollar:
Let Me Hook You Up.

If you like what One Mouth Music is about, I'd certainly appreciate your support.  But I also want to leave room in your pocket to buy other people's music that you like,  Or feed your kids.  Or pay your bills.  So pay what you think the album is worth -- or if money's tight, what you can afford -- and share the link with your friends, repost/tag, or invite them to the page when you're done.  In the end, you could get quite a lot for your contribution of $1 or more towards Interfaced.

(1)  When you contribute US$1, you get your choice of song:  original or cover, English or en Español, from the album or from the EP.  You pick.

(2)  When this campaign hits its goal of $15,000, all contributors receive the group perks (see below):  Every contributor receives a digital album in 2016 (spoiler alert: the record won't be on the Internet until next year, because I still need your face on the cover... keep reading!), and backers at higher levels get additional perks.

(3)  If this campaign doubles its goal and reaches $30,000, my 2018 album (since the writing is nearly finished) will be released in 2017, and all contributors will receive a digital copy of that also.

So.  One dollar, up to two albums.  Not bad.  There's some great perks at higher levels of course, but if you're just here looking to put something a little different in your music mix, you can make that happen with a buck and a share.

You can do a lot more than put your money into Interfaced, though:
You can put your face on it.

Pre-order through IndieGogo:
Put your face on INTERFACED.

If you like, you can pre-order a guaranteed digital copy in advance here on IndieGogo: you will receive it in 2016, and your face will go on the album art!

How is that possible?  Well, the album art (which will likely look something like the temporary art you see on the record) will be a mosaic of nearly 1000 faces, including my family, friends, and every single person who purchases a copy in advance (as available here, check out the $16 level and above).

Facial mosaics have been done many times (although as far as I know, never in this way).  I'd say Bob Marley's are the most well known, so here's an example you might have seen.

Take a close look:

This is what the album cover might look like.  You know.  If I was Bob Marley.
For the record:  I am not Bob Marley.

Get the "hard copy" for the release:
The INTERFACED Album Playlist custom USB.

Wait.  I thought this was an album release!  That's not a CD...

It's 2016: my version of the "CD" is a custom USB drive with nearly 30 different tracks on it and bonus media.  Oh, and you'll also have a brand-new USB drive as soon as you put the music wherever it goes!  (That little ring glows when you plug it in, too, and looks super dope.  Just saying: Shiny.)


And an Unreleased Bonus EP:

When you get the album here, you'll also receive a special unreleased bonus EP not available on the iTunes (or more importantly, perhaps, Spotify) release: the world's first all-vocal stadium anthem, Black & Gold Army / 7 Nation Army featuring Jordan York:

It comes with five "stadium cuts" you can throw in your tailgate mix.
No need for thanks:  It's my pleasure to bring some Black & Gold into your life.
Just sayin'.
 

More perks:

More perks include passes or access to live & online release events (including VIP perks at those events), the beatbox/live looping coaching & workshops that I've performed all over the country (again, live or online), and the opportunity to be part of my 2017 national or international touring calendar at special rates.  You can even name a song and I'll make a track or video out of it (have fun with that one).  Feel free to let your arts outreach, music, or event organization know to take advantage of the special rates!


Dates you should know:

You'll see links become active as more information is publicly available.

Halfway point:  Wednesday, November 23 (7-10pm ET), Pittsburgh, PA --
"Thanksgiving Eve" Live Album Release show featuring very special guest, Canada's Jean-Paul de Roover.  See $64 perk for details.

Night before this campaign ends:
Thursday, December 22 (around 9pm ET), Worldwide --
"Festivus Eve" Live Online Release Show.  See $64 perk for details.

Campaign Ends: Friday, December 23 (11:59pm PST).

More about me, ABC:
A Cappella... Beatbox... And, uh... Live Looping?

Yeah.  It would rock if that one started with a C -- C, as in "Can't Always Get What You Want", I guess.  I use live looping to mix mouthdrumming & other vocal percussion sounds (commonly referred to as "beatbox") with lead and backing vocals and vocal instruments (the elements of contemporary a cappella music).

By way of comparison / closer look, here are a couple live/one-take versions of the song from the video:


intro/promo from web TV show one-take (1 min)


live performance clip (6 min)


The Interfaced Album: Technical & Artistic

My debut EP, Run My Mouth, was released to positive reviews because I was lucky enough to work with some people who, simply put, are regarded in their circles as being among the best at what they do.  I certainly think so.  Maybe you can't catch lightning in a bottle twice, but I'm sure going to try.

Recording, Editing, Mixing, Production:  Andrew Lefkowits for Lefkowits Audio, Denver, CO:  Calling Andrew a "secret weapon" sells him short, since he's no secret to the world of vocal audio, having handled live and studio audio and video production for almost exclusively all-vocal acts his entire career around the world.  His client list includes two-time Grammy winner Pentatonix, Naturally 7 (opener for Michael Buble's last 3 international tours), Manhattan Transfer, and many more recognizable names in vocal music.

Mastering:  Dave Sperandio for Vocal Mastering, Durham, NC:  Simply put, if you are a fan of a cappella music, you know "Dio" and what he does as an engineer.  If you don't know a cappella music but you were listening to the radio one day and were surprised to find out it was an a cappella group singing on the record, there's a good chance that Dave mastered the record.

Graphic Design:  Stephen Russell, Pittsburgh, PA:  Stephen is chief designer in charge of being patient with my way-too-creative ideas when it comes to incorporating audiences into the design of my records.  He handled the "Sign My CD" effort for the Run My Mouth EP with really great ease from top to bottom, and amazed me with his willingness and ability to navigate this massive project.  Special thanks to Sarah Doege Photography (Madison, WI) and Tyler Kotovsky at TK Graphic Design (Los Angeles, CA) for the photo images & design used here.


The Interfaced Album: Guest Artists

These folks are insanely talented.  Be sure to check them out.

Alma (co-arranger, lead and backing vocals, "Royals" orig. Lorde), Los Angeles, CA:  I really don't have enough words for what I think of this talented young woman as a musician or a person -- she is smart, focused, and knows exactly the kind of music she wants to make.  In a true "never say never" moment, I had sworn that I would never record my arrangement of Royals until this happy accident when I was visiting Los Angeles.  Special thanks to <X> for handling her tracking.

Joanna Lowe (co-writer and spoken word, "Des Objets Perdu / Wandering Stars" orig. Joanna Lowe & Portishead), Pittsburgh, PA:  The best thing I ever heard said about Joanna Lowe is: "I don't really know what her thing is, but she's really good at doing her thing."  Well said.  Joanna is a force in local arts: a producer, director, writer, and performer.  Special thanks to Anthony Mele for handling Joanna's tracking.

Jordan York (co-writer, lead, and hype vocals: "Black & Gold Army / 7 Nation Army" bonus track), Pittsburgh, PA:  King of all things Pittsburgh hip-hop, Jordan is the two-time Pittsburgh Pop Artist of the Year and is best known for his "Pittsburgh Living" album.  "The Pittsburgh Song" has broken 100K views on YouTube.  His music is fun, and I share his love for our "hometahn".  Special thanks to John Frazier at McKees rocks productions for handling Jordan's tracking.


The Interfaced Album:
Production & Project Management

Interfaced wouldn't have been possible without the ongoing support and problem-solving abilities of my producers -- anyone can have and spend money: simply put, these two guys are among the smartest and most rational human beings I know.  Their personal successes are hard evidence of this -- the only evidence I can offer to the contrary is that they're now record producers. :)

Jeff Nichols.  Jeff hails from Portland, has an undergraduate degree from the University of Washington and holds a PhD in Human-Computer Interaction from Carnegie Mellon University.  That's the kind of thing that gets you employed by IBM, where he has been, and also Google, so he currently is.   A Portland native, Jeff lives in San Diego with his wife Naomi (who seems to like me fine) and dog Cookie (wish I could say the same).  One of the most well-versed cocktail advocates I know, he and his wife just published a very straightforward and easy-to-use cocktail book (which I highly recommend).

Dan Vogel.  A Boston native, Dan is a graduate of the Computer Science program from Carnegie Mellon University.  Previously employed by Amazon, Dan is now in the Oracle Cloud; he has managed side careers out of most of his life interests, particularly Ultimate frisbee: he publishes a magazine called Skyd and is the majority owner of a professional team in Washington, DC.  Dan lives near Seattle with his wife Tessa and two small and very energetic children.

 

You made it this far?  You rock.  Thanks so much for reading, and for taking a moment to "Get INTERFACED."  Look forward to seeing you in person someday soon, Internet Traveler!

Sincerely,
Mike Why
OneMouthMusic.com

The Interfaced Album: Technical & Artistic
My debut EP, Run My Mouth, was released to positive reviews because I was lucky enough to work with some people who, simply put, are regarded in their circles as being among the best at what they do.  I certainly think so.  Maybe you can't catch lightning in a bottle twice, but I'm sure going to try.Recording, Editing, Mixing, Production:  Andrew Lefkowits for Lefkowits Audio, Denver, CO:  Calling Andrew a "secret weapon" sells him short, since he's no secret to the world of vocal audio, having handled live and studio audio and video production for almost exclusively all-vocal acts his entire career around the world.  His client list includes two-time Grammy winner Pentatonix, Naturally 7 (opener for Michael Buble's last 3 international tours), Manhattan Transfer, and many more recognizable names in vocal music.Mastering:  Dave Sperandio for Vocal Mastering, Durham, NC:  Simply put, if you are a fan of a cappella music, you know "Dio" and what he does as an engineer.  If you don't know a cappella music but you were listening to the radio one day and were surprised to find out it was an a cappella group singing on the record, there's a good chance that Dave mastered the record.Graphic Design:  Stephen Russell, Pittsburgh, PA:  Stephen is chief designer in charge of being patient with my way-too-creative ideas when it comes to incorporating audiences into the design of my records.  He handled the "Sign My CD" effort for the Run My Mouth EP with really great ease from top to bottom, and amazed me with his willingness and ability to navigate this massive project.  Special thanks to Sarah Doege Photography (Madison, WI) and Tyler Kotovsky at TK Graphic Design (Los Angeles, CA) for the photo images & design used here.
The Interfaced Album: Guest Artists
These folks are insanely talented.  Be sure to check them out.Alma (co-arranger, lead and backing vocals, "Royals" orig. Lorde), Los Angeles, CA:  I really don't have enough words for what I think of this talented young woman as a musician or a person -- she is smart, focused, and knows exactly the kind of music she wants to make.  In a true "never say never" moment, I had sworn that I would never record my arrangement of Royals until this happy accident when I was visiting Los Angeles.  Special thanks to <X> for handling her tracking.Joanna Lowe (co-writer and spoken word, "Des Objets Perdu / Wandering Stars" orig. Joanna Lowe & Portishead), Pittsburgh, PA:  The best thing I ever heard said about Joanna Lowe is: "I don't really know what her thing is, but she's really good at doing her thing."  Well said.  Joanna is a force in local arts: a producer, director, writer, and performer.  Special thanks to Anthony Mele for handling Joanna's tracking.Jordan York (co-writer, lead, and hype vocals: "Black & Gold Army / 7 Nation Army" bonus track), Pittsburgh, PA:  King of all things Pittsburgh hip-hop, Jordan is the two-time Pittsburgh Pop Artist of the Year and is best known for his "Pittsburgh Living" album.  "The Pittsburgh Song" has broken 100K views on YouTube.  His music is fun, and I share his love for our "hometahn".  Special thanks to John Frazier at McKees rocks productions for handling Jordan's tracking.
The Interfaced Album:Production & Project ManagementInterfaced wouldn't have been possible without the ongoing support and problem-solving abilities of my producers -- anyone can have and spend money: simply put, these two guys are among the smartest and most rational human beings I know.  Their personal successes are hard evidence of this -- the only evidence I can offer to the contrary is that they're now record producers. :)Jeff Nichols.  Jeff hails from Portland, has an undergraduate degree from the University of Washington and holds a PhD in Human-Computer Interaction from Carnegie Mellon University.  That's the kind of thing that gets you employed by IBM, where he has been, and also Google, so he currently is.   A Portland native, Jeff lives in San Diego with his wife Naomi (who seems to like me fine) and dog Cookie (wish I could say the same).  One of the most well-versed cocktail advocates I know, he and his wife just published a very straightforward and easy-to-use cocktail book (which I highly recommend).Dan Vogel.  A Boston native, Dan is a graduate of the Computer Science program from Carnegie Mellon University.  Previously employed by Amazon, Dan is now in the Oracle Cloud; he has managed side careers out of most of his life interests, particularly Ultimate frisbee: he publishes a magazine called Skyd and is the majority owner of a professional team in Washington, DC.  Dan lives near Seattle with his wife Tessa and two small and very energetic children. You made it this far?  You rock.  Thanks so much for reading, and for taking a moment to "Get INTERFACED."  Look forward to seeing you in person someday soon, Internet Traveler!Sincerely,Mike WhyOneMouthMusic.com

story:
Great question! But first a little story. Black Masala came to fruition a little over 3 years ago in the basement of a row house in the groovy neighborhood of Bloomingdale in Washington, DC. Our first show in Columbia Heights was a smashing success and we knew then we might be on to something! We've seen several members come and go, but true to our passion and restless spirit, we've been able to log 200 plus shows over the last 3 years and record and release our own first record. With no plan of stopping, we CALL ON YOU to help us continue our success by helping us fund the recording of a new 3 Year Anniversary Album. It's the 3 Year Anniversary of the band this year. Let's celebrate and make an album.


We are Washington, D.C.'s own 8-piece Gypsy/ Brass/ Funk/ Rock Music inspired Brass Band, and winner of two Washington Area Music "WAMMIE" Awards for "Best New Artist" and "Best World Album of the Year." Members of the band include:

  • Mike Ounallah – Vocals, Drums, Percussion
  • Kristen Long – Vocals, Percussion
  • Monty Montgomery – Sousaphone, Vocals, Percussion
  • Yannick LePage – Accordion
  • Kirsten Warfield – Trombone
  • Steven Cunningham – Trumpet
  • Duff Davis – Electric Guitar
  • Tomas Drgon – Guitar, Vocals, Percussion
  • Matt Hotez - Trombone (Emeritus)

This campaign will help us to raise $5,000 towards the making of a brand new album being recorded in May 2015. We have many of the songs written already, and we feel like we will be putting out some of our strongest work to date.

Your contributions to this campaign will support: Recording, Mixing, and Mastering costs. Publicity and PR Representation. Tour Support. Remixes (Oh yeah!). Special guests... (It's a surprise). A New Tuba (Just Kidding! -- Monty plays Sousaphone). And a host of other costs that come into play when making a new album especially one with....count 'em.... 8 PEOPLE!!!! IF WE SURPASS OUR GOAL ALL MONEY WILL GO TOWARDS A MUSIC VIDEO AND PR CAMPAIGN

Here are some of the campaign perks and incentives that you can get in return for your donation:

  • Album / T-Shirt / Hoodie Bundles
  • Singing Telegrams (How cool is that?!)
  • Skype or in-person lessons with the band member of your choice
  • Studio Invites to sit-in on the recording of Black Masala's new album
  • Custom Artwork and Clothing
  • VIP Passes to a live show of your choice
  • Live Performance/Party and Educational Clinics Packages

Outside of the usual cost of recording an album, the funding for this campaign will help this DC band put out their second album and keep spreading the music around the country and worldwide. Independent artists thrive from support by music lovers and fans.

Your contribution to this campaign now only gets you personalized goodies from the band, but will also help us obtain the essential funding needed to record and produce our new album in May 2015. We will also be touring after the release of the new album, so any extra funds will go towards publicity and travel costs.

THE MUSIC:

We will be recording an 8 song Album that we will adoringly call "I Love You Madly". It is a snapshot into the diversity of our music. It will feature different singers, a variety of horns, and a number of special guests who reside in the DC Area. We'll also be flying in our good friend who resided in LA to record this follow up album. (He recorded the first one you can hear on our Soundcloud page)

There are other means and ways for you to support our campaign, including: 
  • Head to our Website and Make a Donation NOW!: Black Masala Website.
  • Share this Campaign on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Use any of the Indie-Gogo Tools to share and like what we're doing.
  • Support Us Live! Come to a Black Masala Show and show your support for our new record and hear some of the new music as it comes to life.
  • Make a $1 donation. 

Follow Black Masala:

Facebook: www.facebook.com/BlackMasala

Event: www.facebook.com/events/373818776145921

Twitter: twitter.com/BlackMasalaBand

Website: www.blackmasala.com

Instagram: instagram.com/blackmasala

And that's all there is to it!  Thanks so much for your support!

story:
About Us

Guitarist, singer, songwriter and composer Dan Beck has been writing and performing original music for over 40 years. His music is a combination of Blues & Jazz, with a bit of rock, Latin, and classical thrown in - a genre he calls Blue Jazz.  In the past he appeared as a solo musician, both vocal and instrumental, playing guitar with a unique finger picking style learned from his early classical training. Here is what Dan Beck has to say about his band:

  • I moved to California from the east coast over 15 years ago and didn't know any local musicians.  When I met Robert Rosett at a downtown restaurant, we started jamming together and performing publicly as a duo. Often his son, Ben (founder and drummer in the Strawberry Girls) would sit in on percussion - it was inspiring to play with other musicians again!  I also met an amazing bass player and all around excellent human being, the late Stephanie  R. Woehrmann, who became my friend and co-conspirator.
  • As a volunteer at the Downtown Salinas Visitor Center, I met the band's drummer, Dave Prentice, as well as our violinist, Tyler Reilly. Both serendipitous encounters when they heard me playing guitar and walked in to see who it was. We started jamming together and suddenly we had a full band. After Stephanie passed away in early 2016, Pablo Nuñez, a longtime family friend joined in as the band's bass player.
  • In the past I've always recorded at my home studio using vintage reel to reel equipment because I love the rich analog sound.  I've produced four CDs as a solo artist in this manner. With your help, I, and my band will be able to achieve a special dream: a vinyl album - I'm sure the first of many! - in addition to compact discs and digital downloads on iTunes and Amazon.

In 2016, the Dan Beck Band went into the studio to record an album, "All The Fish Are Hoppin'". They chose The Real to Reel Studio in Sand City, California because the owner, Gary Sousa, uses analog tape to record on, providing that rich, big sound that vinyl is popular for.  The band now has the material professionally recorded and mastered - ready for the next step, burning and pressing.

What We Need & What You Get

This is what we are asking for:

  • We need funding to produce 1000 Compact Disc & 500 Vinyl albums.
  • Our perks are so cool! CD, Vinyl, Collectable Limited Addition Poster, Band T-Shirt, Reusable Water Bottle, VIP Admission to the Album Release Party, and even a LIVE PERFORMANCE at your party or event!
  • If our goal is not completely realized, we will still produce CDs, posters, t-shirts, etc. as well as hold the release party on March 31st, 2017.  And the vinyl will come later.

The Impact

We want you to know the difference your contribution will make:

  • We know our music is great and this project is valuable to you, the contributor, and to the world by enabling us to share our awesome music on vinyl, continuing the audiophile tradition of many great music artists.
  • As a solo artist, Dan Beck has produced and released six and a half (an EP) CDs.
  • With the Dan Beck Band, he has released a limited edition EP compact disc and recorded many songs currently available as digital downloads on iTunes and Amazon. The culmination of this project, a vinyl album, is the epitome of the recording process.

Risks & Challenges

We have the music ready to go and we have done the research for the best value and quality of the project.  It is on a short timeline and there will not be a wait for perks.

  • The biggest (and only) hurdle we need to overcome is funding to press & burn All the Fish Are Hoppin'.
  • Our plan for solving this challenge was to launch our crowd funding 'Pre-Sale' campaign on IndieGoGo.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't assist the cause:

  • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our album.
  • Share on your Facebook timeline, send a Tweet, give us a shout out on Instagram, and please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you all in advance for helping the Dan Beck Band to realize our dream!

story:
Summary

Hello! My name is Eunbi Kim, and I'm a professional pianist based in New York City. I've previously created, produced, performed/toured in a music-theatre piece inspired by author Haruki Murakami in Murakami Music. I've also commissioned eminent composer Daniel Bernard Roumain to write a new work for solo piano and pre-recorded voices which I've performed in solo recitals at venues from the Kennedy Center (DC), le poisson rouge (NYC), PianoForte Foundation (Chicago), and more (listen here). I love to create and perform interesting projects around new ways of listening to concert music, and I hold an especially keen interest in new/contemporary works for piano. 

Most recently, I've been working on recording my solo debut album of contemporary classical works by legendary 10-time GRAMMY-nominated  jazz pianist and recipient of a Guggenheim Fellowship in Composition Fred Hersch. Fred is widely known for his monumental work as a pianist, composer, improviser, bandleader, and educator in the world of jazz. But he's also written contemporary "classical" works which pay homage to Hersch's other influences- of classical composers from Bach to Scriabin to Debussy (and more!) to rhythms and sounds of Brazilian folk music and the Argentinian tango.

Fred Hersch is an incredible artist and human being. I'm incredibly lucky to have this opportunity. ​You can read about his tremendous musical feats and inspirational life story as a long-term HIVAIDS survivor in this wonderful New York Times feature here.

What We Need & What You Get

10K sounds like a lot of money (and it is). Making a CD is expensive. 

Where does all the money go? Great question.

  • Post-Production Costs- $4,500
    • manufacturing, licensing, distribution, etc.
  • Three Recording Sessions at Oktaven Audio (NY)- $3,500
    • studio time & space, editing, mixing & mastering, etc.
  • Artwork & Design- $1,200
  • Miscellaneous Costs- $800 (at least!)
    • hiring musician(s), video documentation, promotional needs, etc. 

We're offering awesome perks for your contributions.

  • Private concert at Fred Hersch's Soho loft 
  • Limited Edition signed CD's by Fred
  • VIP Tickets to future CD release concerts
  • House Concert & Wine Night hosted by Eunbi
  • Artist Coffee Dates, special mentions in the CD liner notes, and more! 

The Impact

Since this album consists of (mostly) premiere recordings, meaning they've never been recorded before, your contributions help make a part of history! This album serves to further cement the legacy of Fred's important work and contributions in concert music of today. 

List of works to be recorded-

  • Variations on a Theme by Tchaikovsky*
  • Three Character Studies
  • Valentine*
  • Tango Bittersweet for piano and violin*
  • Little Midnight Nocturne*

*- denotes premiere recording

Risks & Challenges

The great news is that Albany Records has already agreed to release the album. The challenge is that projects can take a longer time than expected for a variety of reasons from scheduling and logistical issues to wanting the highest quality for something that remains a permanent physical object. There have been bumps along the road so far but I will truly not stop until I get this CD into the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute right now? There are other ways to support this project. Please feel free to share this campaign on your social media page(s) by using the share tools below. Thanks for your interest and support!

story:
Hello, I’m Malbert Lee and I’m very excited to be making my first instrumental music album. It’s all about relaxation and sound vibration, helping people to be calm and equanimous via the sound of the crystal singing bowl. 

In the past few years I have been going on a journey of yoga, mindfulness, sound healing and have discovered how we are all connected in some ways as well as to the universe. I have always been passionate about music and am amazed at how powerful a medium it is in helping people to boost their emotion and energy.

The singing bowl has a long history of being used for meditation, music, relaxation and personal well-being such as yoga, music therapy and sound healing. With the use of modern technology the crystal singing bowl was created with the aim of achieving similar benefits for people. It has since defined tunes by producing pure, rich and heavenly sounds that help people to unwind and feel rejuvenated. This is the reason I am making this album. With a set of crystal singing bowls I hope to create harmonious music that will resonate with everyone.

After attending a couple of sound healing workshops and personally experiencing the benefit of crystal bowl music, I have decided to create an instrumental album through this medium. The sound is heavenly - very calming and relaxing, perfect for meditation and in the yoga class.

As most of us live such highly stressful lives, I want to help people find inner peace by balancing their energy and connect to themselves again. I hope to raise enough money so that I can get the right equipment for the production. The equipment includes a set of clear crystal singing bowls, recording studio equipment and, perhaps, adding the crystal harp if extra funding is raised.

The album will have over an hour of pure instrumental music, including a section that will help balance the seven chakra body energy points. Animal can also enjoy the music too as their ears are very sensitive to sound vibration and my cat loves it when I play crystal music. It will be released this year and will also incorporate an audio guided meditation as bonus track. I will make another album next year and it will be available for everyone who support my project here in Indiegogo for free in digital form.

With your help I am confident we can make this happen! Thank you for your support.

Malbert Lee

I will make another album next year and it will be available for everyone who support my project here in Indiegogo for free in digital form.With your help I am confident we can make this happen! Thank you for your support.Malbert Lee

story:
The Ale House String Band Presents: "Chasing Gold"

Hello Ale-Housians! It has been 4 years since the release of our debut album "Affairs of Common Living," a live-recorded session album of Traditional songs. The recording/mixing/mastering/printing of that project was completely funded by our fans, and we are back to ask for your assistance once more! 

Who we are:

Brian Dunn, vocal/mandolin/mandola

April Reed-Cox, vocal/cello

Oren Robinson, vocal/guitar/dulcimer

 

We are striking out on a new road as a band, and have written and recorded an entire album's worth of brand new songs! We created a small home recording studio in Oren and April's basement and have spent the last 4 months  recording and editing our songs. We had initially planned on mixing our album as well, thus creating an entirely self-produced CD, but a string of winter colds and some very meaningful (but time consuming) projects made this goal less and less viable as the weeks went on.

Due to these setbacks we have hired our friend Jud Caswell of Frog Hollow Studio, who recorded/mixed/mastered our last album, to take on the task of mixing and mastering our new album. We received his first mixes on March 30th and they sound AMAZING!

In addition, we are partnering with Jud to record our live show on April 15th, 2017, at Johnson Hall in Gardiner, Maine. Our goal is to capture a live studio recording of our four newest songs, with an interactive audience, so that we can add them to the 10 tracks that are already recorded.

We hope that you will consider donating to our project!

 

The Breakdown:

Our minimum goal is to raise $2,000.00, which will allow us to pay for the mixing/mastering, printing cost for 100 copies of our album, and most of Indiegogo's fee. Every dollar that we raise once we have met our initial goal will allow us to print more copies of the album.

If we are able to raise enough funds to print 500 copies of the CD, we will use any extra funding to update our website, hire a professional photographer to take new band photos, and expand our band-based merchandise offerings. Our goal is to hire a few of our amazingly talented friends to do this work, supporting our local artists and designers along the way.  

We are completely committed to this project, and your donation will help us to release the most professional product possible!  

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Please share this page! Tell your friends, tell your enemies, tell random people that you meet at the grocery store... We appreciate any and all support, and we hope to see you at one of our shows!

story:
KARA is a professional Entertainer/singer song writer and Pianist.  There is no limit to what her voice can accomplish and Kara loves pushing Limits and breaking barriers. Being a singer includes being a beast on stage and Kara amazes her audience with not only her range and power of voice, but also her spectacular professional performance that she delivers to her audience. Kara's influences range from her love of Broadway musicals, such as The Phantom of the Opera, Les Miserables, and her rock and Jazz Idols such as Pat Benatar, Ann Wilson of Heart Stevie Nicks, Nancy Wilson, Celine Dion, Christina Aguilera and Annie Lennox just to name a few.

Mark Little was born August 28, 1951 in Amarillo, Texas. He began piano lessons at four, and played his first professional gig at six. He joined an R & B group “The Undertakers” at 14, touring with them for four years. Mark moved to Austin in 1970, and played with numerous groups including Willie Nelson, Stevie Ray Vaughn, Willis Allen Ramsey & Jerry Jeff Walker. He received a scholarship from Berklee School of Music where he got the chance to study with Bill Evans. Little adds that studying with Bill Evans was a “once in a lifetime incredible experience”.  By 1975, Mark was teaching at Berklee. He composed and arranged for Bobby McFerrin, as well as performing with him at the Playboy Jazz Festival in Los Angeles. He toured the United States and Europe with Maria Muldaur, working at Fat Tuesday’s in New York City and Ronnie Scott’s in London, among other places. Mark has worked with many great jazz artists, including Joe Henderson, Pharaoh Sanders, Grady Tate, Eddie Henderson, Morgana King, Joe Lovano, Ted Curson, Shorty Rogers, Chico Freeman , Bobby Hutcherson, Steve Allen, Ryo Kawasaki, Don Moye, Morganna King, Bud Shank, and Melba Moore.

This "PASSION" Album campaign is crucial to our success as musicians!! We need your help to get this album promoted around the world to the most influential agents and recording studios that will make our new genre RAZZ known and heard on the most popular radio stations and Recording Studios across the world.  

 If you decide to contribute you will help us achieve the Promotional process of our album "PASSION" to major agents and the best Recording studios in the world such as Capital Records and Sony just to name a few... But we need your help to pay for this process to get there.   

$25 - $45 - you get an autographed CD (mailed to you).

$50 - $95 - you get an autographed CD and poster (suitable for framing)

$100 -$900 - you get the CD and Poster and a KARA T Shirt (specify size)

$1000 - $9000 - you get all of the above plus a one of a kind original composition (you pick the title, subject matter). Example: a song for your spouse or business, your choice.

$10,000 - You get all of the above plus a free KARA concert anywhere in the world (travel expenses not included).

story:
Who is ModernMyth?

We are ModernMyth a new band from Tulsa, Ok. You might know some of us from our current or previous projects: The Dawn Armada, Hail The Blessed Hour, The Brothers Moore.

 

  • Aaron Harris: Vocals
  • Johnny Digges: Guitar
  • Matt Walker: Guitar
  • Elliott Hett: Bass
  • Jake White: Drums

Check out our latest single "Glow" here:

 

Check out our first single "Atrophy" here:

 

The Time Is Now

We started ModernMyth with the intention of stepping outside of our musical boundaries to write music that was new and refreshing to us. Music is a huge part of our lives that we want to use to share our experiences and connect with others. 

With your help, we will be able to finish the album we have been working on for the past 5 years without the need for a record label! 

What We Need 

For the last year and a half, we've been putting our heart and soul into perfecting these songs and carefully working on pre-production to make sure we are putting out the best album we can. As many of you know, the recording process is very expensive. Without the help of a record label, we have drained all of our own personal finances and resources to get us this far but now, we need your help. With your contribution, we can finish the album and get it in your hands!

What You Get

Aside from all of the killer perks we are offering, all of the proceeds we receive will go directly back into recording and producing the album. 

We are offering a lot of options for our fans so our packages range anywhere from a $10 Digital Download to a $35 T-Shirt + CD + Digital Download to a $200 Ultimate fan package that will make you a huge part of this band forever.

We are so appreciative and grateful for any support you can give to this campaign. In exchange for your generosity, We have put together a limited selection of perks that are available exclusively through your participation in this campaign.  Check them out below.

 

By choosing to crowdfund this album, you will play a huge part in our success - We couldn't do this without you! 

We've worked hard over the last 5 years writing and recording music, and now it's time for us to finally share it. We plan to include all of our friends and fans in this adventure, and aim to make this an album to remember. This will be our musical debut and we are honored and extremely grateful for your support! Our main goal is to raise enough funds to record a full-length album but, if we don't hit our goal, we will be releasing an EP. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're ready to contribute, just click the pink "Back It" button at the top of this page! Every dollar counts, and we are grateful for all your support.

Please spread the word and share our campaign with any of your friends that might be interested in supporting us. There are social media share buttons on this page, and please tell your friends how grateful we are for the support.

story:
WHO AM I

I am Samkelo Lelethu Mdolomba – also known as Samthing Soweto – I started my career as one of the founding members of the South African a cappella group The Soil. We released our self-titled debut album in 2011, under record label Native Rhythms. I dismembered from the group – however was honourably credited for my vocal appearance, co-writing, composing and producing 8 of 11 songs on their multi-platinum selling album The Soil.   

My first solo project was an independently released EP titled This n’ That without tempo, which featured a tribute to Miriam Makeba titled Peace n’ Lovely Things. I am also  known for my appearance as front man for nu-jazz band The Fridge, under record label Motif Records. The Fridge disbanded in 2015 due to two members of relocating.

I am a collaborator and producer on the poetry Album I Am Not Going Back to the Township, released in 2013 by Makafula Vilakazi. I've also appeared on several features including the single Broke People with Tumi Molekane, as well as Kabomo’s album All Things Grey on the song titled Things We Cannot Hide.

In 2014 I appeared as solo act at the Joy of Jazz Festival. In the same year I also earned myself a spot on the Rocking the Daises Festival. My music has featured on South African television shows and films, such as Isidingo, Big Brother Mzansi, the title sequence of Rhythm City, the soundtrack of the movie Othello Burning.

In 2015 I appeared on Coke Studios alongside international sensation Spoek Mathambo and Shane Cooper (a.k.a. Card on Spokes). In 2016 my releases include Thanda Wena and Ubhukhazikhazi.

2017 I believe is the year that my breakthrough will happen. I have been able to record an album, perform sold out shows and have had numerous interviews.

· With this campaign we want to bring the Gold Tour to all of the people who love my music across the country. Our next big performance is at the Grahamstown national arts festival. This is a big gathering of different creatives from all walks of life. The arts festival is a great opportunity for us to grow our offering and also link with other festival creators to possibly take our tour to continental and international stages.

· This is my first nation-wide tour. Fans have been wanting to see me and I have never been able to bring my music to them until now.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $5000 that will go towards:

Flights 6 people $1700

Accommodation for 6 people 8 nights $1500

S & T  $1300

Technical Requirements  $500

WHAT YOU GET.......... AN EXCLUSIVE NEW ACCAPELLA RELEASE!!!

I Love creating music and its the best gift i can give to you. With whatever contribution you make you will receive some new music.  

The Impact

· Your contribution to this campaign will really help me in putting together an amazing show for the audience. Knowing that I don’t have to worry about transport and accommodation I will be able to just focus on the music. My music is so important to me and I really want to share my nest with you. You have waited long enough to see me, you deserve nothing but the best of me and that’s what I plan on show casing in Grahamstown.  

Challenges

I have attempted to take a show to Grahamstown before as Samthing Soweto unfortunately the funders were unable to pull through. This year i will not allow that to happen. Do not underestimate your helping hand. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everyone can help financially but you may know people that can. Please share the link with all of your friends and family, who knows I might gain new fans who are able to help make this a reality.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our Album Concept

It's hard to explain the experience of Beer and Hymns unless you've been. It's fun and sacred. Irreverent and spirit-filled. It's like a karaoke all-skate of songs that are nostalgic and meaningful, whether you love them because of their history or your present beliefs.

We started beer and hymns three years ago, and in that time we've grown to love these songs even more. We've created unique adaptations of our favorite hymns, and we want to make them available to our fans and to people who aren't familiar with what we do. If you've never been, we feel like you will still love these songs.

We want to create an album that you want to listen to . . . in the morning, in the shower, in your car. We want these hymns to resonate, and this album to be one you listen to again and again. We've worked hard at curating our favorite ten songs, and we can't wait to share them with you.

story:
And So It Begins...

Hello strangers, lovers, and others! My name is Storm and I am alternative/folk singer-songwriter living in Los Angeles, CA.
Last year I had the pleasure of releasing my debut EP "Find Me There" into the big bad world, and now... I'M READY TO DO IT ALL AGAIN! (but with new songs and sounds ya dig?). 

Sob Story In 3... 2... 1...

It turns out that love, childlike wonder, and the moving power of music aren't enough to keep the lights on. Since I'm not signed to a label, everything comes out of my unfairly small girl-pockets (why do they make our pockets so small?). But with your help, I'll be able to release new music AND shop at a grocery store where they sell things that are things over 99c.


What I Need & What You Get

Lemme break it down:

  • I'll be pouring all funds directly into studio time, post production fees, hiring studio musicians (shout out to my cellist Mr. Fish!), and other boring business-y stuff...
  • In return for your donation, I've dreamed up all kinds of cool perks and goodies you can have for your very own. ;)

I CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT YOU!

story:
** UPDATE **
WE MADE IT TO $5K!

With a combination of contribution online and offline, we were able to raise the full amount! Thank you everyone for supporting, I can't wait to get this album out to you!

Introduction

What's up everyone welcome to my Indiegogo! My name is Andrew Barrack and I'm a singer-songwriter from San Diego, CA. I create feel-good pop music with elements of jazz, reggae, and rock. It's my goal to connect people through the message and the power of the music itself.

My goal with your support is to release an EP of 8 perfectly produced and recorded songs. Your contribution will allow me to fully bring my songs and passion to life and in return you will receive a product that we can all share and be proud of. 

A New Story & New Direction

As some of you might know, I recorded a 7 song EP in 2014 and a single in 2015.

https://soundcloud.com/andrew-barrack/sets/some-ep-tracks-single

There's been a lot  happening since then and my new songs are here to tell you the story. They're a step in a new direction lyrically and musically. Every lyric on this album means something to me, the instrumentals have more bite, and the production will be, as they say...next level.

Your contribution will go directly towards the following:

• Studio time

• Production, Mixing Mastering

• Design & Duplication of the Album and Artwork

• Travel Expenses

• And Anything Else to Make this Record the Best it Can Be!


* My goal is to have this album finished & in your hands by December 2016.

* Perks will also be delivered in December, if not sooner.


Industry Challenges

The biggest challenge in this industry is being heard. There are so many musicians out there trying to do their thing, not only in San Diego but all over the world. That's no secret. However, this album will give listeners the opportunity to fully appreciate my unique sound and enable me to stand out among the crowd. I am fully confident in my team and in YOU  to help me achieve this goal. 


The Goods
To the right are some pretty cool perks that you can choose to receive in return for your support. Anything from a single download or a signed CD + stickers, to having me come play your next event, or cook you dinner, and tons more! In addition,  everyone who contributes will live on the album forever in the liner notes!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Please share this project with all your friends and ask them to share it with their friends. If you are press or have a blog feel free to link to this page and use anything from my site. You can message me via the "contact" button with any questions.

And THANK YOU so much for your support and contributions. I am very excited for what this album will bring and what we can do together!

Sincerely, 

Andrew Barrack

.     .     .     .     .     .     .     .     .            

Keep in Touch!


Facebook - Andrew Barrack Music

https://www.facebook.com/AndrewBarrackMusic


GigTown - Andrew Barrack

gig.town/andrewbarrack


Twitter - @barrackmusic

https://twitter.com/barrackmusic


BandsInTown - Andrew Barrack

http://www.bandsintown.com/AndrewBarrackMusic


Soundcloud - Andrew Barrack

Thank you for the support...let the journey begin!
story_txt:
** UPDATE **WE MADE IT TO $5K!
With a combination of contribution online and offline, we were able to raise the full amount! Thank you everyone for supporting, I can't wait to get this album out to you!
Introduction

What's up everyone welcome to my Indiegogo! My name is Andrew Barrack and I'm a singer-songwriter from San Diego, CA. I create feel-good pop music with elements of jazz, reggae, and rock. It's my goal to connect people through the message and the power of the music itself.
My goal with your support is to release an EP of 8 perfectly produced and recorded songs. Your contribution will allow me to fully bring my songs and passion to life and in return you will receive a product that we can all share and be proud of. A New Story & New Direction
As some of you might know, I recorded a 7 song EP in 2014 and a single in 2015.
https://soundcloud.com/andrew-barrack/sets/some-ep-tracks-single
There's been a lot  happening since then and my new songs are here to tell you the story. They're a step in a new direction lyrically and musically. Every lyric on this album means something to me, the instrumentals have more bite, and the production will be, as they say...next level.
Your contribution will go directly towards the following:
• Studio time
• Production, Mixing Mastering
• Design & Duplication of the Album and Artwork
• Travel Expenses
• And Anything Else to Make this Record the Best it Can Be!

* My goal is to have this album finished & in your hands by December 2016.
* Perks will also be delivered in December, if not sooner.

Industry Challenges

The biggest challenge in this industry is being heard. There are so many musicians out there trying to do their thing, not only in San Diego but all over the world. That's no secret. However, this album will give listeners the opportunity to fully appreciate my unique sound and enable me to stand out among the crowd. I am fully confident in my team and in YOU  to help me achieve this goal. 



The Goods


To the right are some pretty cool perks that you can choose to receive in return for your support. Anything from a single download or a signed CD + stickers, to having me come play your next event, or cook you dinner, and tons more! In addition,  everyone who contributes will live on the album forever in the liner notes!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Please share this project with all your friends and ask them to share it with their friends. If you are press or have a blog feel free to link to this page and use anything from my site. You can message me via the "contact" button with any questions.
And THANK YOU so much for your support and contributions. I am very excited for what this album will bring and what we can do together!
Sincerely, 
Andrew Barrack
.     .     .     .     .     .     .     .     .            
Keep in Touch!

Facebook - Andrew Barrack Music
https://www.facebook.com/AndrewBarrackMusic



GigTown - Andrew Barrack
gig.town/andrewbarrack


Twitter - @barrackmusic
https://twitter.com/barrackmusic

BandsInTown - Andrew Barrack
http://www.bandsintown.com/AndrewBarrackMusic

Soundcloud - Andrew Barrack
https://soundcloud.com/andrew-barrack

Thank you for the support...let the journey begin!
