story:
We've got the producers and the studio, now get us there!

My name is Matt Hoyles and I'm a Vancouver based soul blues musician (check my music and videos out at matthoyles.com). I moved to Canada from New Zealand two years ago, and I've been stirring things up in the scene, but now's the chance to really make something happen.

I have been offered the incredible chance to record with acclaimed producers Earl Powell eptonemusic.com, and Ben Pelchat at Toronto's legendary Kensington Sound studios.

I met Ben when I had the honour of recording a live session of "I gave it all away" in the run up to Canadian Music Week 2016 where I was a showcasing artist. Ben and I met Earl at CMW's mentoring cafe and that's where the fire was truly sparked. incredibly, Earl and Ben have offered their services free of charge because they believe in the music I'm making; I can't even begin to explain how validating and overwhelming this is, and it is yet more fuel on the fire that proves this is an opportunity that cannot be missed.

Although Earl and Ben have offered their services for free, there are significant costs associated with flying Earl up from LA, and myself (with gear) from Vancouver, and keeping a roof over our heads, and food in our bellies while we're there. There is no way I can cover this cost, but I can't let this incredible chance slip by, and I can't let Earl and Ben incur any more financial burden than they already will be, by providing me with their amazing talents and services.

I'm a hard working musician, and I put my soul into every word I sing and every note I play, I live and breathe music, and with this team behind me, who knows what could happen!  If you too, believe in the music I'm making, and want to see it taken to the next level, please become a backer, donate and help make the magic happen.

Wondering if I'm any good? Check out my PRESS KIT, or what some of the industry had to say about my performance at Canadian Music Week 2016:

“ Matt Hoyles was one of my major highlights at CMW 2016. I still can’t believe that voice/ guitar combo. I want him over in the UK and that’s one of my goals now I’m back in London. The first tracks I downloaded when back in the office were Matt’s Nimbus sessions.”

Simon Gurney - BBC Worldwide

“ The best live performance I've seen in the last 2 years. That's crazy, because my job requires me to check out live performances all the time. "

Henca Maduro, Rotterdam, Netherlands -
C.E.O at Epitome Entertainment - New Skool Rules 

"I love this guy! Dude can play and his vocals are worldly!"

Lou Plaia - Co-Founder/EVP Music Industry & Artist Relations ReverbNation

"...was very fortunate to see and hear more than several great bands @ 'CMW'. Matt Hoyles truly 'moved the needle' in a way that I haven't experienced in quite some time..."

a.T fortuna - Damp Interactive, NYC

"I recently had the opportunity to record a live-off-the floor session with Matt Hoyles at Kensington Sound, where he proceeded to totally floor me. Matt oozes a sort of raw passion in his performances that I haven't really seen from anyone else to date. A true original, old soul, and heart-stopping musician. Seeing him live at the Paddock in front of a mesmerized crowd of professionals who gave him a standing ovation during CMW solidified my opinion.

Matt is THE one to watch.
All hail the return of real music!”

Ben Pelchat - Producer / Owner, Kensington Sound Studios, Toronto

 

Where will your money be going?

As mentioned above, Earl and Ben are donating their time and talents, we need funding for travel, accommodation, and daily costs:

  • Around $1400 in flights for Earl and myself, including excess fees for my instruments.
  • Lodging and food for Earl and myself for a week. 
  • Travel within the city, between accommodation and the studio.
  • A per diem for Ben to prevent any extra losses of income.
  • coverage of paypal transfer fees, and credit card processing fees being deducted from the total

This in total equates to a minimum of $3200, not including the ability to pay Earl and Ben for their services, or my loss of income from cancelling a week of work, so anything over the goal would be immensely appreciated.

I'm a full time musician, earning my daily wage as a guitar teacher, and as such I pretty much live hand to mouth. If I could achieve this without asking for help, I truly would. I am forever indebted for your support and understanding. In the music industry as it is today, we really depend on our fans more than ever, and I am grateful for every one of you.

​Any funds raised over the goal will be put towards making the record. This means paying the guys for their work, and getting CD's produced and tracks put on iTunes/Spotify etc. If I want a full production run of CD's licensed and pressed, we're talking at least $1000 (including digital distribution and design fees), so absolutely anything over the goal would be a Godsend.

 

Want to help, but can't donate?

  • Share the campaign around all your social media and friends!
  • You can share right from Indiegogo.
  • Let people know you love my music by following/liking me on Facebook, Youtube, Instagram, and Twitter @matthoylesmusic
  • Buy my EP on Bandcamp 

You're all the best, let's see what we can do!

story:
For over 15 years, my passion and specialty has been the Italian American Songbook. From Italian Jazz Classics, numerous covers of Connie Francis, Mario Lanza, Jerry Vale, and Rosemary Clooney favorites to beloved Neapolitan Songs and Contemporary Classical Crossover melodies, my repertoire is diverse, festive and energetic!

I have studied Italian and Italian Opera in Lucca, Italy while honing my skills in the performance halls of the region. I trained extensively with Italian diction coach Lorenzo Malfatti, who loved to share stories of teaching Sofia Loren her English and studying with the famed Italian conductor Toscanini. My Italian American roots go back to the late 1800's when my great grandfather immigrated to the United States to work in the brickyards of Niles, Ohio. This set the foundation for my Italian ancestors to own their own homes, and businesses and to educate their children and build community surrounding their church.

I am a person who believes  that it's important to know and appreciate where we come from. A great deal of identity and self-worth find their roots in our heritage and sense of family and tradition. I am a third generation American, but these songs ignite my soul and fuel a passion I am eager to share with my family, friends, and the world.

Amanda's 'Italian American Songbook' pays tribute to all aspects of Italian music including songs made famous here in the States among Italian-American's and those cherished in the homeland and passed down from generation to generation. It's the perfect balance of nostalgia and sentiment that will have you longing for Nonna's homemade raviolis and the warmth of her embrace.

My fundraising goal of $5,000 will pay for obtaining the rights to record 15 songs, professional arrangements and charts, recording studio time, studio musicians, and final printing and production. My long term vision for this project is that the CD will serve as a promotional tool to help me book more public performances and the band charts purchased for the CD have expanded my library allowing me to diversify my repertoire.

If you can't contribute to the campaign, please consider buying the album when it's released and/or attending my CD Release event at Leo's Banquet Center in Howland, OH on September 30th. And please share my project with your friends!

Rome wasn't built in a day, and neither will this ambitious project. I know I can't do this alone and I appreciate every effort to help make this dream a reality.

story:
I am planning to record my very FIRST full-length record, EVER and I'd love for you to be a part of it!

First of all, Thank you for stopping by my Indiegogo Campaign. Whether you are a friend, a family member, a loyal fan or a complete stranger, I love you for even remotely considering investing in my passion and calling.

THE LONG VERSION:

THE PROJECT is simple; I want to record a full album (10 songs) and have it released by the end of this year.

THE THEME of this record is courage and honesty. I spent years of my life searching for who I am and what my purpose on this earth is. Over the last 5 years, I went through some major transformation. This transformation resulted in some amazing new songs that I shared in a live setting with my audience. People loved them and kept asking me, where can I buy this? I want to use the new songs to love, encourage and inspire others to live their lives authentically and boldly while enjoying every step in their journey!

THE INVESTMENT can be any amount; high, low or steady as you go. Just know that it will help me make a 10-song record with producer and songwriter, Aaron Rice, Grammy-nominated songwriter ("Made to love" made famous by TobyMac, "Good Morning" sung by Mandisa, and “Million Miles Away” with Hawk Nelson, to name a few) and producer. 

In Picture with Aaron Rice

My $10,000 goal for this campaign only covers half the budget for the record. If we reach it quickly, I'd love to keep going so we can cover the full cost of the album, which is $20,000! My husband is a conservative man, and he talked me into keeping the initial goal low. However, if we quickly (or not-so-quickly) hit the $10,000 mark, please DON'T STOP SPREADING THE WORD! A lot of the success of this campaign depends on your help.

STRETCH GOAL #1 * $20,000 - When we reach this stretch goal the recording and production part of the project will be fully funded.

STRETCH GOAL #2 * $25,000 - When we reach this stretch goal I'll be able to hire a professional videography crew to help me record a professional music video for the title song on this album. 

YOUR REWARD In addition to all the new music Aaron and I've been cooking up, I also prepared some lovely rewards for your generous support. Some of the rewards include:

1. GET THE NEW ALBUM BEFORE ANYONE ELSE! The album cover has not been designed yet, but I promise it will look as lovely as it sounds.

2. CUSTOME-DESIGNED PICTURE FRAME (handpicked by me for you) WITH ORIGINAL LYRICS

3. 30 MINUTE VOCAL TRAINING SESSION IN PERSON OR VIA SKYPE

4. VISIT RECORDING SESSION IN PERSON OR VIA SKYPE

5. I'LL TRAVEL TO YOU IN THE U.S. TO SING AND SPEAK AT YOUR EVENT

and more...


BUDGET FOR THE ALBUM:

Recording/Production: $ 17,000

Manufacturing: $1,100

Photo/Design: $500

Indiegogo Fee and Payments Fee: $1,400

Total: $20,000



I CAN'T STRESS THIS ENOUGH: This album cannot and will not happen without you. I have spent years writing these songs but that is the extent of my abilities -- the new music will never see the light of day without the funds to pay the fine recording professionals their humble dues.

AGAIN, THANK YOU. Please help spread the word and don't whisper softly the things you want loudly to be.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

I've made several albums in the past and have a pretty decent handle on how this thing goes. I don't anticipate any difficulty in getting these songs to you in time to share them with those you love.

Notes From Listeners:

"To borrow a phrase from Simon Cowell, Csilla’s voice is like liquid gold. The clarity and beauty with which she sings are truly stunning.” Christopher M.

"Her voice is like honey combined with milk. So soothing."  D. M.
"

Csilla is an inspiring musician and speaker. Her music is genuine and heartfelt.

" Dr. Mark D.

"Csilla is an inspiring musician and speaker. Her music is genuine and heartfelt." Dr. Mark D.

story:
The world is evolving and growing fast, and one can ponder what future music will sound like. Will it be more tied to the elements (organic instruments) and move away from the mechanised sounds that have dominated a fragmented world for so long?

Our goal has always been to tune ourselves into the higher energies coming into the world today, and create an etheric, penetrating sound as a need of our time. Utilising precision recording of crystal bowls, swaramandala (27 string Indian zither), tamburas, bells, large orchestral drums, sustained vocal harmonics, the "Light Language Attunments" CD is fashioning a new and powerful sound for an emerging global consciousness. It is unique in its sound and very polished and rich in meticulously produced sonic landscape. As is the case with forward thinking, experimental ideas, this album needs resources and financial help for completion.

Funds raised go directly into the hard costs: studio time, overdubbing, video editing, mixing and final mastering. The artwork and packaging on the final CD will be visionary and uplifting, informative and inspirational. Additional time and effort will go into making vidual representations of the channeled music pieces — all to help its outreach.

Our strengths are: 1) the proven (and awarded) professional career of the producer/arranger, Craig Pruess, and 2) the extraodinary voice and channeling of Carmen Belle White, which will be a revelation to many many people.

This sound activation is needed urgently in the world today and this collaboration is very clear about the effect this music has on a global level.

 

TEAM ETHERICA - =;-D

Carmen Belle White is a British visionary painter, singer and sound healer. She has been traveling to the sacred sites for two years, toning and tuning in the higher energies, receiving the energy of the White Lion Beings, and reaching many people through her White Lion Beings Facebook page and authentic channeled artwork. Her ability to work spontaneously with acended masters and galactic beings sets her apart. She "becomes the sound" and truly reveals many wonders with her voice. The video trailer features many of her magical lion paintings.

Craig Pruess, film composer and international recording artist, is known globally for his "Sacred Chant of...." CDs, including the widely used, "108 Sacred Names of Mother Divine", "Angel Of The Earth" & "Sacred Chants Of Shiva." A British Academy Award nomination in 2010 recognises Craig's skills in soundtrack composing, conducting, arranging and sound sculpting. He is also a long term meditator/yoga practicioner and Art of Living teacher, involved in world peace initiatives for over 40 years through the power of consciousness and music.

Craig has kindly put together a YouTube sample of what the new CD will sound like. Meticulously recorded in A=432Hz frequency, this is a short taster of some of the activations and downloads that we are starting to capture for a a new and very powerful CD. For more about Craig's professional career: www.craigpruess.com

Craig is supporting this new and unique recording initiative, gifting his own time and expertise towards a project that would normally cost £20,000 or more, reflecting the level of expenses in a fully-fledged professional recording.

Thank you for your support, well wishes and your donations! Our perks are exciting for us, and we genuinely are looking forward to serving you in return! This work is in our DNA!

New updates will be regulated posted on the White Lion Being page, www.facebook.com/thewhitelionbeings.

The video trailer features many of her magical lion paintings.Craig Pruess, film composer and international recording artist, is known globally for his "Sacred Chant of...." CDs, including the widely used, "108 Sacred Names of Mother Divine", "Angel Of The Earth" & "Sacred Chants Of Shiva." A British Academy Award nomination in 2010 recognises Craig's skills in soundtrack composing, conducting, arranging and sound sculpting. He is also a long term meditator/yoga practicioner and Art of Living teacher, involved in world peace initiatives for over 40 years through the power of consciousness and music.Craig has kindly put together a YouTube sample of what the new CD will sound like. Meticulously recorded in A=432Hz frequency, this is a short taster of some of the activations and downloads that we are starting to capture for a a new and very powerful CD. For more about Craig's professional career: www.craigpruess.comCraig is supporting this new and unique recording initiative, gifting his own time and expertise towards a project that would normally cost £20,000 or more, reflecting the level of expenses in a fully-fledged professional recording.Thank you for your support, well wishes and your donations! Our perks are exciting for us, and we genuinely are looking forward to serving you in return! This work is in our DNA!New updates will be regulated posted on the White Lion Being page, www.facebook.com/thewhitelionbeings.

story:
My name is Derek Noppe an Ottawa based guitar player and live music fan.

  • In May of 2015 I lost a close friend and band mate due to her struggles with her Mental Health Issues - this has opened my eyes to the many, many people who struggle in silence today.
  • Every dollar donated will be going to help those in need - the Royal and SickNotWeak specialise in helping those with Mental Health issues.
  • This is the second year for this fund raising event, it is now my annual duty to raise awareness and funds in memory of my band mate, I am purposely not using her name as her family struggles with the reality of her illness.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please spread the word - share this site on social media, check out the website www.rockingawareness.ca  - share that too, let everyone know that you stand along side all those who suffer, help me let them know that they are not alone.
  •

story:
What we're about...


We're I Set The Sea On Fire (Billy, Pete, Meg & Josh). We've got the tracks together to record our first full length album, and we're really proud of the songs. We just need a little help funding the recording. We've had a few troubles with our last record label, so we are recording this album independently,  but cant financially make it happen without your support.

All the money raised will go towards paying for a studio for a week. As some of you know, this can be very expensive and on top of university & living costs, we just don't see it being possible in the near future.

Please dont think your moneys going to waste, we've been a band for around 5 years, and we are extremely passionate about music, and take the band very seriously. Over then years, we've opened for various successful bands, most notably Buzzcocks. We've also played many festivals & prestigious venues around the UK.

If you've got the money, we'd really appreciate anything you can give, but if not we're musicians, we know what its like to be skint. Thanks for all your support so far, and we wont let you down.

Billy, Pete, Josh & Meg (ISTSOF) x

story:
Wanting Miss Julie- "Musically Deep, Artistically Surreal"

                                                                                           -The Geek Authority

“You have a decision to make…”

Would you risk everything you worked for, everything you’ve built, for a chance at a new life—a new love—one with limitless possibilities?

Hi there…we’re John Sparks, Jake Anthony and Patricia Zehentmayr—book writer, composer, and lyricist (respectively)—and that’s the question our protagonist John has to answer in our musical Wanting Miss Julie, currently having it’s first full production at the Loft Ensemble in downtown Los Angeles (Saturdays and Sundays through May 8th, tickets available at www.loftensemble.com.) After having done many staged readings and workshop productions of this show both in Los Angeles and Chicago, we can’t begin to tell you how exciting/overwhelming it is to see the piece in a fully staged production, complete with lighting, costumes, choreography, and a fully orchestrated score…with a BAND! 

Recording the score!

So of course, in the middle of our inaugural six week run, we’re starting to think about future productions (“limitless possibilities” right?), and we thought: we have a fully rehearsed band and a fantastic cast—let’s make a complete recording of the score! In the past, we’d made some simple piano/vocal demos, but this Julie that’s on stage now has new songs, new lyrics; it barely resembles the piece we hear in previous recordings. Over the years that we have been workshopping  this show we have had many requests from audience members to have a recording of the score- but we've been reluctant to share our piano demos because they were only a sketch of our total vision. "this is an intense and musically diverse (score) where the music style and emotion actually move the story's own passions..." -The Geek Authority.

The future of Julie

So…the next logical step in the evolution of Wanting Miss Julie is a fully produced recording of the entire score. In today’s theater market, new musicals are a hard sell. Producers, Artistic Directors—they all want to know exactly what they’re getting when they take a chance on a new show. Piano recordings, while they've gotten us this far, aren't enough anymore. Furthermore, the music of Julie comes alive in living color in its orchestrations in a way we don’t get in the piano version of the score. A soulful clarinet wail transports us to a seedy jazz club, where Julie serenades us with a torchy ballad. Castanets power Julie’s tango, as she attempts her first seduction of the unwitting John.  The flute soothes Julie into a numb reverie, while she waits for her long lost mother to return.   THIS version of the score reflects Wanting Miss Julie in its current (and strongest) form, and this orchestrated version is the one that will secure future productions.

Where the funding goes

 So here’s where YOU come in. We need to raise $2300 to make this recording happen. The funding will go studio rental, a sound engineer, musicians and vocalists. And by helping us reach this goal, you’ll get to hear the finished tracks, in their fully orchestrated and fully mixed glory!

And if we happen to surpass our goal, we’ve got plenty of ideas to make the cast recording even more spectacular! 

The score of a musical lives in two places: one--the theaters in which it is being performed, and two--in a recording. These recording will help to perpetuate both. Let’s be honest: we’re not trying to change the world here…it's just musical theatre! 

Other ways you can help

  • Any dollar amount is welcome, and we thank you in advance.
  • Even if you can't give, you can still help by sharing our campaign through social media! Be sure to take advantage of IndieGoGo's share tools!

From the creative team of Wanting Miss Julie: THANK YOU!

story:
Our story

Voices of Silicon Valley is an innovative choral group. In keeping with the entrepreneurial spirit of the Silicon Valley, our goal is to revolutionize the way performers perform and the way audiences experience the performance.

In the first 2 years of our existence we experimented with new technology including bringing in new software from IRCAM, an institute on research in acoustic and electronic music in Paris (at 3:06 of our video you can see the choir stop singing and the software creating new computer sounds based on the previous input from the choir). We presented several world premieres, including a newly commissioned work by composer Monica Houghton, Moms of Silicon Valley, highlighting the plight of undocumented workers and their families in California (at the beginning of our video, on the screen you see the creators of the text, undocumented mothers. They conceal their faces for fear of prosecution). We incorporated visuals into our performances, complementing music.

Our Project

For our next project, we would like to take the innovation to another level and partner with developers to create a new app to allow audience members to participate in our concerts together with our choir, making the experience truly interactive. The app would have short music examples that the audience members would play with during certain pieces thus creating music together with the choir.

If our $4000 goal is met, we will be able to create this app and commission one or two composers to write new works for our Fall 2016 concert. The cost of producing the app, keeping it operational and updating it for different concert programs is $2000, and the cost of commissions is around $2000, depending on the length of a musical work.  We're very excited about this possibility to create something completely new and original and hope you are, too.

The Impact

 

We established our vocal group in San Jose, the capital of Silicon Valley, to create a new experience for ourselves and our audiences. Our goal is to create a vibrant, engaging choral experience, which blends music, visual and interactive elements... involving the performers as well as the audience.

In essence, we want to change the very nature of what we've all come to know as a 'choir concert' into an engaging interactive artistic experience for everyone.

We've put together a selection of gifts which you can claim in return for your generosity. Each gift comes with a special contributor status... Please choose from the column on the right of the page when you donate!

 

Challenges

 Since its inception, our group has shown a lot of resilience in the face of adversity. Our members have many talents, organizational skills and determination. Last year, we conducted our first successful crowd funding campaign and look how much we accomplished in just two years!  Voices of Silicon Valley is a sure bet to bring innovation and excitement onto the music scene in Bay area and beyond.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can help Voices:

* share this Indiegogo campaign link on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and other social media pages (hit the 'share' button on the Indiegogo page!) with your friends and other music lovers!

* share our video on other social media platforms

*visit our website: voices-sv.org and come to our concerts!

story:
"Burt, the Nerd" was a 1st successful album which I produced with alumni of Frank Zappa's band. Ike Willis, Tommy Mars, Arthur Barrow, Robert Martin, Ed Mann and Albert Wing joined me in the studio. The album won the German Rock & Pop Award 2014.

Now comes part 2 - "L.A. Bang Bang" - it will be even better. Better music, better production, better organisation and involvement of same artists even more people joining.

Working title of the CD is "L.A. Bang Bang" because LA is the creative base of it all.

What I need your help for: I can afford to compose and prepare it all and manage. It is artists fees which have a huge impact on the result. It is a big difference to spend half a day or 3 days with a huge talented person such as Ike or Tommy:
With short time you get a very good job done, while a real artists will dig deeper into the matter and add his creativity into it the more time is given. Besides artists "salary" studio time is the 2nd high cost. Help us to make the max out on what we can do - help us pay for the time we need.

Currently this artists confirmed their participation:

Ike Willis: Vocals and Guitar * 

Arthur Barrow: Sound Engineer and Studio Owner * 

Robert Martin: Vocals, Sax, French Horn *

Michael Barsimanto: Drums

(check project updates for other musicians coming in)

* As you well know, they played with musical genius Frank Zappa. 

........................... As reference here infos about the 1st CD:

Video: https://youtu.be/dbQ-p-czgx0

For buying the 1st CD "Burt, the Nerd"  on Amazon and iTunes:

https://www.amazon.de/Burt-Nerd-Wolfram-Klug/dp...

https://itunes.apple.com/de/album/burt-the-nerd...

 

If anything goes wrong or budget won't suffice then you will get all material such as mp3s and videos. But we are not worried  . It will all happen smoothly

story:
(Français plus bas)

Be a part of this creation by helping us

Sanguine Glacialis needs a minimum of 6500$ for our next album, and we need your help!
We are composing our 2nd album, "Hadopelagic", the first production with the new line-up, and we want to offer you the best album possible. We will enter the studio The Grid (Christian Donaldson & Marc-Olivier Fréchette) in Marc 2017, and we need your help to finance the album and all the cost related to it.
If you cannot help financing it, you can certainly help by sharing this page or our site to everyone! The more you share, the more we get know, and we have more chances of playing near you!
Where the money goes

All funds raised here will go in the production cost of the album or merch related to it. We need the money to:

  • Record, mix and master the album
  • Pay the graphist and photograph that will work on the visual
  • Print 500 copies
  • Promotion
  • Design and print the merch related to the album (T-shirts, hoodies, stickers, posters)
  • Plan the album launch in a few cities


Contribuez à cette création en nous aidant

Sanguine Glacialis a besoin d'un minimum de 6500$ pour la production du prochain album, et nous avons besoin de votre aide!

Nous composons notre 2e album, "Hadopelagic", la première production avec les nouveaux membres, et nous voulons vous offrir le meilleur album possible. Nous entrons au studio "The Grid" (Christian Donaldson & Marc-Olivier Fréchette) en Mars 2017, alors nous avons besoin de votre aide pour financer l'album et les coûts qui y sont reliés. 

Si vous ne pouvez pas payer, vous pouvez certainement aider en partageant cette page ou nos sites! Le plus vous partagez, le plus nous nous faisons connaître, donc nous avons plus de chance de jouer dans votre ville!

À quoi vos dons serviront

Tous les fonds ramassés ici vont aller aux coûts de production de l'album et de la marchandise qui y est reliée. Nous avons besoin de l'argent pour:

  • Enregistrer, mixer et masterer l'album
  • Payer le graphiste et la photographe qui va travailler sur le visuel
  • Imprimer 500 copies
  • Faire de la promotion
  • Designé et imprimer la marchandise reliée à l'album (T-shirts, autocollants, etc.)
  • Planifier la sortie d'album dans plusieurs villes

story:
WHO WE ARE

Soulga's mission is to bridge the gap between the ancient tradition of Yoga and the contemporary world of music and pop culture. Our goal is to blend a centuries old art form with current music, in order to bring a more modern feel to the practice. Plus we love shaking our booty to Beyonce in down dog! We will be the first studio in Colorado to bring this new twist on yoga to the mat in our own unique style. Offered in both NYC and Colorado, Soulga has grown to be a fun and playful practice that supports growth, community, mindfulness and inspiration.

ABOUT THE SQUAD

Ashley - Founder and Teacher 
A Pueblo Native turned New Yorker, Ashley has spent the last decade working in the Fashion industry. With a keen eye for aesthetic, she quickly learned how much atmosphere and visual surroundings affect the mood, clarity, and over all disposition people, as well as general happiness. After receiveing her certification, she started exploring different venues, styles, teachers, and of course music. Studying under some of the best teachers and most innovative styles, Ashley sought out to make her own mark on the Yoga and Movement world. She began by pairing yoga and modern contemporary music in unexpected venues, and Soulga was born.
Tara Becks - Soul Wizard and Teacher

A Colorado native, Tara Beck began practicing yoga as the fluidity was similar to that of dancing which she loved and grew up doing and also as a way to heal. After about a year and a half of home practice, Tara decided to embark on Teacher Training. She strives through her delicate yet tenacious spirit to be able to inspire others see their abilities from the inside out, not just only in the studio but also outside of out of it. When Tara is not on the mat you can find her spending time with her two beautiful children, her English Bulldog Ellie and her boyfriend Blair.

Melissa Mihelich - Studio Manager and Organizer Extraordinaire 

A Southern Louisiana native, Melissa started doing yoga in high school.  After she was swept from her native land by Hurricane Katrina, she met the love of her life, Tony and they moved to his hometown, Pueblo, CO.  Melissa loves being around positive souls and thrives in the arts.  Oil painter, mother of two beautiful children and Yogi for life.

Chris Garcia - Music Magician and Vibe Aficionado  

A Pueblo native with a love of music, Chris has been on the Pro DJ circuit for 10 years. Coming from a background in Mass Communication in Broadcasting and Communication, he's always had the ear for beats. Long time friends with Tara, Chris became Soulga's go to music master supplying all the vibes for class.  You can catch him behind the decks during class, then behind the camera after class as our impromptu photog. Although he finds inspiration in everything, the most comes from his beautiful daughter and their two crazy dogs.


WHAT'S MISSING OUT THERE...

With the ever changing fitness industry it's hard to keep current and fresh among a saturated market. Beat driven yoga paired with music has become the hottest new addition to the practice on both coasts. Soulga prides itself on offering fun, playful, and new twists on the traditional practice, but maintaining the solid foundations and ideals of yoga. We have a lighter approach to classes, but really stress the importance of supplying an environment of TEACHING and not just MOVING. Our attitude is to help students grow their practice in a mindful and safe space with proper teachings and tools. 

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

So what can you do? SO SO SO MUCH! In addition to just supporting the studio with attendance, your funds will go into making the space not only beautiful but filled with the best equipment available. Not only will we provide Jade non slip mats, Cork Blocks, high tech sound system and a DJ set up for live classes. We'll be offering retail at the front of the studio, including Soulga Gear and Merchandise. We're extremely excited to bring our vision to life and offer an amazing space to practice that will facilitate and foster growth and community. 

WHAT YOU GET!

By purchasing pre-paid class packs, you get the benefit of coming to class (yay!) but also for a discounted price! Not to mention a snazzy tote or water bottle. It's up to you! 

SHOUT IT FROM THE ROOFTOPS

Even if you can't help out with mulah, help us by spreading the word! Please share the link on social media, email, fax, text.....anything you can think of! Every little bit helps and we appreciate our kick a$$ SOULGA SQUAD for supporting our vision.
story_txt:
WHO WE ARESoulga's mission is to bridge the gap between the ancient tradition of Yoga and the contemporary world of music and pop culture. Our goal is to blend a centuries old art form with current music, in order to bring a more modern feel to the practice. Plus we love shaking our booty to Beyonce in down dog! We will be the first studio in Colorado to bring this new twist on yoga to the mat in our own unique style. Offered in both NYC and Colorado, Soulga has grown to be a fun and playful practice that supports growth, community, mindfulness and inspiration. 
ABOUT THE SQUAD

Ashley - Founder and Teacher 
A Pueblo Native turned New Yorker, Ashley has spent the last decade working in the Fashion industry. With a keen eye for aesthetic, she quickly learned how much atmosphere and visual surroundings affect the mood, clarity, and over all disposition people, as well as general happiness. After receiveing her certification, she started exploring different venues, styles, teachers, and of course music. Studying under some of the best teachers and most innovative styles, Ashley sought out to make her own mark on the Yoga and Movement world. She began by pairing yoga and modern contemporary music in unexpected venues, and Soulga was born.
Tara Becks - Soul Wizard and Teacher

A Colorado native, Tara Beck began practicing yoga as the fluidity was similar to that of dancing which she loved and grew up doing and also as a way to heal. After about a year and a half of home practice, Tara decided to embark on Teacher Training. She strives through her delicate yet tenacious spirit to be able to inspire others see their abilities from the inside out, not just only in the studio but also outside of out of it. When Tara is not on the mat you can find her spending time with her two beautiful children, her English Bulldog Ellie and her boyfriend Blair.

Melissa Mihelich - Studio Manager and Organizer Extraordinaire A Southern Louisiana native, Melissa started doing yoga in high school.  After she was swept from her native land by Hurricane Katrina, she met the love of her life, Tony and they moved to his hometown, Pueblo, CO.  Melissa loves being around positive souls and thrives in the arts.  Oil painter, mother of two beautiful children and Yogi for life.
Chris Garcia - Music Magician and Vibe Aficionado  
A Pueblo native with a love of music, Chris has been on the Pro DJ circuit for 10 years. Coming from a background in Mass Communication in Broadcasting and Communication, he's always had the ear for beats. Long time friends with Tara, Chris became Soulga's go to music master supplying all the vibes for class.  You can catch him behind the decks during class, then behind the camera after class as our impromptu photog. Although he finds inspiration in everything, the most comes from his beautiful daughter and their two crazy dogs.


WHAT'S MISSING OUT THERE...


With the ever changing fitness industry it's hard to keep current and fresh among a saturated market. Beat driven yoga paired with music has become the hottest new addition to the practice on both coasts. Soulga prides itself on offering fun, playful, and new twists on the traditional practice, but maintaining the solid foundations and ideals of yoga. We have a lighter approach to classes, but really stress the importance of supplying an environment of TEACHING and not just MOVING. Our attitude is to help students grow their practice in a mindful and safe space with proper teachings and tools. 
HOW CAN YOU HELP?

 So what can you do? SO SO SO MUCH! In addition to just supporting the studio with attendance, your funds will go into making the space not only beautiful but filled with the best equipment available. Not only will we provide Jade non slip mats, Cork Blocks, high tech sound system and a DJ set up for live classes. We'll be offering retail at the front of the studio, including Soulga Gear and Merchandise. We're extremely excited to bring our vision to life and offer an amazing space to practice that will facilitate and foster growth and community. 
    WHAT YOU GET! 
By purchasing pre-paid class packs, you get the benefit of coming to class (yay!) but also for a discounted price! Not to mention a snazzy tote or water bottle. It's up to you!   SHOUT IT FROM THE ROOFTOPS Even if you can't help out with mulah, help us by spreading the word! Please share the link on social media, email, fax, text.....anything you can think of! Every little bit helps and we appreciate our kick a$$ SOULGA SQUAD for supporting our vision.

story:
Who's Behind the Project?

Small Laces is written and fronted by actor and comedian Lorna Shaw; founder of Poco Town Kids and one half of critically acclaimed duo That Pair (Soho Theatre, BBC Radio 4) who enjoyed sell-out runs at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival between 2012 and 2015. Lorna has taken 5 shows to the Edinburgh fringe, has extensive experience working with children in schools through drama as well as working for a number of years as children's entertainer. 

The show is directed by musician and actor Ben Harrison. Ben has toured internationally with hugely successful, long running children’s show ‘Bear Hunt Live!’ along with many other acclaimed children’s productions including ‘Jason and the Argonauts’ and ‘James and the Giant Peach’. Ben wrote the script and music for an adaptation of Alice in Wonderland back in 2008 which was directed by Jessica Swale and received critical acclaim at the Edinburgh Fringe. 

The rest of Small Laces comprises of a rotating ensemble of acclaimed and award winning musicians and comedians; Katie Pritchard, Gareth Cooper, Cassie Atkinson, Ben Van Der Velde and Will Tuckwell.

The Show

The multi-talented band sings and plays a range of instruments including guitar, keyboard, ukulele and cajon, combined with percussion and punchy backing tracks that will have children and parents tapping their feet from start to finish. The songs are woven together with audience interaction and comedic dialogue where the audience get to know the quirky band and all their foibles. All sung from a child’s point of view, the songs cover a wide range of subject matter; from the gender labelling of the colour pink to coping with coeliac disease. On the sillier end of spectrum are numbers about the annoyance of sharing your name with someone else and seeing your teacher in the supermarket.

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise £2000 to help cover our expenses.

We are keeping expenses to a minimum by calling in favours, volunteering and trading skills. However, some expenses are unavoidable. These are;

Rehearsal space

Fringe registration fees

Flyer and poster printing

Photographer

Flyering Team 

Costumes

Technician to operate the show

Paying the performers

By contributing to the project you will not only be helping with all the above, but will also buy us time to put into the production. You will also enable us to raise the production quality of the show and get the word out further afield, thus ensuring bigger audiences and more exposure. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If are not in a position to contribute, you can still help us get the word out! Please tell your friends about the project, 'like' us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter and shout about the show in Edinburgh

@smalllaces

www.facebook.com/smalllacesband/

2 - 27 August (not 14, 21)

Pleasance Courtyard (The Green – Kids Zone)

Time: 12.45pm

If you are in a position to contribute then you could be a recipient of a Small Laces CD :) See our perks for more information.

Thank you so much for considering our campaign!

Love,

Small Laces x

story:
The colorful cityscape of Havana.

 

My Story

In the winter of 2016 I lived in Havana, Cuba for three months (thanks to my generous supporters on IndieGoGo!) studying Cuban music and dance. I met some talented musicians and, on a return trip this last December, started recording an album with a few of them. Moises Whittaker and Laura Napoles Martinez run a small studio called MO Records out of their home. As soon as we started making music together I knew it was something special and that I would have to return to continue the project with more time and a bigger budget.

Moises and I with some of the musicians who joined us at MO Records Studio.

 

I plan to bring along T Bruce Bowers (world class recording engineer who also happens to be my father...) to help us get the highest possible quality of recordings. We've worked together for many years in many capacities and have a great collaborative relationship, so his presence and expertise will be invaluable. My first trip to Cuba was cut a bit shorter than planned because he was diagnosed with stage 4 prostate cancer and I came home to be with my family. He is now in remission and feeling healthy and I'm looking forward to having him as part of this project. 

Flashback to 2011 with my dad T Bruce Bowers.

 

As some of you may know, I've been in love with Cuban music for many years over the course of my career as a pianist, songwriter, vocalist and dancer. I spent over 11 years learning all that I could about Cuban music, dance and culture. I've also spent a long time writing indie-folk songs and performing them. But now for the first time I'm bringing the two passions together into one beautiful melting pot. This has been my dream as an artist for a long time and the way it is unfolding is perfect and so, so exciting for me.

In John Lennon Park in Habana.

 

This particular album (working title "SpiralBound") made itself clear to me over the course of this last winter when I found myself writing a song once a month on the full moon. It was a long hard winter and each of these songs were steps along my journey, gifts from my deep, aching heart that helped me reach the next level of growth. As I pulled myself into the light one song at a time and finally looked back at where I'd come from, I saw something beautiful. A spiral. A series of patterns. The sum of everything I had once been. And so I became suddenly drawn to the Fibonacci sequence, spirals, the nautilus shell, and other patterns in the world. I saw how they were the same as my life, each chamber leading to the next and expanding upon itself, growing constantly bigger and more beautiful. 1 + 1 = 2, 1 + 2= 3, 2 + 3 = 5, 3 + 5 = 8... Each number is the sum of the previous two. Leading to infinity. 

If all goes well, the album will be released in five portions, one each week, following the Fibonacci sequence starting on January 1st 2018. A new year. A full moon. A new spiral. I will share details as they are clarified. 

My mascot Naughty the Nautilus (who used to be a salt shaker...)

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $12,000 to make this project happen. About half of that will be used up front for recording/traveling costs. The rest will go into post-production, making sure I delivery to your doorstep a beautiful product that I'm proud of.

Here's a breakdown of the budget:

Flights: $1,000

Travel/living expenses in Cuba: $2,000

Studio costs in Cuba: $1,000

Studio costs in USA: $2,000

Graphic Design and Layout: $900

Duplication: $2,000

Promotion/music video: $2,000

IndieGoGo Fees (10%): $1,100

______
Total: $12,000

Bruce and I leave for Cuba on September 25th. If we don't reach our full goal amount by that time, I will find other funding sources for the post production upon our return. 

My big picture plan is to buy a touring vehicle and live on the road for the next couple of years starting this spring, playing music around the country in support of this album. In the event that we surpass our funding goal, every penny will go towards the touring costs involved in this dream.

My dream van!

 

I'm striving for simplicity, so I've limited the perks to a few really goods ones. The most obvious will be a shiny, signed copy of the album sent to you with lots of love and kisses. Other highlights are a solo Yazmin show in your living room, your name listed in the album booklet thank you's, a signed picture of the band, hand-written lyrics. 

 

The Impact

This project is the next step for me as an artist, but it's also a personal chance to lessen the gap between two countries that are struggling to maintain relations right now. My last fundraiser was successful in getting me to Cuba for the first time and now the irresistible sabor of that country has gotten under my skin. It's become a part of me and part of my music that I want to share with all of you.

This is such a challenging and sensitive time in our country in regards to race, religion and gender equality. Part of me wonders if releasing an album of love songs is really that important. But then another part of me speaks up and says, "YES!" These songs come straight from my heart. My intention is that by sharing these I can shine a light on the love and humanity in all of us and inspire others to create and share their own stories. Let's all make art together!

 

Risks & Challenges

Sharing this creation is scary. These songs are extremely personal and I'm terrified to put them out there. As a perfectionist, I'm already grieving the many ways the album will not be exactly as I picture it. But also, I'm excited for the many more ways it will become real and human and filled with beautiful flaws. I think it's only fitting, since the journey of these songs is all about realizing again and again that we are enough just as we are, human, struggling, loving, flawed.

Performing live on Madeline Island. Photo by Marie Ketring.

 

I'm so grateful for every bit of support, whether that means a donation, a social media share or like, a thumbs up from across the street when you see me stressing out, or just a deep breath of fresh air sent my way. I will send it back to you with love and 12 brand new songs from my heart.

story:
the lullaby is as ancient as humankind. 

 Lullabies are as much for adults as for children, and we love the genre so much that we've dedicated an entire project to it. The two of us have enjoyed a collaboration for many years now, and we look forward to sharing our original arrangements of folk lullabies from around the world. We will bring you music from the middle ages, 1800s Germany, baroque Italy, early America, and more.

A professional recording requires up-front funding and so we are raising money to record our music. We want to share it with the world! Donate $12 and you'll get the recording for free.

August-September 2017: raise funds

September-December 2017: record album

January 2018: release recording

story:
Abendmusik - New York's Early Music String Band

                                        

Judson Griffin, baroque violin

                 Małgorzata Ziemnicka, baroque violin

                                       Lawrence Lipnik, viola da gamba

                                                           Carlene Stober, viola da gamba

                                                                               Patricia Ann Neely, viola da gamba

Our campaign is simple:

At the end of each season we look back at what we have achieved programmatically and how much we enjoyed the process of preparing our concerts. One of the most rewarding responsibilities we have to Abendmusik is to make sure we keep our programming fresh, creatively engaging, and informative. We enthusiastically look forward to fulfilling this obligation by delving deeply into research of 17th-century culture, aspects of which remain an enigma and questions regarding musical interpretation and style still evolving. We delight in being an active part of the discussion through our performances. However, in order to achieve what we set out to present in concerts, we must raise funds to support research, preparation, contracting of the best and the most historically-informed guest artists, as well as compensation for ourselves so that we can continue to inspire in our audiences the same passion and commitment we have for the music. We need your support and hope you will consider a donation to the ensemble and become a member of our extended family.   For those who have given in the past, we are eternally grateful and we hope that we can continue to count on you for support.  

What we want to achieve this year:

·  complete a recording of the Fantasies of William White, a Jacobean composer who flourished alongside Orlando Gibbons, Alfonso Ferrabosco II, John Ward, William Byrd, and Thomas Lupo, to name a few, but whose works have not yet been recorded as a collection.· 

·  increase our outreach and public profile by producing  videos, recordings, and arranging more concert opportunities in a wider geographic network.

·  collaborate with other early music musicians and ensembles as well as cultural and educational organizations.

Abendmusik, New York’s Early Music String Band, showcases the rarely-performed repertoire composed during and after one of the most devastating periods in the Germanic region’s history, the 30 Years War (1618 – 1648).  The term “Abendmusik” refers to the free concert series established by the organist Franz Tunder in Lübeck churches in the 17th century and further cultivated by North German composer Dieterich Buxtehude in the early 18th century.  Abendmusik programs featured sacred and secular vocal and instrumental solo and chamber works.  The series became so popular, as a result of free admission and featured compositions, that it grew into a respectable cultural institution.  We explore the repertoire of countries that  influenced  German composers (Italy, the Hapsburg Empire of Austria and Spain, Poland, Holland, England, Denmark and France) as well as the regional styles of German composers associated with specific principalities through the period during and after the war. The end result is a fusion of styles and the ultimate establishment of a German national style we associate with J. S. Bach, Georg Philipp Telemann, George Friderich Handel and others.

The members of the ensemble individually enjoy distinguished careers in historically-informed academic and performance fields and have appeared with many high-profile early music ensembles including: The American Classical Orchestra, Aston Magna, Boston Camerata, The Boston Early Music Festival Orchestra, Consort Royal, Early Music New York, Glimmerglass Opera, Lionheart, New York City Opera, The New York Consort of Viols, New York Grande Bande, Parthenia, Rebel, Sequentia,The Smithsonian Chamber Orchestra and Viol Consort, The Smithson Quartet, Trinity Baroque, Washington Bach Consort, and many more.  Together the members of Abendmusik contribute their professional experience, talent and scholarship, to create and present programs that are informative, showcase virtuosity, sensitivity and creativity, and most importantly leave the audience wanting more.

Our guests artists for the 2017-2018 season include: Mary Springfels, viola da gamba; Jason Priset, lute and theorbo; Adam Young, viola da gamba.

Fantasia No. 2 in 6 parts by William White

https://soundcloud.com/neelyp/william-white-and-his-contemporaries-fantasia-no-2-in-6-parts-william-white

 

Please consider making a contribution to our fundraising campaign so that we can continue to inspire ourselves as artists and inspire our followers to join us on this journey.

Giving Levels:

Contributor, $25.00 - $99.00
Donor, $100.00 - $499.00
Sponsor, $500.00 - $999.00
Patron, $1,000.00 - 1,499.00
Benefactor, $1,500.00 and above

All Supporters receive:

Contributor = 2 free tickets
Donor = up to 4 free tickets
Sponsor = up to 6 free tickets
Patron = up to 10 free tickets
Benefactor = up to 14 free tickets

We also welcome major gifts and underwriters for specific projects. 

Our specific needs include:

· $6,000 for artists fees

· $1,200 for rental of the concert space

· $1,200.00 for archival recordings of our concerts

·  $7,000.00 more to produce a commercial recording of the Fantasies of William White (we raised $1700 last year through our campaign)

·  $800.00 for general operating expenses and publicity campaigns 

Abendmusik is under the fiscal sponsorship of Gotham Early Music Scene, Inc., a 501©3 corporation.  All donations are tax deductible to the full extent of the law.

By visiting our website   www.abendmusik.net you will also get to know us individually and LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR PROGRAMS WE OFFER THIS SEASON. WE LOOK FORWARD TO SEEING YOU AT OUR NEXT CONCERT :

Thursday, October 12, 2017 at 8 pm

“De Gouden Eeuw"

The Golden Age or the consequences of Dutch Persistence

The “Gouden Eeuw” or Golden Age in the Low Countries during the 17th century was a period in which commerce, education, and the arts and sciences experienced major growth. Abendmusik focuses on the music published in the Netherlands by Dutch and foreign composers who flourished in the Netherlands during this prolific period including, Nicolaus à Kempis, Philippe van Wichel, Johann Schop, Johann Schenk, Constantijn Huygens, Jr., Carolus Hacquart, Peter Philips, Tarquinio Merula, Louis Constantin, and more. 

Guest Artists: Adam Young, viola da gamba; Jason Priset, lute and theorbo

The Church of St. Luke in the Fields
487 Hudson Street in Greenwich Village (at the intersection of Hudson Street and Grove Street)

We delight in being an active part of the discussion through our performances. However, in order to achieve what we set out to present in concerts, we must raise funds to support research, preparation, contracting of the best and the most historically-informed guest artists, as well as compensation for ourselves so that we can continue to inspire in our audiences the same passion and commitment we have for the music. We need your support and hope you will consider a donation to the ensemble and become a member of our extended family.   For those who have given in the past, we are eternally grateful and we hope that we can continue to count on you for support.  What we want to achieve this year:·  complete a recording of the Fantasies of William White, a Jacobean composer who flourished alongside Orlando Gibbons, Alfonso Ferrabosco II, John Ward, William Byrd, and Thomas Lupo, to name a few, but whose works have not yet been recorded as a collection.· ·  increase our outreach and public profile by producing  videos, recordings, and arranging more concert opportunities in a wider geographic network.·  collaborate with other early music musicians and ensembles as well as cultural and educational organizations.Abendmusik, New York’s Early Music String Band, showcases the rarely-performed repertoire composed during and after one of the most devastating periods in the Germanic region’s history, the 30 Years War (1618 – 1648).  The term “Abendmusik” refers to the free concert series established by the organist Franz Tunder in Lübeck churches in the 17th century and further cultivated by North German composer Dieterich Buxtehude in the early 18th century.  Abendmusik programs featured sacred and secular vocal and instrumental solo and chamber works.  The series became so popular, as a result of free admission and featured compositions, that it grew into a respectable cultural institution.  We explore the repertoire of countries that  influenced  German composers (Italy, the Hapsburg Empire of Austria and Spain, Poland, Holland, England, Denmark and France) as well as the regional styles of German composers associated with specific principalities through the period during and after the war. The end result is a fusion of styles and the ultimate establishment of a German national style we associate with J. S. Bach, Georg Philipp Telemann, George Friderich Handel and others.The members of the ensemble individually enjoy distinguished careers in historically-informed academic and performance fields and have appeared with many high-profile early music ensembles including: The American Classical Orchestra, Aston Magna, Boston Camerata, The Boston Early Music Festival Orchestra, Consort Royal, Early Music New York, Glimmerglass Opera, Lionheart, New York City Opera, The New York Consort of Viols, New York Grande Bande, Parthenia, Rebel, Sequentia,The Smithsonian Chamber Orchestra and Viol Consort, The Smithson Quartet, Trinity Baroque, Washington Bach Consort, and many more.  Together the members of Abendmusik contribute their professional experience, talent and scholarship, to create and present programs that are informative, showcase virtuosity, sensitivity and creativity, and most importantly leave the audience wanting more.Our guests artists for the 2017-2018 season include: Mary Springfels, viola da gamba; Jason Priset, lute and theorbo; Adam Young, viola da gamba.Fantasia No. 2 in 6 parts by William Whitehttps://soundcloud.com/neelyp/william-white-and-his-contemporaries-fantasia-no-2-in-6-parts-william-white Please consider making a contribution to our fundraising campaign so that we can continue to inspire ourselves as artists and inspire our followers to join us on this journey.Giving Levels:Contributor, $25.00 - $99.00Donor, $100.00 - $499.00Sponsor, $500.00 - $999.00Patron, $1,000.00 - 1,499.00Benefactor, $1,500.00 and aboveAll Supporters receive:Contributor = 2 free ticketsDonor = up to 4 free ticketsSponsor = up to 6 free ticketsPatron = up to 10 free ticketsBenefactor = up to 14 free ticketsWe also welcome major gifts and underwriters for specific projects. Our specific needs include:· $6,000 for artists fees· $1,200 for rental of the concert space· $1,200.00 for archival recordings of our concerts·  $7,000.00 more to produce a commercial recording of the Fantasies of William White (we raised $1700 last year through our campaign)·  $800.00 for general operating expenses and publicity campaigns Abendmusik is under the fiscal sponsorship of Gotham Early Music Scene, Inc., a 501©3 corporation.  All donations are tax deductible to the full extent of the law.By visiting our website   www.abendmusik.net you will also get to know us individually and LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR PROGRAMS WE OFFER THIS SEASON. WE LOOK FORWARD TO SEEING YOU AT OUR NEXT CONCERT :Thursday, October 12, 2017 at 8 pm“De Gouden Eeuw"The Golden Age or the consequences of Dutch PersistenceThe “Gouden Eeuw” or Golden Age in the Low Countries during the 17th century was a period in which commerce, education, and the arts and sciences experienced major growth. Abendmusik focuses on the music published in the Netherlands by Dutch and foreign composers who flourished in the Netherlands during this prolific period including, Nicolaus à Kempis, Philippe van Wichel, Johann Schop, Johann Schenk, Constantijn Huygens, Jr., Carolus Hacquart, Peter Philips, Tarquinio Merula, Louis Constantin, and more. Guest Artists: Adam Young, viola da gamba; Jason Priset, lute and theorboThe Church of St. Luke in the Fields487 Hudson Street in Greenwich Village (at the intersection of Hudson Street and Grove Street)

story:
About Me

I live in Chicago and my full-time work is as a licensed, professional psychotherapist. But I have been a singer-songwriter and piano player since I was three-years-old in Uxbridge, Massachusetts.  Writing and performing music has always been an important part of my own self-care and self-expression throughout the years, and music-making has also been a good friend to me during difficult times…such as these.

About This Project

Like a lot of people, I have found the days since November 9th, 2016 to be particularly challenging on many levels. So, on November 10th I started writing this new batch of songs. I think I was still in a state of shock at that time, however, so I looked for some sort of structure to help me get my thoughts together. I found that the names and images of certain tarot cards made for very useful writing prompts. The result of which is a set of eight songs that can be appreciated both now and at a time beyond our current cultural-political moment. I think any audience, regardless of their familiarity with tarot cards, will understand the thoughts and feelings conveyed.

Being a therapist as well as a songwriter, my aim was for these songs to bring us together, feel a little less alone, and maybe help make some sort of sense out of this moment.

This song-cycle has gotten a lot of positive, enthusiastic responses when I’ve played it live and I feel strongly that the collection’s underlying message of hope and courage needs to reach a wider audience. Your support will help make that happen!

How Your Contribution Helps

Fortunately, these songs sound best with minimal instrumentation. I have not had to hire a lot of musicians to accompany me, which has helped keep expenses low. Most of the songs are just me singing and playing the piano, the three female harmony singers known as “the Affinities”, and cello. I will also have a harpist on a couple of tracks.

That said, studio time, production fees, mastering, cover artwork, and duplication all add up quickly.

Your contribution helps me cover the costs of making the album, which would be tremendously freeing for me as an artist. Since I am not dependent on my earnings as a musician, once the costs of making “Don’t Let The Moon Fool You” are covered, I can share the album more generously and reach a wider audience.

Besides feeling good about helping this music reach more people, there are a lot of great perks available to contributors. Many of the perks are pretty special...please check them out!

Other Ways to Help

Please tell your friends and family about this project. You can use the Indiegogo ‘share’ tools above to spread the word on social media.

You can find out when and where I’m playing at kevin-newhall.com or my facebook page “Kevin Newhall Music”. Please come and support me live… and bring your friends!

I am extremely grateful for your support and encouragement.

Thank you!

Kevin

story:
WHO ARE YOU? WHAT IS HAPPENING?

Hi Indiegogo Folks (and former Kickstarter Folks!**)! I am Cat Harris-White and I'm an independent artist located in Seattle WA.  I create, sing, perform and produce music under the name SassyBlack. You may know my work from my former group THEESatisfaction or my vocal appearances on Black Up & Lese Majesty by Shabazz Palaces.  

Last year I released my first solo album No More Weak Dates to a fantastically warm reception, after finishing other project releases you might be familiar with – Personal Sunlight, Me and Mines (Cute Chicks), Pop Treasury Vol 1;*NSYNC, etc.

Since then so much has happened including my first solo tour to Europe last fall! I spoke at SXSW & Pop Kultur Berlin, performed at several festivals (Capitol Hill Block Party, Treefort Music Fest, Linecheck Festival (Milan), Barcelona Acciò Musical (Barcelona), Doe Bay, Earshot Jazz Festival, Daytrotter Downs, etc.), performed a KEXP Live In Studio as well as had my music featured on the Adult Swim compilation LUXE. As you can see, things in my solo career are moving pretty quickly!!

On June 23rd, I released my sophomore album New Black Swing independently. It's my seventh release in the past three years, can you believe it?! Like all my projects, this album was written, produced and performed by me.  And so far, this has been my most successful record yet, gaining praise not only from major publications like i-d, NYLON & the FADER, but also from YOU, my family, friends and supporters!

 

OH COOL, WHAT'S GOOD SASSY? WHAT'S THIS ALL ABOUT?

As I mentioned, people have responded so well to New Black Swing that it is definitely time for a full fledged North American and European tour! I manage and book myself and have been in contact with promoters and venues all over the world confirming venues for my live performances. So far, I have some great dates lined up including Seattle (8/31), Portland (9/6), London (10/13), Salt Lake City (9/9), Zürich (10/26) and many more to be announced.
 

WHY ARE YOU DOING THIS INDIEGOGO?

As a Queer, Black woman, I rarely ever ask for help. With that said, this is what I like to call a "vulnerability moment". It's an opportunity for me to share myself in a different way and admit that I don't have all the answers and that I do need help from my fans and supporters. Going from being a indie artist to a signed (Sub Pop) artist back to an indie artist has been quite the journey and I wouldn't change a thing!  However, I have learned a lot during this time and asking for support for my tour will insure that I reach new venues outside the Pacific Northwest and share my music of love and empowerment. All in all, I am very excited to get to know my fans and supporters better and to continue to grow as a musician and share knowledge.

** For my Kickstarter supporters, a big THANK YOU for your support!! As you know, Kickstarter is an “all or nothing” fundraising campaign platform. With your support, I was able reach a total of over $8,500 ($8,563), which I think is pretty stupendous, but fell short of the $20,000 goal I had listed. ! So, I am going to step out of my comfort zone and ask you a pretty big favor: PLEASE make that same pledge on this Indiegogo page!!    

I learned a lot from my Kickstarter campaign: I reduced my goal to $10,000, I reviewed the pledges to offer what intrigued you the most, and deleted others. The best thing about Indiegogo, is that it allows the artist to receive what is pledged!! This will allow you to truly fund my tour!!

 

 

 

 


photo by Brady Harvey from KEXP In Studio
 

WHAT'S THE PLAN MA'AM?

My tour kicks off August 31st and goes until mid November. Promoters and venues have been contacted, and so far 15 dates have been confirmed with more confirming almost every day!

- All perks will be scheduled in October and set in motion beginning in November when I return from tour.

- Merchandise Delivery has a few more steps involved which is below:

·        October = Buttons, Posters, CDs, Shirts, Vinyl go into production

·        November = Individual CD Mailings begins. If you ordered a package that includes a shirt (but not vinyl), your order will be shipped out by late November, which is great for holiday gift giving!

·        February = Vinyl inclusive packages mailings begin; If you ordered a package that includes Vinyl this will all be shipped together in February. * The wait on vinyl is so long because it takes 3 months to create and ship out vinyl and since it takes 2-4 weeks to process the Indiegogo funds, the vinyl cannot be ordered until October.
 

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

It covers some of my expenses which include air, ground, and ferry travel, tour publicity & media promotions, music videos, accommodations (I need somewhere to sleep and practice!) and of course, meals (I need to eat!). These are all things that are necessary to have a successful tour and many venues are unable to provide travel and accommodations for out of town artists.
 

WHY IS THIS IMPORTANT TO YOU SASS?

It’s important to push yourself and try new things! My solo career is still a new thing for me and it is scary and magical, every day, but that’s why I love it!! I challenge myself to take risks and learn more about myself and how I can help others and that is one of the best feelings in the world, outside of making music!
 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

My biggest risks are financial. My fans have been requesting that I come to their cities to perform live. With the support of all of you, as well as radio & print publicists, I can make their requests a reality. I have allotted myself a cushion in terms of the time it takes to get some of the perks done. If for some reason the timeline changes I will notify you immediately.

The album is finished. I have researched the cost of merchandise and publicity firms. I have directors, designers, promoters, actors and videographers ready to create magic!

There will always be fear in my line of creativity, but I feel that my nerves are healthy and proof that I am truly alive! It is also more important to me to try rather to give up before I give myself a chance to start.

story:
"Worthy of Love"

My name is Matt Grigsby. I'm a 30 year old songwriter living in Denton, TX. I need your help producing an album I think is going to be special and meaningful to a lot of people. Let me explain. 

I haven't put out an album in 4 years. I've written plenty of songs, I could put together another album right after this one but that doesn't mean I should. A good album is more than just a collection of songs. The songs should all work together towards the same message or feeling. And I think I finally have a group of songs that will do just that. 

When we think of being "Worthy of Love" we immediately think of our romantic pursuits. And certainly romance is a huge factor in all of our lives, but there's more to it than that. There's also our sense of self-worth, and of finding our place in the universe, or even our own hometown. And I think we've all struggled with that. Because how much happiness is spent paying the rent is part of feeling worthy of love. And waking up Monday morning thinking, "before long I may have to quit drinking" is part of feeling worthy of love. Because looking back at failed relationships and hoping they're on the road to feeling good again is part of feeling worthy of love. And these songs have all that and more.

What I Need

This album is currently being recorded in Denton, Texas at CaptivEar Studios and will be released October 5th with a release party at Dan's Silver Leaf. I'm seeking to raise $8000 to cover costs. This money will be used to pay for the amazing studio musicians we're bringing in to make this record worthy of your listening, as well as the packaging/duplication process, printing t-shirts, hiring a radio promoter, and promotions in general, and likely costs I don't even know exist yet. And your contributions will not go unrewarded. There are perks for donations as little as $5 or as much as $500. Some of the perks include an autographed copy of the CD, a CD and t-shirt, or a copy of the poster from the album release show. For a $250 contribution I will write a song based off any prompt you feed me. For a $1000 contribution I will come play a private concert in the comfort of your home, or wherever you choose. And if you find yourself unable to participate financially, as I often do, you'll still be able to help by sharing this campaign with friends and family who may want to be involved as well. Plus, Indiegogo provides several share tools to make this process easier. All of you can help make this a success.

story:
Hello, thank you for considering a donation to our Indiegogo campaign.  Burning Man is a giant art experience held on a large dry lakebed in the Black Rock Desert. Every year 70,000 people gather, build a huge city out of nothing - featuring incredible art and interactivity, and then dismantle it and leave the wonderful desert space in a condition better than when we arrived.

We love all that is Burning Man, and we want to support more diversity in the styles of music you can find there, so we bring high-quality, professional live Bluegrass music to the Playa!  Rootpile is a camp dedicated to exposing more folks to live Bluegrass music and Hillbilly culture and food (moonshine and BBQ!!).

This year we want to expand our offering to the community OUTSIDE of our camp, with The Rootpile Rolling Thunder Bluegrass Stage. This is a self-contained mobile stage and fire-shooting art car!  Rolling Thunder will be clad in North Carolina pine logs and look like your granny’s front porch!  Inside our camp, we host Bluegrass lessons and nightly concerts (with dinner!) by our professional house band, Black Rock Bluegrass.  Getting those pros out and about to other camps and spaces is what Rolling Thunder is all about!

Challenges with this project:  going to Burning Man is a challenge in itself, and coordinating a 75-person camp (and its infrastructure) with nightly live music and food is even more so.  But, in this - our fifth year out, we want to spread the Bluegrass love far(ther) and wide(r)!

Our mission is to bring live Bluegrass somewhere it’s never been, and we are committed to that. We have set a fundraising goal that will be solely dedicated to the construction and transport of Rolling Thunder. Hey, if a guy can raise $55,000 to make potato salad then surely, we can raise the money to take the “greatest music in the world” to Burning Man?! Help us bring Bluegrass Music to the dusty masses!!
