story:
Short Summary

Aloha... my name is Toni Childs, I am an Emmy Winner and three time Grammy nominated recording artist, installation artist, environmental activist and yoga teacher. In a nut shell, I am an impact artist, and I have developed a new music driven 3D Mapping Concert Experience - 'It's All a Beautiful Noise'. To listen to my new music click here. 

This is two hours of music and off-the-hook 3D mapping animations by Barcelona based Tigrelab. My show is designed to inspire a ground swell of support for our littlest angels - the Bees and other Pollinators who are facing collapse. (Click on the video below to watch Tigrelab's Projection Reel. This will give an idea of the quality and scope of their work.)

 

My show is unique on a few fronts, most notable is that it was designed to keep audiences engaged for up to five months - before, during and after the show by using life size Visy Recycled paper animal installations that are installed three months BEFORE the show comes to town, and six simple white paper hats of pollinators with addressable LED lights that are given to audience members at the show. And guess what? I get to control lights in the hats from the stage - fun fun fun!!

Now the really cool part for me is that each hat is connected to a different environmental organization with the URL of the organization on the underside of the hat. Each organization is asked to take the audience member on a journey AFTER the concert- a treasure hunt so to speak - to experience five online hero moments that end asking the audience member to send their hat to a yet to be specified physical location where all the hats become part of a large public installation and a beautiful tremendous voice for our pollinators! I am presently in talking with Green Peace, World Wild Life Fund, ICUN Red List and NGOs local to different countries we will be touring.

Bee populations collapsed 41% in the US last year... !! To give these beautiful creatures a voice I have created a High-Tech inspirational interactive playdate with an environmental message.  The production will travel to regional areas of the US, Canada, Australia and Europe inspiring people to stop buying chemicals and the chemical laden products that are contributing to the collapse of our littlest angels our pollinators.

The theme for my show is "We are all pollinators, what we buy we grow!" 

We are actually corporate farmers... if we don't buy it, it won't grow!

“as Interaction with social media and its tools become more and more sophisticated so to has the expectation of audiences for more than just a music experience. People are seeking to belong, to engage, and participate in change.” - MIT Press

 

What We Need...

My goal is to raise 350K for all the elements that make up the show in this crowd-funding campaign:

  1. The design, fabrication and build of three popup sets for my shows in the US, Europe and Australia. (I am fabricating three sets in three different countries to reduce international shipping costs to our touring company.);

  2. Two hours of 3D animation mixed with live action footage;

  3. An exoskeletal suit that brings the show together ;

  4. Four weeks with a Dramaturge to really nut-out the flow of the show and tighten the storytelling elements; 

  5. And a full four weeks of production rehearsals in Barcelona bringing all the elements together: the music, the set, 3D animations, lights, sound and storytelling.

Your buy-in means we can bring contemporary art with an environmental message to cities and regional areas. This will give us a shot at changing some minds about the chemicals people use in areas where environmental activism is usually a dirty word. 

"Where would we be without bees? As far as important species go, they are top of the list. They are critical pollinators: they pollinate 70 of the around 100 crop species that feed 90% of the world. Honey bees are responsible for $30 billion a year in crops.

That’s only the start. We may lose all the plants that bees pollinate, all of the animals that eat those plants and so on up the food chain. Which means a world without bees could struggle to sustain the global human population of 7 billion. Our supermarkets would have half the amount of fruit and vegetables.

It gets worse. We are losing bees at an alarming rate. Possible reasons include the loss of flower meadows, the crab-like varroa mite that feasts on their blood, climate change, and use of pesticides." - BBC's Maddie Moate​ 2014

I have been recording music and touring internationally for more than 40 years and have garnered a faithful and growing fan base in 50 countries around the world. I am proud to collaborate with so many exceptionally talented artists on this project using spectacle and play to produce a cutting-edge show filled with technological delights to create an 'Awe' experience - proving art can change the world!

The awe experience takes us on a journey, It entices us into a mini revolution, an internal revolt that opens us. It evolves our perceptions, our beliefs and the way we relate to the world around us – without asking for permission. It is an experience that turns on a light inside us when we least expect it. 

Inspiration

When I was 21 years old I had a dream.  In the dream, I’m standing at a stone balustrade in front of a French Chateau in the Hollywood hills; which, of course, you can do in the Hollywood hills, and you can do in a dream.

The sun had just set and I was gazing down over the city. I noticed to my amazement the city lights come on-line systematically in large sections across the valley. I had never seen that before.

It was the time of year when the sun goes down you feel the bite of the air on your skin and the clean smell of damp earth. In front of me off in the distance, I could see the silhouette of the Angeles Crest Mountain Range — a black sharp outline against a massive bandwidth of brilliant orange illuminating the sky where the sun had set. I had to look straight up into the night sky to see where it turned to turquoise blue and to see the first star. 

This was epic!

I was fully immersed in the waves of beautiful feeling this stunning visual moment brought, when something caught my attention. I turned to look and behind me were two very tall narrow French doors, and inside was a full-blown Hollywood party, with people smoking and drinking and being all fabulous.

But I didn't want to go in. I just wanted to turn around and be back in the vibe of the epic moment. But when I did turn away something caught my eye, and I noticed, behind the far right door there was a woman -  floating a foot off the ground!! She had no clothes on, and no hair on her body. Strangely, her body was like a jellyfish… Now, don’t get me wrong, her anatomy was clearly like ours. Yet, parts of her body were transparent, and had the look and texture of a Box Jellyfish. In fact, I  would have to say her body’s opacity was a combination Box Jellyfish/Gecko.

What I mean was that her breasts and muscle pads were transparent like a Box Jellyfish and her torso had the opacity of a Gecko. Just like we can see its eggs inside a Gecko, I could see her ovaries and I could see her heart beating inside her chest. Her neck and arms and breast were clear like a jellyfish but the torso transparent like a gecko.

I became fascinated by every inch of her body. I noticed she had a blue caste to her body and I thought to myself, "Oh it’s because our veins are blue."

I could see her neck vein pulsing up and down, and as I watched closely I could see various systems moving inside her body. I became so wrapped up in her anatomy I forgot there was a person attached to this body, and when I finally did look into her eyes, I got freaked out.

She said, “Don’t be afraid!” But her lips didn’t move.

And I said, ‘Did you just talk to me inside my head?”

“When you reach a certain moment in your human development, you’ll no longer be afraid to allow people to know what you think or feel.”

I thought for a moment, "That sounds right."

Looking into her eyes I asked, “Who are you?"

She paused, and said, "I’m your future self",

and I woke up.

Meeting my future self all those years ago gave me a trajectory – a star on the distant horizon to point my compass toward. I have now shared this dream with many people in more than 20 countries around the world. I believe Mik Lavage's music created a portal for my future self to come through. The impact this story, and the new music from It’s All a Beautiful Noise has on people is really something special to experience. As part of ‘The Show’ I want to share my dream moment in a more dynamic and captivating way, by allowing my future self to come to life! I want to give my future self the opportunity to sing and talk directly to the audience, reflecting back to us what she thinks is happening on planet earth, and sharing her great belief in humanity’s capacity to evolve and meet the shifting dynamic of the natural world on planet Earth.

Rewards

I have many wonderful Rewards to entice you to pollinate It's All a Beautiful Noise and to signal your friends to do the same. I have been busy designing the merch for this show for the last couple of years, so I am really excited to finally share what's on offer here. I have everything from CDs to Concert Packages, Birthday Bundles, Songwriting Retreats, my Radical Alignment Retreats, Posters, Animal Chalkboards & Whiteboards, T-Shirts and more.  Below are some large product photos of some of the things you can purchase as gifts for someone you love or just for yourself for this coming holiday season!

Music

The music for It's All a Beautiful Noise was written and produced in collaboration with Mik Lavage. Mik is a sound designer, noise maker extraordinaire, and AFI award nominee who creates music primarily for film, television and documentary. His vast and epic musical contributions inspired me to explore new possibilities vocally which led me into the territory of DubStep and Trip-Hop. I also wanted to create something unique for the CD cover, and I thought it would be cool to design a popup cover to interface with six Augmented Reality Animations that Tigrelab are creating specifically for this show. If you've yet to hear about augmented reality click on the link and see what it's all about. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oH_LfXnklRw 

Toni Childs' Greatest Hits So Far... is an Eco Wallet two CD set. This two CD set is only available here on Indiegogo with songs hand picked from all of Toni's albums including: Union, House of Hope, The Woman's Boat, Keep the Faith, It's All a Beautiful Noise and a couple special tracks from Citizens of the Planet.

This is the one and only Toni Childs Box Set in existence and it includes: Union, House of Hope, The Woman's Boat, Keep the Faith, It's All a Beautiful Noise, Zero Point, Citizens of the Planet and Toni Childs, The Vault Unreleased Tracks. This is the first time this Box Set has been available.

The Vault is unreleased and alternate takes from my previous albums. This collection of music is a mix of never before released songs from Citizens of the Planet, Keep the Faith, and the album 'Bare' I was in the process of writing and recording when I was diagnosed with Graves Disease and had to put my career on hold. If you love my music you are going to love this...!!

Art

Choose from one of six AO size Pollinator Posters on canvas. This is a massive poster and looks incredible!! Or buy all six paper posters in A1 size or 16.5 × 23.4 inches and create a feature wall!

T-Shirts

Buy all six tea towels...  perfect gifts for the holidays!

My fun lightweight Chalk Boards and White Boards stands up on their own... a perfect gift for a Birthday. You have a Rhino, Lion, Kangaroo and Penguin to choose from. FYI: We will ship anywhere in the world but as shipping costs are hard to predict we will require that shipping charges are paid when ready to ship.

Golden Ticket

 

Risks & Challenges

I cannot foresee any challenges to producing all aspects of this ground-breaking, awe inspiring and educational show, or in fulfilling the Rewards I've listed in this campaign, other than, of course, failing to make my 350k goal. All of the collaborators on this project are top professionals in their respective fields, with excellent production credentials. The manufacturers producing my rewards also have a proven reputation for delivering quality products. With the combined expertise of these professionals, plus my success as a producer and performer over many years in the music and arts industry, I am fully confident I will reach my projected goal.

Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.

I launched a Kickstarter campaign in 2013 and raised $111K, just over my target amount. In 2013, 699 individuals pledged to my Kickstarter to put it over the line. That was an average spend of $159 per person. To reach my present 350K target I will need approximately 2,202 individuals to buy-in at the same average. I believe this is absolutely possible given the number of fans and friends I have on Facebook and other social media sites, plus my always growing mailing list of 45,000. This was my very first crowd-funding campaign, and I learned a lot from that experience.

There were many issues I had to overcome, such as organizing the mailing list and finding the right fulfillment warehouses in China and the US. We recently linked our shop to our fulfillments centre warehouses. I am bringing all I learned to this campaign. Specifically, I am creating a video explaining the challenges of the first campaign and how I will avoid these issues this time around. This will give new, and past supporters, the chance to understand more fully the process of fulfillment, the processes I've put in place in order to make reward fulfillment easier, and where we are at presently with Citizens of the Planet.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you find It's All a Beautiful exciting but just can't contribute, I am looking for volunteers to help me get the word out and make some noise on social media. Personal Message me or my manager Rae Mitchell and we'll kick in some special rewards for the time you give!

Remember Indiegogo has share tools you can use.

I am looking for people with PR background and social networking skills. Put your hand up if you're interested in joining the Gogo Crew!!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
To My People:

It's me, Mil. The seven year old dreamer that once screamed and cried and kicked and spit people in the face in order to avoid singing in front of crowds has now written a song and is oddly proud and in love with it. This would be an honor and a lifelong dream of mine to share with all of you. The song called "MoVE" is written and performed by yours truly. The production is ready to, well, move. After 100 rough drafts on voice notes I realized it won't work this way. It needs studio time, producers, and a music video to follow... and it ain't even close to free. So I'll need your help. Anything goes such a long way, even a share of this page on your social sites will cause a ripple that can make waves. It takes an army to make a single three minutes of music come to life and I have faith we can make it happen.  I can't wait to share the final product with you all so you can blast it in your car or maybe at a bar. You can blast it in a club or bathing in a tub. You can blast it here, there...you see where I'm going with this, right? Anyhow, this one comes from the heart and I hope you all have as much fun listening as I will creating. 

With Love and Gratitude,

M

story:
Our Letter To YOU.

Dear AHMIR-ica.. yes, that's you, our devoted and loyal fanbase from ALL over the world.  You may likely know us from our YouTube covers and fell in love with how we breathed new life into your favorite songs. You always knew it was an AHMIR cover when you heard our signature group harmonies and lush vocals that just made your heart melt every time :)  We uploaded our first cover in 2008 and because of each of you, we are still here in 2016... 200+ videos and almost 100 million views later. We've performed all over the country, got a record deal, been featured in magazines, played on the radio, had our albums in stores in Japan, even been on TV a few times.  We've been privileged enough to also use our platform to help bring awareness and raise money for some awesome charities.  It's truly been an incredible ride so far and we can only thank you for making it possible.

In all honesty, we're not quite sure where this ride will take us or when it will end, but we do know that before all is said and done we wanted to make a new album of all original R&B music.  An album that is AHMIR at its core. An album that is raw, emotional, soulful and most importantly written by us as we've experienced life, love, lust, and loss.  Some of you may know we released our first original R&B album called "The Gift" back in 2006.  We've lived a lot since then and as you can imagine, 10 years later we have a lot to say.

For the past year, we've been secretly recording songs for this new album and it's almost done and we must say it's truly going to be a collection of songs that you'll cherish for a lifetime.  Our dream is to have this album heard by everyone possible, talked about by everyone possible, and most of all enjoyed by everyone possible.  Writing and recording the songs is only part of the process and now this next part is why we're launching this campaign.

We no longer have the resources of a record label, but we're confident we can do something truly special with your help. We want to have the best possible sound engineers to make sure the songs sound amazing for you. We want to put out the best and most beautiful visuals for you. We want to put together the best team of people to give us the best chance at showcasing these songs so you can maybe see us on TV again, hear us on the radio, or even perform near YOU. We want OUR success to be YOUR success. As this may be our last original album, we would love nothing more than for you to lend us a hand to take us through this monumental part of our journey.

Much luv ...KC, Sing-Sing, Big Mike & Mr. Jones


What YOU Can Get for donating:

In exchange for your generous donations, you can get some awesome perks like:

-Exclusive FIRST listen of the songs recorded for the album!

-Exclusive Bonus Track!

-JUST ADDED 6/17/16!! Sound Intone CX-05 Headphones - 2 pairs will be given away to new donors at a random drawing!


-Limited edition T-shirt!

-Exclusive video chats with us to help pick the title and final track list for the album!

-Signed poster with personal messages from us!

-Limited edition signed hard copy of the album!

-Thank You credit in the album and music video!

-Flight and hotel to Boston to get the ultimate fan experience with us!


Where your generous donation will go:

We want you to know exactly where your contributions are going so here is the projected budget for our campaign in order of what will be spent first:

Album sound mastering:                                 $2,000

Music video(s):                                                  $10,000

Publicity (we have the best in the biz ;)       $15,000

Press/Showcase trip-Los Angeles & NYC:  $3,000

Radio promotion;                                               $20,000

GOAL:                                                                   $50,000

We know this is quite a chunk of change we're trying to raise, but hey we've learned that if you want to be a star, you have to reach for the stars! Nevertheless, our campaign is set up as a flex-funding campaign meaning that we will receive your contributions whether or not we reach our goal. If we do not reach our goal we will adjust our budget and proceed accordingly. We guarantee the highest possible product no matter what, but the opportunity to make the most noise and generate the most buzz for this album only becomes possible by reaching our goal. We were signed to a record deal so we know and have seen firsthand how much financial power it takes to make things happen. So let's make it happen together AHMIR-ica!


Album Release Date:

We're aiming for the 4th quarter of 2016 or 1st quarter of 2017.  Setting up a successful release with the right mix of publicity and buzz can be tricky so all we can say is that we will have some intense discussions and planning sessions with our team of experts to ensure the best possible release date so that your contributions receive their maximum value! The best of all for you as a donor is that you will receive exclusive behind-the-scenes updates that no one else will!


Other Ways You Can Help:

No money? No problem! We love you just for being an AHMIR-zing fan no matter what, but here's what else you can do:

  • Share this IndieGoGo campaign link on your Facebook and Twitter, and other social media pages (hit that "Share" button on the IndieGoGo page!) with other AHMIR fans you know or anyone you think may like us!

  • Share your favorite AHMIR YouTube cover video on social media so we can get new awesome fans like you!

  • Subscribe to us on YouTube: youtube.com/ahmirTV

  • “Like” us on Facebook: facebook.com/ahmirmusic

  • Follow us on Twitter: @AHMIR
  • Follow us on Instagram: @AhmirMusic
story_txt:
Our Letter To YOU.


Dear AHMIR-ica.. yes, that's you, our devoted and loyal fanbase from ALL over the world.  You may likely know us from our YouTube covers and fell in love with how we breathed new life into your favorite songs. You always knew it was an AHMIR cover when you heard our signature group harmonies and lush vocals that just made your heart melt every time :)  We uploaded our first cover in 2008 and because of each of you, we are still here in 2016... 200+ videos and almost 100 million views later. We've performed all over the country, got a record deal, been featured in magazines, played on the radio, had our albums in stores in Japan, even been on TV a few times.  We've been privileged enough to also use our platform to help bring awareness and raise money for some awesome charities.  It's truly been an incredible ride so far and we can only thank you for making it possible. 
In all honesty, we're not quite sure where this ride will take us or when it will end, but we do know that before all is said and done we wanted to make a new album of all original R&B music.  An album that is AHMIR at its core. An album that is raw, emotional, soulful and most importantly written by us as we've experienced life, love, lust, and loss.  Some of you may know we released our first original R&B album called "The Gift" back in 2006.  We've lived a lot since then and as you can imagine, 10 years later we have a lot to say. 
For the past year, we've been secretly recording songs for this new album and it's almost done and we must say it's truly going to be a collection of songs that you'll cherish for a lifetime.  Our dream is to have this album heard by everyone possible, talked about by everyone possible, and most of all enjoyed by everyone possible.  Writing and recording the songs is only part of the process and now this next part is why we're launching this campaign. 
We no longer have the resources of a record label, but we're confident we can do something truly special with your help. We want to have the best possible sound engineers to make sure the songs sound amazing for you. We want to put out the best and most beautiful visuals for you. We want to put together the best team of people to give us the best chance at showcasing these songs so you can maybe see us on TV again, hear us on the radio, or even perform near YOU. We want OUR success to be YOUR success. As this may be our last original album, we would love nothing more than for you to lend us a hand to take us through this monumental part of our journey. 
Much luv ...KC, Sing-Sing, Big Mike & Mr. Jones

story:
POT is a music project from Republic of Moldova which started in 2014 to help and encourage young bands to bring their music to a wider audience. 

It acts as a take-off platform by offering emerging artists access to venues, music industry knowledge and a network of opportunities with professionals from the field. Since its very outset, 25 bands have been given the opportunity to perform live on a stage and show their talents in the POT Music Contest. 

2016 is an exciting year for us as we challenged ourselves to produce the first Moldovan Alternative Music Compilation that will include songs of emerging bands from Moldova. This will be a fantastic opportunity to promote Moldovan alternative music beyond our country’s borders. By selling the album we want to secure its continuity, meaning the next edition.

In Moldova the production of a song costs around 330$, which is more than the average monthly salary that rounds up to 200$. Therefore, such a musical compilation will offer a unique chance for 15 young artists to showcase their talents and their work. Having a CD with your song on it is a great achievement for any emerging artist and a chance for a great start. Especially, when you come from a country where the music industry is under-developed and you have limited opportunities.

We have this dream of seeing POT Music bands on an international arena singing at the opening concert of such inspiring bands as Radiohead, Hurts, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Muse or Arctic Monkeys.

So, the first step in achieving this dream is to get their music out there by creating a compilation and promoting it. The overall budget for producing the album amounts to 7600 USD and it includes production costs for a compilation of 15 songs on 500 CD copies. We managed to raise 3600 USD on our own for the production of 9 songs. And now we need your support to raise the additional 4000 USD, so we could make this compilation real! This sum includes the production of another 6 songs for the CD, which equals to 20 days of studio work for recording. There are also mixing and mastering costs for all the songs. And last but not least there are also costs related to the design and packaging. We plan to track the songs in the best Moldovan studio - Polidisc Records. The mixing and mastering will be done by NMP Studios from London. And our old and dear friend Imago will create the CD cover design of the album. Both studios are supporting our initiative by offering us extremely good prices for their high quality work therefore lowering our costs considerably!

CHALLENGES

We would not have gotten so far if we wouldn’t had taken into account certain risks. In this campaign the most eminent risk is the fact that we might not raise the entire amount of 4000 $ that we need for the production of the music compilation. Therefore, we present you three scenarios of our next steps in case we do not reach  campaign's goal in order to ensure you that the compilation will still be produced, one way or another.

Scenario 1

If we raise less than 900 $ then we will distribute only a digital version of the compilation album with 9 songs on it.

Scenario 2

If we manage to raise 1000 $ then we will produce 500 CDs with 9 songs on them.

Scenario 3

If we manage to raise more than 1000 we complete the 500 CDs production (9 songs) with additional songs proportionally to the amount raised.

IMPACT

Your donation will make a difference, no matter the size, because it will increase our chances of producing the first Moldovan Alternative Music Compilation. And last, but not least, it will help us promote the image of young Moldovan musicians in the international artistic community. 

All in all, we strongly feel that our investment in the future of young aspiring musicians will be worthwhile. We hope that your support towards the production of the first POT Music Album will take this initiative to the next level. 

Empower young Moldovan artists with a bright future by making a contribution!

A few more words about POT Music as an organization. Through our program we have created a community of young musicians who are determined to better their performing skills. We have put together workshops with music industry professionals in order to improve the learning outcomes of these emerging artists. We are also constantly working on facilitating their access to stages all over Moldova at the same time bringing along fresh alternative music to the public. Once the project became a success, we decided to go further and register it as a non-profit organization with the main focus on the development of alternative music in Moldova. Moreover, we do our best to bring music closer to youngsters that are in difficulties, such as the teenagers from boarding schools or those from juvenile prison. 


**************************** ROMÂNĂ **********************************

                   POT este un proiect muzical din Republica Moldova, care a început în 2014, pentru a ajuta și a încuraja trupele tinere să-și aducă muzica în fața unui public mai larg.

Acesta acționează ca o platformă de decolare oferind acces artiștilor începători la scene, cunoștințe din industria muzicală și o rețea de oportunități cu profesioniștii din domeniu. De la bun început, 25 de trupe au avut posibilitatea de a evolua pe o scenă vie și să-și arate talentele lor în cadrul Concursului POT Music.

2016 este un an interesant pentru că ne-am propus să producem prima Compilație de Muzică Alternativă din Moldova, care va include piesele mai multor trupe tinere ce sunt la început de cale. Aceasta va fi o oportunitate fantastică de a promova muzica alternativă moldovenească dincolo de hotarele țării noastre. Prin comercializarea albumului dorim să asigurăm continuitatea următoarelor ediții ale compilației.

În Moldova producția unei piese costă în jur de 330 $, ceea ce este mai mult decât salariul mediu lunar, care poate fi rotungit la 200 $. Prin urmare, o astfel de compilație muzicală va oferi o șansă unică pentru 15 trupe începătoare de a-și demonstra talentul și rezultatul muncii lor. A avea un CD care include o piesă proprie este o mare realizare pentru orice tânăr artist și o șansă pentru un început grozav. Cu atât mai mult dacă vii într-o țară în care industria muzicală este subdezvolată și ai oportunități limitate.

Noi avem acest vis de a vedea trupele POT Music pe arena internațională cântând la deschiderea unui concert a unor trupe precum Radiohead, Hurts, Red Hot Chili Pepper, Muse sau Arctic Monkeys. 

Iar primul pas spre realizarea acestui vis este promovarea muzicii alternative din Moldova prin intermediul unei compilații. Bugetul total pentru realizarea albumului se ridică la 7600 USD și include costurile de producție pentru o compilație de 15 piese și producerea a 500 de exemplare (CD-uri). Până în prezent, am reușit să strîngem cu forțele proprii 3600 USD pentru producția a 9 piese. Iar acum avem nevoie de suportul tău pentru a colecta cei 4000$ adiționali de care avem nevoie pentru a face această compilație o realitate! Această sumă include producția a încă 6 piese, ceea ce echivalează cu 20 de zile de muncă de studio pentru înregistrare. Pe lîngă aceasta, vom avea nevoie de mixing și mastering pentru toate piesele. Și nu în ultimul rând. mai avem cheltuieli de design și ambalare. Ne propunem să înregistrăm melodiile în cel mai bun studio din Moldova -  Polidisc Records, iar mixul și masteringul urmează să fie realizate de către NMP Studios din Londra. Și sigur că vechiul și dragul nostru prieten Imago va crea design-ul copertei pentru album. Ambele studiouri sprijină inițiativa noastră oferindu-ne prețuri extrem de generoase pentru munca lor de înaltă calitate, prin urmare micșorând costurile noastre considerabil!

PROVOCĂRI

Cu siguranță nu am fi ajuns atât de departe dacă nu am fi luat în considerație anumite riscuri. În această campanie riscul cel mai eminent este faptul că s-ar putea să nu reușim să colectăm întreaga sumă de 4000 $ de care avem nevoie pentru producerea compilației muzicale. Prin urmare, vă prezentăm trei scenarii a ceea ce urmează să facem în cazul în care nu ne vom atingem obiectivul campaniei.

Scenariul 1

Dacă vom colecta mai puțin de 900 $, atunci vom distribui doar versiunea digitală a albumului și va cuprinde 9 piese.

Scenariul 2

Dacă vom reuși să adunăm 1000 $, atunci vom produce 500 de CD-uri având 9 piese înregistrate.

Scenariul 3

Dacă vom reuși să colectăm mai mult de 1000 $, vom completa producția a 500 de CD-uri (9 piese), cu cântece adiționale proporțional cu sumei colectate.

IMPACT

Donația ta contează, indiferent de mărimea acesteia, deoarece ea va crește șansele noastre de a produce prima Compilație de Muzică Alternativă din Moldova și de a promova imaginea tinerilor muzicieni moldoveni în comunitatea artistică internațională.

Într-un final, suntem ferm convinși că investiția noastră în viitorul tinerilor muzicieni se merită pe deplin. Sperăm că sprijinul tău pentru producerea primului album POT Music va aduce această inițiativă la un nou nivel.

Încurajează tinerii artiști moldoveni cu o contribuție și oferă-le un viitor strălucit!

***

Mai multe despre POT Music ca și organizație. Noi am reușit să creăm o comunitate de tineri muzicieni care sunt hotărâți să-și îmbunătățească abilitățile lor de performanță. Pe lângă aceasta, am organizat o serie de ateliere cu profesioniștii din industria muzicală, cu scopul de a le oferi o nouă experiență practică de învățare. Totodată, continuăm să lucrăm la facilitarea accesului acestor trupe la scenele din toată țara, aducând în același timp publicului larg muzică alternativă nouă.

În momentul în care proiectul a devenit un succes, am decis că trebuie să mergem mai departe și să creăm o organizație non-profit, cu accent pe dezvoltarea muzicii alternative din Moldova. Mai mult decât atât, încercăm să aducem muzica mai aproape de tinerii care sunt în dificultate, cum ar fi adolescenții din școlile-internat sau cei din închisoarea pentru minori. Astfel, în 2015 și 2016 am pornit la drum spre școala internat din comuna Popeasca și spre închisoarea pentru minori din Goian cu cîteva trupe din POT, unde le-am organizat cîte un mic concert live.

Mai multe despre POT Music ca și organizație. Noi am reușit să creăm o comunitate de tineri muzicieni care sunt hotărâți să-și îmbunătățească abilitățile lor de performanță. Totodată, continuăm să lucrăm la facilitarea accesului acestor trupe la scenele din toată țara, aducând în același timp publicului larg muzică alternativă nouă.În momentul în care proiectul a devenit un succes, am decis că trebuie să mergem mai departe și să creăm o organizație non-profit, cu accent pe dezvoltarea muzicii alternative din Moldova. Mai mult decât atât, încercăm să aducem muzica mai aproape de tinerii care sunt în dificultate, cum ar fi adolescenții din școlile-internat sau cei din închisoarea pentru minori. Astfel, în 2015 și 2016 am pornit la drum spre școala internat din comuna Popeasca și spre închisoarea pentru minori din Goian cu cîteva trupe din POT, unde le-am organizat cîte un mic concert live.

story:
FreedomsJazz - Festival 2015 available on iTunes

FreedomsJAZZ FESTIVAL 2016 presented by iCanStudioLive is unique Music Performance and Recording on the studio, with interviews, music workshop and demonstration, fans meet and greet, CD and crafts sales, serving of traditional snacks and drinks.

In reason of creating High Quality contents, festival will be held in 17 days of music concerts and themes, from 1 to 17 August 2016.

It’s mean one band (one day) can do more excitement for their music. We provide musician a creative space and supporting them a whole day creative process.

It’s also means, the Production Team have enough time to  maximizing all the technical process along the half day; from  audio-engineering to the video production works, and make sure everything run smoothly. 

Unlike regular music concerts, actually, FreedomsJAZZ FESTIVAL 2016 is a commercial music production that applying industry-standard recording techniques including microphone selection and placement for Live-Studio recording. The result enable us selling music audio and music video at online music store to reach global market.

As optimistically, we can produce 2 music albums, for each containing 9 audio and 9 video tracks. With selected various artist who have a high quality music contents and interpretation.

45’ of performance duration for each show (similar with 4-5 of Original Composition) making us possible to have enough publicity materials to be disseminated into the social media network.

By having those digital assets, we have an open opportunities for the advertiser to be include in product brand campaign.

What makes this program unique is the FREEDOMS, freedom to the both advertisers; The Musician and The Sponsor. Through this Jazz Festival we are welcome individual, related organization or companies to participate. The companies who looking for vehicle to activate their online community; to revitalize their brand recognition or adding more value to the brand by simple social media sharing act to get more post reach. The more people you reach and inspire to join in, the greater your brand's award.

Thank You, iCanStudioLive

Indonesia is full of talented people!

In continuing success of bringing Joey Alexander to his first performance “LOVE, LOSS AND LAUGHTER : THE STORY OF JAZZ”, featuring the Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra with Wynton Marsalis. The momentum of December 29, 2013 has granted us an opportunity producing presentation of sensational skills and prodigious improvisation, then the world’s borders wide open for both Joey and the Studio itself.

At the first two weeks the post reach of 130,000’s viewers on our YouTube Channel, they all come from any corner of the world and it continues moving... from a small dot in the world.

Today, we keep move on, keeping us up from the vision of enabling Indonesia’s Great Talents to present their amazing Idea and Works. We host a number of world-class productions from PRE to POST and meet-ups where businesses can connect and collaborate with talents across the globe.

We owe it to ourself to be the very best, hardworking, well-rounded talents; as we can be fastest and strongest, be worked efficiently, be clear in objective, be enjoyed and appreciated by all who are ready to witness it. We believe success is determined by freedom, whatever it’s mean to you.

Sincerely,

Irsan Wallad, Founder & CEO

story:
Here is a pre-release overview of the album done by the magazine "All About Jazz"

... The album consists of 10 original songs, which are all composed, written, arranged, and produced by Lorens Chuno. Lyrically the songs directly take on issues that are not necessarily related to one another, but come together to form a cohesive body of work. “Come My Way” and “Do Not Call” for instance, address the often tacit negotiations that come with building a relationship and the difficulties of letting go, while the Igbo lyric of “Nuru Onum” calls for dialogue, wisdom, and understanding within a community. “Changing” talks about the intricacies and inevitability of globalization, and “Mr Sabi” pokes fun at how westerners, even when they have good intentions, do not care to understand Africa. “Wait” directly and fearlessly tackles the issues of police brutality and the deep-seated racism in America... The album features well commended jazz talents including bassist John Gray and drummer Michael Vitali. The album also features award winning guitarist Albino Mbie, whom Lionel Loueke has praised as a guitarist that "needs to be heard by the whole world!”, and saxophonist Michael Easton, a well respected protege and collaborator of David Liebman’s. 

Your contribution will go towards:

  • Mixing the songs so that every instrument blends well
  • Mastering the album to make it sound good on all platforms
  • Promotion & Public Relation
  • Making a music video for the song "Wait"

You support will be most valuable especially since the album is already getting rave reviews

 There will be rewards/perks for any amount you contribute. They could include the following:

  • a signed physical cd
  • a handwritten thank you note
  • a customized surprise gift
  • shout-out in cd liner note
  • shout-out on video end credit
  • personal solo concert
  • being named executive producer

story:
Oakland First Fridays Needs You 



Oakland First Fridays has grown from a small one-block street fair to a nationally known force that attracts tens of thousands of Bay Area residents each month to the KONO (Koreatown Northgate) arts district.

Oakland First Fridays runs the festival outdoors in conjunction with Art Murmur's monthly gallery openings, blocking off five city blocks on Telegraph to host nearly 100 arts, artisan, and food vendors for nominal vendor fees.

In addition, our staff curates two stages and up to five performance areas, providing a platform and stipends to dozens of emerging Bay Area performing artists each month.


 

In 2013, the festival grew larger than the community of artists who were running it could support, and the nonprofit business district successfully took over coordinating the festival and has done so for the past three years.

Now we need your help to grow and improve our festival.

The annual cost to run our event is nearing $250,000, which we are currently raising from gate donations, sponsorships, and vendor fees. But this does not include the cost of the additional staff and equipment we need to continue to run our event and deepen our impact.   

This fundraiser will allow us to buy much needed equipment for our local performing arts program, and enable us to hire and retain program staff for rest of  2016 through 2017. All while keeping our event free to the public and affordable for our artisan vendors.

Your support will not only help Oakland First Fridays this year, but for years to come. You will truly brighten our future.



Our Bright Future & Yours 

What we need to build our brighter future! Your donation will go directly to helping us:

Purchase needed stage and sound equipment. We offer a platform to over 100 local up-and-coming performing artists each year. In order to offer a better experience for both our emerging artists and Oakland First Fridays audience, we need to replace our aging sound and stage equipment.

Offer stipends to local artists. We offer our performing artists' stipends to participate in our festival. Help us maintain this program and add a new initiative that will support at least one art installation by an individual or group per month.

Support our Artrepreneurship program. This year, we launched our Artrepreneurship program in partnership with Green Leef and offered Oakland artisan vendors a low-cost 10-week business course. We are continuing this program in 2017, and will be adding free monthly courses for artisans participating in our festival.

Hire and retain program staff. In order for us to do all of the above, we need to hire the staff who will help us with these three tasks: aid and support our participating artisans and artists, run new program initiatives like the Artrepreneurship program, and to cultivate new and impactful partnerships with other Oakland arts organizations.

Keep our event free and vendor fees low. Finally, we want to keep our event free to the public all while retaining low vendor fees for the artisan community. 



What we will do to brighten your future!

For your donation, you will receive some pretty rad limited-edition perks (listed to your right), such as:

A long-lasting, UV-coated 3" by 3" I [heart] Oakland First Fridays Sticker
 

 A pair of shade-throwing Oakland First Fridays Sunglasses
​
An Oakland First Fridays Trucker Hat

A $25 Gift Certificate to Flax art & design Oakland 


 

Why Oakland First Fridays

Oakland First Friday has a deep impact on Oakland's arts, nonprofit, and small-business communities:

In 2015/16, we:

  • Hosted over 100 artisan vendors per month 
  • Were selected by Oakland's community two years in a row as Best Arts and Culture Festival through the East Bay Express' Best of the East Bay poll.
  • Featured over 100 performers | 30% received stipends to perform
  • Partnered with and supported over two dozen nonprofit arts organizations including Betti Ono Gallery, Nomadic Press, Chapter 510 & the Dept. of Make Believe, and more.
  • Provided 6 individuals a 10-week art-focused business course
  • Welcomed 20K+ visitors per month to our footprint who then support our artisans and help our small businesses thrive.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't give, there are other ways to make our future bright:

  • Volunteer. We depend on dozens of volunteers to work our monthly festival. Help us greet people at our gates, run our donation-based sake and beer garden, manage our stages, and set up and break down. Food, fun, friends, and T-shirts provided!
  • Like us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, then invite all your friends, family, and frenemies to do the same.
  • Share this campaign. With folks far and wide. Anyone in Oakland (or not in Oakland) who loves our event.

story:
James Bond Concert Spectacular


Although we are primarily a corporate and function band, in the past few years we have been taking our show into theatres to give our fans and followers a chance to come and see us live.  At the same time, we have appeared at several Bond fan events such as the On The Tracks Of 007 event at the Pinewood Hotel in 2015.

We regularly get messages and emails from all around the World from people who would like to see us in their country, but due to the costs involved, we are unable to take our show to many of the places requested - including the US for example.

We are bringing in some top industry experts to bring this idea to fruition - including a sound engineer who worked on the last 3 James Bond soundtracks.


What We Need & What You Get

We need the funding to cover the costs of the project.  To produce the highest professional output we can, the costs are large.

We also want to make sure the stream and product is guaranteed.

What is going to come from this project:

  • The show will be available as a stream for just over 24 hours from 1900 28th November to 2359 29th November 2016.  You will be able to start watching the stream (from the start of the show) at any point in that period.
  • In addition, available in January 2017 will be a DVD and CDs of the show.  The DVDs will contain all the individual tracks performed, but not the compere spots and not the James Bond Radio presentation - for these you will need to watch the live show.
  • We have a variety of perks available, including access to the stream (you will need to pay to get an access code), copies of the DVD/CD and other great options too.

Risks & Challenges


To guarantee the streams (to ensure a good connection), and make sure our fans around the World can see the show, we are uploading and streaming the show for just over 24 hours after the show.  No matter where you are in the World, you will be able to begin the show and watch it as live, within that period.

We very much want to give the feel of the live show - which is why we are only offering it in this method in this time period, after that, an edited down DVD will be available.


Set List:


James Bond Theme

From Russia With Love

Goldfinger

Thunderball

Mr Kiss Kiss Bang Bang

On Her Majesty’s Secret Service

We Have All The Time In The World

Diamonds Are Forever

Live & Let Die

The Man With The Golden Gun

For Your Eyes Only

A View To A Kill

Nobody Does It Better

Bond 77

The Living Daylights

Where Has Everybody Gone

Licence To Kill

Goldeneye

Tomorrow Never Dies

Moby Remix

The World Is Not Enough

Backseat Driver

You Know My Name

Another Way To Die

Skyfall

Writing’s On The Wall

James Bond Theme (short/finale version)

Encore; Surrender

story:
Short Summary

  • My Name is Jay Brown and I am the founder of Greenstone Festival.
  • This festival is a place where we congregate every year to celebrate music from emerging and up and coming artists! As we know life has its twists and turns and it's always nice to know that every year we can get together in one place and celebrate each others talents and build a space that grows every year with new people leaving inspired, with new friends and new ideas.
  • By giving to greenstone you will help keep that vision and feeling alive!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:


We need 1500£

500£ will go to a marquee

500£ will go to the sound system

500£ will go to paying for staffing


The rest of the festival will be self -funded

  • We have partnered up with some great boutiques so we have bags, hats, free meal tickets, festival tickets to give away to contributors!!
  • If we don't reach our full target the funds will still go directly to the festival!

The Impact

This project is valuable because we think it's important to promote emerging artists and offer a place to share new music with people who love and care for quality music! We also like to share beautiful moments like this to inspire each other and spread our GreenLove!. 

  • Risks & Challenges
  • Everything is in place with our festival! Bands are confirmed and everything is up and running. We just need these last financial bits to be covered.

  • Other Ways You Can Help

We understand why some people are unable to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can get the word out for us by follwing us on our campaigns on Instagram. 'Greenstone Festival' 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Join in helping me share my music with the world!

     Hi, I'm Missy Balsam, and I am so excited and grateful that you are here in support of my Indiegogo Campaign! For those of you who don't know me yet, I am a singer/songwriter, mantra music artist and yoga teacher. My passion is sharing what I have learned on my spiritual journey to uplift and inspire others. Believe it or not, I spent many years working in the corporate world in New York City and Los Angeles in a stressful, high-level marketing and sales career. I was "successful," but I felt that something was missing and that I wasn't living my true purpose. I took a leap of faith, decided to follow my heart and began teaching yoga full-time. During my yoga journey, I fell in love with kirtan (the singing of mantras and divine names), and the joy and bliss I discovered from this practice led me to write my own songs that came from deep within my soul. My music invites you into my personal journey of healing, growth and self-discovery. My deepest intention is that it brings hope and joy to everyone who listens to it.

How to help: 

     I have been in the studio for several months working on this album. I am pouring all of my heart, soul, energy and resources into making this music the best it can possibly be. It's amazing how much goes into making an album! That is why I have created this campaign - to raise the funds necessary to complete this project. By contributing to my campaign, it will enable me to finish recording, mixing, and mastering the album. YOUR help will also go towards its manufacturing and distribution. My goal is to share my music beyond the yoga community and bring healing and empowerment to a wider audience. 

Give and you shall receive (perks):

We have some wonderful rewards available for you to choose from, including digital downloads, signed copies of the CD, having your name listed in the liner notes, private yoga/spiritual coaching sessions with me, and more!

You can contribute as little as $10, which is essentially an advance purchase of a download of the album, or make larger contributions for even greater perks. Any amount you contribute will be so greatly appreciated and will help make my dream a reality.

Please note: All rewards will be sent out after the album is complete.


Here are more ways you can help!

Having a community of supporters like you who believe in me and my music is incredibly powerful. Your help in sharing the word about my campaign is invaluable. Every mention on social media makes a huge difference, and will carry the message out far and wide. You can use the Indiegogo share tools in order to help spread the word by email, Twitter, Facebook and more! Thank you so much for your loving support!

From my heart to yours, Missy

My music invites you into my personal journey of healing, growth and self-discovery. My deepest intention is that it brings hope and joy to everyone who listens to it.


How to help: 
     I have been in the studio for several months working on this album. I am pouring all of my heart, soul, energy and resources into making this music the best it can possibly be. It's amazing how much goes into making an album! That is why I have created this campaign - to raise the funds necessary to complete this project. By contributing to my campaign, it will enable me to finish recording, mixing, and mastering the album. YOUR help will also go towards its manufacturing and distribution. My goal is to share my music beyond the yoga community and bring healing and empowerment to a wider audience. 
Give and you shall receive (perks):
We have some wonderful rewards available for you to choose from, including digital downloads, signed copies of the CD, having your name listed in the liner notes, private yoga/spiritual coaching sessions with me, and more!
You can contribute as little as $10, which is essentially an advance purchase of a download of the album, or make larger contributions for even greater perks. Any amount you contribute will be so greatly appreciated and will help make my dream a reality.
Please note: All rewards will be sent out after the album is complete.





Here are more ways you can help!
Having a community of supporters like you who believe in me and my music is incredibly powerful. Your help in sharing the word about my campaign is invaluable. Every mention on social media makes a huge difference, and will carry the message out far and wide. You can use the Indiegogo share tools in order to help spread the word by email, Twitter, Facebook and more! Thank you so much for your loving support!
From my heart to yours, Missy

story:
Clarity

I have been making music since I was 9 years old. Music has given me a chance to express myself and create something that speaks to anyone who is going through something in their lives. Now I have a chance to finally release my first album Clarity. It has taken me years to get to this point, I wrote, recorded, mixed and mastered the entire thing myself. With the help of my team, AKA Management, we have a chance to get my music in the hands of someone who needs to hear it.

Why We Need Your Support

 With the money that we raise here, we are going to be able to:
  - Press the album, which includes a professionally designed booklet. (250.00)
  - Buy Promotional material, including: Shirts, Posters,  Digital Download cards for the album and vinyl. (300.00)
  - Help me and the band get to the first few dates on the Clarity release tour.
 - Record a music video for the first single "Fates Melody" (500.00)
 

Risks & Challenges

 I am lucky enough to be working with a talented marketing and management team to help me with everything from social media to getting press for the project. There are going to be some bumps along the way, the music industry does have its fair share of surprises. Along with my education in music management, we are going to do everything that we can to make sure this project meets its full potential.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get on to social media and spread my message, anything done here today will only help further my dream.

Don't forget to come out to the shows and show your support!

story:
Short Summary

Jenna Syde & The Watchers need the help of our Watcher Army members to tour across the U.S. in the spring of 2017

  • We are Jenna Syde & The Watchers, a 5 piece, female fronted, hard rock act from Hollywood, California
  • We have a new album we want to play for the public but touring funds are short when you are a small, independent band.
  • With your contribution we will be able to keep touring cost out of our own pockets which means we can: Pay for our van rental, sleeping arrangements, gas, food and still be able to pay our bills and feed our families when we come home.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are hoping to hit a total of $6000 by the end of our campaign. $2500 goes to van rental, $1000 to gas, $500 food, $1000 for motels, $1000 for emergency expenses, example.... van breakdown, medical issues, equipment breakdown or stolen gear.
  • Our perks range from personal video thank yous to signed musical gear and all are sent our with an extra piece of swag you can only get from this campaign.
  • if we don't meet our goal we will still use the funds we have raised to help us along the way but of course we will have to pull some cash out of our own pockets ( because when we set out to do something we freaking do it no matter what!)

The Impact

The impact of your contribution means we get to spread our music to a much wider audience and grow our bands fan base in places we wouldn't normally be able to reach.

  • In this day and age where people sit on their phones and computers all day we believe that live music, art, and performances are the last thing that truly bring us all together.
  • Our summer campaign two years ago nearly doubled our fan base and our music was able to reach people all across the west coast and south west from ages 5-85 years old.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you cant help.

  • even if you cant afford to contribute just getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign is a huge help!
  • You can share our indiegogo campaign through all social media platforms, text, email and even your own blogs.

We thank you so much for your time and hope you rock your faces off out on the road!

story:
More about the project:

No-land Bands is a series of four concerts of improvised music. Each event will be dedicated to stories of one city in the Middle East. There will be at least two performers with Middle Eastern instruments who are familiar with the music of the area and will define the main theme of the performance. The themes will be free melodic interpretations of known traditional motifs or tunes from that area.  

The musical experience will be accompanied by a visual journey as well. We will be working with visual artists to produce video art installation which will be projected on a screen during the show. The video art will be inspired by the city that will be be presented in the Middle East. Through this setting, a triangular relationship between audience, musicians and places is being shaped. The musical and visual experience will literally put the audience in those places, transforming  their understanding of a specific geographical location. These short journeys will take away all the abstraction and numbness of what we hear on everyday news , and replace it with a humane and tangible experience.

 

Who I am:

I am an architect and a part-time musician interested in community based projects. Taking into account the recent events in Syria, as well as ongoing struggle of refugees all over the world, I understand that it is important to bring awareness towards these issues. This understanding inspired me to create a project that would unite like-minded musicians towards a noble goal. Being originally from Iran, I know how important it is to promote intercultural understanding.

 

What We Need & What You Get:

A major portion of funding for this project will be dedicated to creative expenses, since it will be crucial that the collaborating artists and musicians are well compensated and able to produce their best work. We are hopeful that the outcome of this project will be a valuable asset in the cultural landscape of our era.

The outcome though, will not be limited  to a series of live performances. Therefore the quality of production and documentation of the work is quite important. Our goal is to have an impact on as large an audience as possible, making investment in publicity materials and the distribution of video and audio recordings is vital to the success of the project.

The minimum basic costs of each event will be approximately $2,500 which includes musicians’ fees, video art production and video and audio recording of the event.

If we go beyond our campaign goal, we will be producing an album from the selected musics produced during the entire length of the project. The cost of the album production will be approximately $2,500. Our supporters will receive a free copy of the album as soon as it is published.

Please check out our perks section and see what you get from us for your contribution.

The Impact:

One of the key aspects of this project is using music as a metaphor to reveal the possibility of peaceful dialogue between different nations and cultures. Music, as a universal language, has no borders, yet different music can resonate together. As one of the most important outcome of this project, at least 4 hours of original music will be produced and distributed, which can make an effective impact on the perspective of people and politicians dealing with some of the world’s current crisis.

Other Ways You Can Help:

- Please share this campaign with your network of friends, family and coworkers.

- If you are a musician or artist and you would like to contribute to this project, we definitely welcome you! Please send us an email and tell us how you would like to contribute.

 

- If you know any organization or institute which might be interested in sponsoring or supporting this project please let us know.

 

- If you know any venue, rehearsal space or recording studio that might be willing to support this project or you can facilitate a relationship with them, please share it with us.


Email address:  nima.farzaneh@no-landbands.com

story:
Read more about my campaign:

  • My name is Ashton York and I was born and raised here in Northern California. I've been surrounded by music my whole life. I began writing songs and playing different instruments by the time I was 11, and now at 22, I still have the same passion for playing as I always have.
  • This EP is made up of my strongest batch of songs yet, focusing on themes like friendship, family, faith/doubt, and life as a young adult. All of my favorite records are the ones in which the artist invites the listener into something that feels real. "You Are My Sanity" is an honest reflection of my story, and is something I'm confident many people will relate to. These songs are 100% me, and I couldn't be happier with them.
  • If you contribute, you're contributing to my future in music. This EP will be a giant stepping stone and tool in order to pursue a career in music.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Here's why my EP is going to cost $8,000. A large portion of the funds are going towards studio time and hiring studio musicians. Five full days (10 hours) in the studio will cost on average (for audio engineer, musicians, recording studio fee) approximately $800, split between two studios. This recording process alone will cost $4,000. Then the mixing process will cost roughly $3,500 altogether for 7 songs. This is adds up to $7,500 total, which doesn't cover mastering costs. 
  • If I make my $8,000 goal, every contributor will receive a free pre-download of the final product upon completion. The point of this campaign is to get some great music out for the world to hear. I am more than happy to give you the EP for free and in advance of the release date if you contribute. Of course, every contributor will receive a proper thank you whether or not I make my goal. 
  • If we raise $10,000, I will be able to include a song that didn't quite make the cut for my $8,000 minimum. It's called "Anymore" and I'm crazy about it. If we raise $15,000, I will be able to invest in artwork and hard copies of the album. Physical CD's are always a plus, and I would include a really beautiful lyric booklet, something I've dreamed of for a long time.
  • If we do not make all $8,000 within the 30 days alotted, I will still be able to get started on the EP and book some studio time, which would still be incredibly helpful.

Risks & Challenges

Honestly, the only thing that has prohibited me from making this album sooner, is lack of funds. I have been supporting myself completely since the age of 18. I work really hard, but on top of the cost of living, this project would take a long time to complete without your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • The best support possible, on top of contributing, is word of mouth! It would be so helpful if you participated with me in sharing and talking to other people about my project. Even if you don't contribute, spreading the word with family and friends would mean the world to me.
  • Though it might not be as effective as word of mouth, sharing this on social media is another HUGE help. I appreciate each and every effort to get the word out. Thank you again for your support!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who am I?

I am a music teacher by day, wedding singer by night. Think of me like a Clark Kent of musicians, except I’m not a man...And I’m also not allergic to kryptonite. 

I am a classically trained percussionist, which means if its something you hit, I can play it: xylophone, timpani, cymbals, gongs, brake drums, you name it. I play the piano too. For this project, I am shedding all of the formality of classical music and focusing on cathartic vocals, sick grooves and interesting sounding instruments.

 

 

What am I?

I am blues and jazz influenced. I adore writing with jazzy chords, but I always like to have my songs anchored in a good solid groove, and a nice soulful, gritty vocal. Think Amy Winehouse meets John Bonham (minus the addiction problems).

 

 

What is it?

I have written a collection of songs, some old, some new and one cover.

Two of the songs are slated to be featured in an episode of Netflix’s upcoming Mindhunter series, Produced by David Fincher and Charlize Theron, directed by Andrew Douglas.

 

 

About the featured song:

Scared of My Shadow We've all had those moments, or those days, (or those weeks!), when we hate our job, or hate how we look, or something else about ourselves. The best way I know how to cope with those days is to accept where I am and what I’ve done to get myself there, acknowledge that it sucks, and then take a deep breath and deal with it. This song is about those days. Fighting the nightmare. 

 

 

The Meaning of My Music

I believe in writing about the human condition, and not limiting myself to writing happy songs, but ones that come from where we have all been that we’d rather not go back to. Not songs that have been watered down to please everyone based on a marketing algorithm, but real songs about real things. 

 

 

Why are you contributing?

Your contribution not only helps my music come to life, it also makes you feel good about yourself. Back in the days of the Renaissance, the Medicis funded Michelangelo’s greatest works. You could be just like them! Wouldn’t that make you feel good? 

 

 

What I Need: The Breakdown

$6,000 = Six songs at $1,000 a song

$2,046 = Digital downloads and vinyl pressing

$1,200 = Musician fees for the band on the day(s) of recording

$465 = 5% Indiegogo transaction fee

$277 = 3% Credit card transaction fee

 $9,985 = Total ... which I'll round up to an even

$10,000 because I will probably buy the band some Jimmy John's

 

 

What if I don’t get all the funding?

If by some tragedy my goal is not met, don’t worry. The remaining funds acquired will still be used to record as many songs as budget will allow. It will be a shorter, and more potent project. 

 

 

What if I get EXTRA funding?

First of all, that would be awesome, thanks to y'all! I have a few more songs that could fit the project. Don't you want to see what else I can come up with with an extra couple G's?

 

 

Risks & Challenges: Mitigating Costs

Recording for some bands can be a long and difficult process, with a lot of trial and error involved. I plan on minimizing time spent recording as possible by planning meticulously what needs to go into each song beforehand. My training as a classical musician helps greatly with this compositional side of music making. 

 

 

What if you Can't Give? Here are some other ways you can help.

Do you like what you hear? Do you like my message? Spread the word! Share on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, your book club, or your grandmother’s knitting group, anything!

 

 

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Earthcore is Australia’s pioneering dance music, lifestyle, culture, arts, festival experience. Set on 1500 acres of pristine land in rural Victoria  featuring 5 epic stages, District 13 Theme Stage Zone, Boutique Camping, Worlds Beyond Speakers Forum, Fractured Reality Art Zone, Yellow Sunshine Chill Out, Muffplex Cinema, Elemental Planet Lifestyle City,  DIY Social Calendar, Kinky Karnival Freak Show, Mind Bending Art Installations, your closest mates and you!

Since 1993, Earthcore has seen punters descend on the lush Pyalong surrounds to enjoy five days of music, arts, and entertainment in an environment that is open, welcoming, and makes for an unforgettable experience. 4000 people became 8000 people and the whole country sat up and paid attention. 8000 people: 18,000 people!, dependent on mind set this social experiment or underground oddity holds responsibility for paving the way for Australia's Outdoor party industry.

Year after year Earthcore delivers a line up of the world's biggest names in electronic music and superstars that have inspired generations, while also seeking to bring out the new faces making waves & destroying dance floors all around the country and world.

Milleniem Falcon Project proudly works with Earthcore by setting up District 13 Theme Camp Stage 'Wax Of The Worlds' showcasing talented artists of many form which include Electronic Music Producers, Vocalists, Vinyl DJ's, Visual Artists, Hula Hoopers, Dancers and more......

A big thanks going out to Arts SA, The Beatbox & The Salty Lime Cafe for the support given to make this venture possible.

Click on our sponsors web links..

Earthcore Links

http://www.earthcore.com.au/

http://www.earthcore.com.au/news/wax-of-worlds-...

Last year's SOLD OUT Earthcore Festival drew a huge 6,000 electronic music lovers to outback Victoria for 5 days of solid dancing to nothing but the worlds hottest DJ's & Producers. 2016 horizons are expansive and ticket sales are expected to reach a whopping 8,000 – 10,000, marking Earthcore yet again as Australia's biggest festival of this kind.

November 2015, deep in the midst of the theme camps of District 13 the 'Milleniem Falcom Project' debut stage 'Wax Of The Worlds' rose to fame, 3 vinyl turntables, a mixer a line up of emerging DJ's, UFO and infinity mirror art installations along with a a truck load of wax was all that was required to make the lasting impression upon Earthcore it has.

The recent news of our successful submission to host 'Wax Of The Worlds' 100% Vinyl stage at the 2016 festival has all involved brimming with excitement, emerging Aussie DJ's are fine tuning, designs our visual artists are presenting for installations this year are out of this world, our lighting, audio and set up crew are comparing all the latest gizmo's. This will be an event of career defining moments for many of us MFP crew.

Intent to expand our stages capabilities, kick start careers by being able to offer a wider range of talented individuals the chance to perform alongside a line up of the worlds most highly acclaimed electronic musicians and acts is the reason I write to you and your business. We need support, limited place of sponsorship are on offer to the like minded who share MFP's core values and ethics, driven by passion for music who hold desire in assisting musician and artists reach their dreams.  

This crowdfunding campaign includes almost all avenues we are undertaking to raise a minimum of $6500

Funds will be used for Audio, Equipment, Lighting, Art Installations for 'Wax Of The Worlds', we hope to raise enough in order to pay for transportation costs to get our artists to the festival.

This campaign entails several different levels of support options..

Informal Support - $25 Sticker Bundle, $50 Photo Pack, $75 USB, $100 T-Shirt (& Stickers) and $200 Combined Sticker, Photo, USB and T-Shirt Bundle. These options are aimed at the families, friends and neighbors of the artists and DJ's involved, a support option for all who wish to contribute in assisting our artists successfully achieve their dreams.

Punters Support - $299 Ticket to Earthcore Festival 2016, $500 Play a set at Earthcore 2016. These options are for the party people. Aspiring vinyl DJs who wish to book themselves a gig of a lifetime, and for lovers of the music who wish to book a ticket to the festival of a lifetime.

Corporate Support - $500, $800 & $1000 Donation Options and 2 Major Sponsor Packages Valued at $4000each. These packages are aimed at like minded businesses seeking to exposure their business to the attendees of Earthcore, online followers and Adelaide after party attendees. The reach is far and wide - a marketing opportunity not to be missed with 8,000 – 10,000 tickets expected to be sold and a whopping 122,200+ online followers.

All funds will be used wisely and after the event an expenditure budget will be available to all who request to see where funds were allocated and used.

We will be going to the event regardless, rain, hail, sunshine or tornado, but to actually construct a stage with notability we need all the help we can get.

Email:milleniemfalconproject@outlook.com

Thank you for your time!
story_txt:
Earthcore is Australia’s pioneering dance music, lifestyle, culture, arts, festival experience. Set on 1500 acres of pristine land in rural Victoria  featuring 5 epic stages, District 13 Theme Stage Zone, Boutique Camping, Worlds Beyond Speakers Forum, Fractured Reality Art Zone, Yellow Sunshine Chill Out, Muffplex Cinema, Elemental Planet Lifestyle City,  DIY Social Calendar, Kinky Karnival Freak Show, Mind Bending Art Installations, your closest mates and you!
Since 1993, Earthcore has seen punters descend on the lush Pyalong surrounds to enjoy five days of music, arts, and entertainment in an environment that is open, welcoming, and makes for an unforgettable experience. 4000 people became 8000 people and the whole country sat up and paid attention. 8000 people: 18,000 people!, dependent on mind set this social experiment or underground oddity holds responsibility for paving the way for Australia's Outdoor party industry.
Year after year Earthcore delivers a line up of the world's biggest names in electronic music and superstars that have inspired generations, while also seeking to bring out the new faces making waves & destroying dance floors all around the country and world.
Milleniem Falcon Project proudly works with Earthcore by setting up District 13 Theme Camp Stage 'Wax Of The Worlds' showcasing talented artists of many form which include Electronic Music Producers, Vocalists, Vinyl DJ's, Visual Artists, Hula Hoopers, Dancers and more......
A big thanks going out to Arts SA, The Beatbox & The Salty Lime Cafe for the support given to make this venture possible.
Click on our sponsors web links..



Earthcore Links
http://www.earthcore.com.au/
http://www.earthcore.com.au/news/wax-of-worlds-...
Last year's SOLD OUT Earthcore Festival drew a huge 6,000 electronic music lovers to outback Victoria for 5 days of solid dancing to nothing but the worlds hottest DJ's & Producers. 2016 horizons are expansive and ticket sales are expected to reach a whopping 8,000 – 10,000, marking Earthcore yet again as Australia's biggest festival of this kind.
November 2015, deep in the midst of the theme camps of District 13 the 'Milleniem Falcom Project' debut stage 'Wax Of The Worlds' rose to fame, 3 vinyl turntables, a mixer a line up of emerging DJ's, UFO and infinity mirror art installations along with a a truck load of wax was all that was required to make the lasting impression upon Earthcore it has.

story:
The Mai 68s

The Mai 68s were an indiepop band - Formed in Leicester in 2006 by Julie, Jonathan, Zac and Jeremy they set out a stall of fuzzy noisy revolutionary indiepop songs that soon caused the world to fall at their feet.

Self described as -  ‘the sound of Dinosaur Jr if fronted by Ulrike Meinhof, the Ramones if they sniffed C86 comps rather than glue, and the band Phil Spector would have loved if he hadn’t gone the whole Starsailor/gunningpeopledownthang route (allegedly)’ the Mais soon acquired a number of legendary collaborators including one 'Slaughter' Joe Foster (JAMC, TVPs, Creation Records) who lent his legendary production skills to their debut (Cloudberry Records) double A side - Froth on the Day Dream / Lead Me To A Quiet Cell. 
Many gigs followed - including a now legendary set at Indietracks Festival, a number of EPs ( Histoire Du Guerilla Urbain and Froth on the Daydream ) and then with a 7" due on Cloudberry Records of Paper and Sticks came silence. 
Fast forward 10 years a compilation has been put together containing the complete Mai 68s recordings from their short existence. 
This comp lovingly remastered is due to be released on 180gm vinyl with sleeve notes by Roque from Cloudberry records and a full colour booklet / fanzine collecting together many exclusive and never before seen photos and items from the Mai 68s archive.
'If The Jesus and Mary Chain were the session musicians for Young Marble Giants, they'd sound like The Mai 68s: enigmatic, sweet, noisy, wonderful.' - http://www.spiralscratchpop.com/
https://soundcloud.com/crazyharry/sets/the-mai-68s


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The goal is set at £1000 - This is to cover the pressing of the vinyl and to ensure that the compilation is the quality it deserves.
  • As well as the compilation there is a number of other items in the Mai 68s Archive available including several unique live sets which are also available. 

Risks & Challenges

  • There are very few risks to this project - the songs are recorded and already remastered. The artwork is complete. The only real issue would be a delay with the pressing times (for example RSD) 
  • Once the campaign is completed all contributors will receive a download of the compilation and then the record once it is received back from the pressing plant and will also receive an invite to the one off launch party to be held in London. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like this campaign but feel that you can't contribute ( and we understand money is very tight these days) then you can help out by sharing this campaign amongst your friends and even your enemies.
