story:
About This Campaign

Hi! I'm Crystal King, an aspiring singer/songwriter that needs your help to produce and release my first official debut album! I've been writing original music since I was 7, but was always too shy to share it to anyone outside of the family until 2 years ago. I wrote and performed an original song at a showcase, which led to me recording my first single. Over the past year, I've come out with 5 singles available on my website or iTunes. But now I want to take my music to another level.

Why We Need Your Help

You can check out some of my other music up on my website: http://www.crystalkingmusic.com

I plan on recording my debut album this summer but I need your help! I managed to record the first song off the album, "Unstoppable" Take a listen below to get a feel of how the album will sound like.


But recording a 12 song album won't be cheap! Your donation will cover the following costs of putting together an album. 

Recording - costs for booking the studio, hiring musicians, producing and the actual recording process

Mixing - every song has to be personally mixed to create the right balance between instruments and vocals

Mastering - every song will be mastered together to create a cohesive sound for the overall album

Ordering physical CDs - costs for processing, copying, and shipping all the CDs

Merchandise - other merchandise such as T-shirts and posters

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word by sharing this page with friends and family!

This is a very important campaign to me, so I hope you are able to help by donating! Every little bit counts! 

 Thank You!

           Crystal King

story:
Who is Drifter?

Identity: Complex  Genre: Virtually undefinable

Coming from a diverse ethnic and geographical background, the music of DrifterShapeShifter is informed by totality. Not just in music, but also in life. From Hip Hop and rock to Reggae, Folk and Jazz- the influences are boundless. From comic books to genetics; history to philosophy and back to politics; the influences of life and lived experiences follow suit. So what is DrifterShapeShifter? The particular question can only be answered by you, and don't be surprised if your answer ends up changing... a couple of times..

 


What Do I Need?

 Hey, friends! In order to get my project in the hands of people everywhere, I with the help of my team, need to raise enough money to accomplish a few goals.
- 250.00 to press 100 copies of the album
- 250.00 to pay for the album release party space
- 150.00 For initial promotional materials
- 500.00 Help get to the first few shows
As you can see the initial costs add up! We need all the help we can get to reach our initial goal of $500.00.
  

YOLO Hard AF

 A little over a year and a half ago, I moved to LA to pursue my career as a musician. It's been a ride. There have been ups and downs... but I would be lying if I said that the rollercoaster hasn't been Amazing. This music release is a big step in my journey. I give all of you so much love and gratitude for believing me and supporting me thus far. Dreams, here I come!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Go to driftershapeshifter.com and share my project with your friends!

story:
Voces de Santa Rosa

 

Voces de Santa Rosa tiene sus orígenes en la agrupación Aguinalderos de Santa Rosa, creada en 1991, por la iniciativa de Delfina Volcanes quien conjuntamente con Jesús Arturo Parra y Alirio Zambrano, le dan cabida a este proyecto con el objetivo de alegrar los tiempos de navidad y ofrecer una actividad de provecho para todos los niños de la comunidad. 

En el año 2001, algunos de sus exintegrantes deciden emprender una nueva etapa y conforman la agrupación Voces de Santa Rosa con la intención de ampliar sus horizontes, incursionando en otros géneros musicales del folklore latinoamericano y venezolano que les permiten mostrarse durante todo el año y en otros escenarios.

A lo largo de los años Voces de Santa Rosa, se ha propuesto preservar los valores de la música andina, difundir las creaciones de los compositores de la localidad y cuidar de su trabajo artístico principalmente en lo referido al canto.

Así mismo, la polifonía ha sido incorporada para disfrutar de un resultado, que ha permitido darle nuevos acabados, proyección y novedad a su trabajo.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xoJk80GKO1U

La agrupación se ha destacado en diversos festivales realizados a nivel estadal y nacional obteniendo premiaciones como mejor coro, mejor voz solista, mejor canción inédita, y mejor instrumentista, entre otros. También ha tenido la oportunidad de compartir espacios de formación e intercambio con agrupaciones de renombre a nivel nacional e internacional, representantes de música tradicional y contemporánea venezolana entre los que se encuentran: Vasallos de Venezuela, Los Parranderos de Mendoza, Agrupación Pomarrosa y C4trío.

Esta agrupación se caracteriza por realizar gran parte de su trabajo creativo y musical, con ese esfuerzo se da paso a la primera producción discográfica cuyo resultado es un homenaje a la música decembrina venezolana y a nuestra fundadora Delfina Volcanes, personaje que por muchos años persevero para llevar a cabo este proyecto musical.

 

Nuestra Campaña

IrecordVocesdeSantaRosa como hemos titulado nuestra campaña, es la proyección internacional de nuestra agrupación, es la oportunidad para dar a conocer nuestra historia, nuestra vida, nuestra música. Es un capítulo que nos permitirá completar el presupuesto y cristalizar nuestra primera producción discográfica para llenar todos los espacios posibles con la música que hemos interpretado desde muy niñas.

IrecordVocesdeSantaRosa, es un espacio para que todos sean parte de nuestro proyecto contribuyendo en la culminación de un disco que representa un gran tesoro para interpretes, compositores y arreglistas de nuestra agrupación.

Es importante destacar, que con un esfuerzo inicial, se pudo llevar a cabo la grabación de  los arreglos vocales, pero no fue suficiente para concluir el proyecto de la manera que se había planteado, para nosotros es muy importante esta campaña, pues representa una apuesta que permitirá lograr un sueño por el que se ha trabajado durante años.

¿Qué obtenemos con su participación?

A través de la participación de todos los colaboradores, será posible un disco con atributos muy especiales, estarán en calidad de invitados cantantes e instrumentistas de renombre del mundo y de nuestro país con los que hemos compartido escenarios, así como la participación de ingenieros de sonido que harán posible las mezclas de nuestros temas con la mejor calidad que podamos ofrecer.

Será posible también, el diseño de una imagen fresca y natural que se verá materializada en el empaque del disco que todos podrán disfrutar en una presentación digital y en físico.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Esta campaña ofrece una serie de recompensas con la que los contribuyentes podrán elegir como colaborar, esta será una forma de acercarnos aún mas a todos aquellos que quieran concretar su participación. Nuestras recompensas son especialmente diseñadas para este proyecto, la más sorprendente de todas, es nuestro cuatro venezolano instrumento que se presenta como recompensa debido a su tracendencia para acompañar todos los géneros musicales existentes en nuestro país.

Para lograr todo lo referido anteriormente, se requiere de un presupuesto de 18.000 $ monto que será distribuido en los gastos de: horas de grabación en estudio , honorarios de algunos músicos, edición mezcla y masterización, diseño de la imagen, reproducción  del disco y recompensas. Todos estos gastos están contemplados para ser ejecutados dentro del país y en algunos casos fuera de él debido a las dificultades que actualmente se manejan con la situación del país. 

Esta campaña viene respaldada de un material audiovisual hecho por un equipo extraordinario de personas entre los que destacan los reconocidos  cineastas John y Javier Márquez, Nataly Higton, Radarani Gómez y Glenda Mendoza. En dicho material se recoge una pequeña muestra musical de nuestro disco, y la petición expresa de cada uno de sus integrantes a que todo aquel que se anime nos ayude con su contribución.

Cualquier contribución por pequeña que sea tendrá una repercusión importante para nuestro proyecto, soñamos con un disco de la mejor calidad, con la participación de músicos, técnicos y diseñadores que puedan llenarnos de mucha satisfacción, alegría y orgullo.

En caso de no cumplir el 100% de la meta planteada, nos veremos limitados a ejecutar el plan como se tiene previsto, sin embargo, el porcentaje que se obtenga será destinado para culminar el proyecto de la mejor manera posible.

Los más valioso de culminar este proyecto, es el aporte que se hará a través del registro y difusión de nuestra música popular venezolana, el mundo podrá disfrutar de un trabajo cultivado por años que se caracteriza por conservar elementos muy tradicionales con fusión de música contemporánea.

Nuestros principales riesgos y desafíos, están relacionados en principio con las dificultades enmarcadas en la situación socio política que atraviesa Venezuela, las limitaciones en cuanto a las telecomunicaciones comprometen la buena comunicación o relación con nuestros colaborados a lo largo de la campaña. Se tomarán las previsiones para que esto no nos afecte de manera significativa, a través de la contratación de servicios privados que proporcionen internet.

Existen formas muy útiles de colaborar, la más valiosa de todas es que compartas en tu circulo de amigos y conocidos el link de nuestra campaña junto a una invitación para que otros al igual que tu sean protagonistas de esta historia.
story_txt: Voces de Santa Rosa Voces de Santa Rosa tiene sus orígenes en la agrupación Aguinalderos de Santa Rosa, creada en 1991, por la iniciativa de Delfina Volcanes quien conjuntamente con Jesús Arturo Parra y Alirio Zambrano, le dan cabida a este proyecto con el objetivo de alegrar los tiempos de navidad y ofrecer una actividad de provecho para todos los niños de la comunidad. En el año 2001, algunos de sus exintegrantes deciden emprender una nueva etapa y conforman la agrupación Voces de Santa Rosa con la intención de ampliar sus horizontes, incursionando en otros géneros musicales del folklore latinoamericano y venezolano que les permiten mostrarse durante todo el año y en otros escenarios.A lo largo de los años Voces de Santa Rosa, se ha propuesto preservar los valores de la música andina, difundir las creaciones de los compositores de la localidad y cuidar de su trabajo artístico principalmente en lo referido al canto.Así mismo, la polifonía ha sido incorporada para disfrutar de un resultado, que ha permitido darle nuevos acabados, proyección y novedad a su trabajo.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xoJk80GKO1ULa agrupación se ha destacado en diversos festivales realizados a nivel estadal y nacional obteniendo premiaciones como mejor coro, mejor voz solista, mejor canción inédita, y mejor instrumentista, entre otros. También ha tenido la oportunidad de compartir espacios de formación e intercambio con agrupaciones de renombre a nivel nacional e internacional, representantes de música tradicional y contemporánea venezolana entre los que se encuentran: Vasallos de Venezuela, Los Parranderos de Mendoza, Agrupación Pomarrosa y C4trío.Esta agrupación se caracteriza por realizar gran parte de su trabajo creativo y musical, con ese esfuerzo se da paso a la primera producción discográfica cuyo resultado es un homenaje a la música decembrina venezolana y a nuestra fundadora Delfina Volcanes, personaje que por muchos años persevero para llevar a cabo este proyecto musical. Nuestra CampañaIrecordVocesdeSantaRosa como hemos titulado nuestra campaña, es la proyección internacional de nuestra agrupación, es la oportunidad para dar a conocer nuestra historia, nuestra vida, nuestra música. Es un capítulo que nos permitirá completar el presupuesto y cristalizar nuestra primera producción discográfica para llenar todos los espacios posibles con la música que hemos interpretado desde muy niñas.IrecordVocesdeSantaRosa, es un espacio para que todos sean parte de nuestro proyecto contribuyendo en la culminación de un disco que representa un gran tesoro para interpretes, compositores y arreglistas de nuestra agrupación.Es importante destacar, que con un esfuerzo inicial, se pudo llevar a cabo la grabación de  los arreglos vocales, pero no fue suficiente para concluir el proyecto de la manera que se había planteado, para nosotros es muy importante esta campaña, pues representa una apuesta que permitirá lograr un sueño por el que se ha trabajado durante años.¿Qué obtenemos con su participación?A través de la participación de todos los colaboradores, será posible un disco con atributos muy especiales, estarán en calidad de invitados cantantes e instrumentistas de renombre del mundo y de nuestro país con los que hemos compartido escenarios, así como la participación de ingenieros de sonido que harán posible las mezclas de nuestros temas con la mejor calidad que podamos ofrecer.Será posible también, el diseño de una imagen fresca y natural que se verá materializada en el empaque del disco que todos podrán disfrutar en una presentación digital y en físico.¿Qué ofrecemos?Esta campaña ofrece una serie de recompensas con la que los contribuyentes podrán elegir como colaborar, esta será una forma de acercarnos aún mas a todos aquellos que quieran concretar su participación. Nuestras recompensas son especialmente diseñadas para este proyecto, la más sorprendente de todas, es nuestro cuatro venezolano instrumento que se presenta como recompensa debido a su tracendencia para acompañar todos los géneros musicales existentes en nuestro país.Para lograr todo lo referido anteriormente, se requiere de un presupuesto de 18.000 $ monto que será distribuido en los gastos de: horas de grabación en estudio , honorarios de algunos músicos, edición mezcla y masterización, diseño de la imagen, reproducción  del disco y recompensas. Todos estos gastos están contemplados para ser ejecutados dentro del país y en algunos casos fuera de él debido a las dificultades que actualmente se manejan con la situación del país. Esta campaña viene respaldada de un material audiovisual hecho por un equipo extraordinario de personas entre los que destacan los reconocidos  cineastas John y Javier Márquez, Nataly Higton, Radarani Gómez y Glenda Mendoza. En dicho material se recoge una pequeña muestra musical de nuestro disco, y la petición expresa de cada uno de sus integrantes a que todo aquel que se anime nos ayude con su contribución.Cualquier contribución por pequeña que sea tendrá una repercusión importante para nuestro proyecto, soñamos con un disco de la mejor calidad, con la participación de músicos, técnicos y diseñadores que puedan llenarnos de mucha satisfacción, alegría y orgullo.En caso de no cumplir el 100% de la meta planteada, nos veremos limitados a ejecutar el plan como se tiene previsto, sin embargo, el porcentaje que se obtenga será destinado para culminar el proyecto de la mejor manera posible.Los más valioso de culminar este proyecto, es el aporte que se hará a través del registro y difusión de nuestra música popular venezolana, el mundo podrá disfrutar de un trabajo cultivado por años que se caracteriza por conservar elementos muy tradicionales con fusión de música contemporánea.Nuestros principales riesgos y desafíos, están relacionados en principio con las dificultades enmarcadas en la situación socio política que atraviesa Venezuela, las limitaciones en cuanto a las telecomunicaciones comprometen la buena comunicación o relación con nuestros colaborados a lo largo de la campaña. Se tomarán las previsiones para que esto no nos afecte de manera significativa, a través de la contratación de servicios privados que proporcionen internet.Existen formas muy útiles de colaborar, la más valiosa de todas es que compartas en tu circulo de amigos y conocidos el link de nuestra campaña junto a una invitación para que otros al igual que tu sean protagonistas de esta historia.

story:
Short Summary

Closure is a project I started as an outlet for my more personal music.  This song is no exception, and I want this video to really capture what I felt while writing this song and album.  The video itself is a metaphor for a person who broke me, and will show clips of a house being wrecked.  My goal is to paint a clear picture of what it feels like to be abused, neglected, and taken advantage of by the person who you love the most.  

What We Need & What You Get

All money we receive through this campaign will go towards the following:

  • Director
  • Camera Crew
  • Video Editors
  • Set
  • Props
  • Venue Fee
  • Actors
  • Production Fee

Check out the perks you can get from donating to the right of your screen!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the ability to donate, we are still looking for extras to be in the live shots of the video.  If you are interested in participating, you can meet us at The Smiling Moose in Pittsburgh on March 15th at 7:00pm, completely free of charge.  If you are unavailable, or not within driving distance, simply sharing this link with your friends will be greatly appreciated!

story:
Hello world! My name is Keri Stewart, and I'm a singer-songwriter here in the greater Boston area.

I’ve been making music since I was a little girl, but much of it remained in my head and in my notebooks until recent years. For years, I was afraid to be heard. But, eventually, I began sharing my songs with others and knew it was time to see my music come to life. So, now, after many years of writing, playing, and waiting, it's finally time to share the sounds in my head and my heart with all of you.

The material is ready. The musicians are waiting. This Indiegogo campaign is the final step toward creating my first-ever professionally produced studio album.

This campaign is raising funds for my professionally recorded album with Bryan Fennelly, a Boston-based producer, and engineer who is working with both established and up-and-coming musicians. Together, Bryan and I are digging into my original material, writing arrangements, and reaching out to local musicians to bring the songs to life.

I’ve been able to cover the costs of recording and producing one song, which is ready for you to check out right here on this page. This first song is called "Candy Land,” and you can check it out below!

 

While I was able to fund the recording process for "Candy Land" on my own, studio time costs to create an album of songs of this quality add up quickly. With that said, this campaign gives us a unique opportunity to collaborate and make great art together. Your donation will cover the following costs of my project:

1. Pre-Production: This is where everything starts. Bryan and I will start crafting the arrangements for each of the songs that will go on the album. We’ll hold rehearsals to fine-tune the songs, arrangements, and talk through new and exciting ideas for how to approach the recording process.

2. Recording: This is when we enter the studio and start capturing the music and where the songs become what you'll hear on this album. This campaign will play a huge role in making sure we have enough time to capture great performances for every musician.

3. Mixing & Mastering: Each track will get mixed to create the right balance between instruments, texture, and color that make up a track. As a final step, the album will be mastered from beginning to end, so the listening experience is cohesive and carefully choreographed from start to finish.

And what will you get for your generosity and support? So many awesome things!

I am so appreciative and grateful for any support you can lend to this campaign. In exchange for your generosity, I've put together a really exciting group of gifts that are available exclusively through your participation in this campaign.

Check out some examples below and a full list to the right!

It's hard to express how much this project would change my life.

It's said that 3 chords and the truth can change the world. I believe it. It changed mine.

Creating music is what I was born to do. I knew it at age 4 while playing my mom's old vinyl in my bedroom. I knew it at age 10 while teaching myself piano. The passion has always stayed with me. But in my teens, an experience convinced me that I would never be any good at this. As a result, it would be another 16 years before anyone would hear me sing again. Thankfully, an encouraging mentor and musician helped me overcome this belief, and the passion won out.

Today, I'm writing, singing, and playing my own music. I'm determined to let this passion grow into it's full potential. And for the first time ever, I'm taking a huge leap of courage and offering up my original music for you and the world to hear.

It all begins with this album. Having my own original music professionally produced is a dream come true. The finished album will open new doors and new opportunities for growth for me. My hope is to have more opportunities to play live, to see my songs used in media and film, to collaborate with other artists, and to inspire even more new music. I can't wait to see where this new chapter will take me, and I'd love for you to be a part of it.

With your support, I can fully enter into what I was always meant to do: create music that just might change the world.

If you're ready to contribute, simply choose a perk, or click the pink "Back It" button on the top right of this page! Every little bit counts, and I'm so grateful for all your support.

If you've got folks in your network that would be interested in supporting me, please help get the word out and make some noise! There are social media share buttons on this page, and please tell your friends how grateful I am for this support.

Thank you so much for checking out my campaign page. I can't wait to share more music with you!

story:
Short Summary

  • Welcome to my page! I'm Mikelangelo, but you can call me Mike (since we're friends now).  I'm an LA native at heart; my love for music grew in parallel with my struggles in South Central LA throughout the early 90's.  I define myself as an artist, songwriter, and engineer. I've been the in-house engineer for Kamaiyah (aka., 4Hunnid's and YG's first lady) since 2017 working directly for Universal Music Group / Interscope Records. Admittedly, I've been crafting my own music over the last few years in stealth mode, but was always scared to release it (until now). Nonetheless, I'm really looking forward to finally being able to share my songs and feelings with all of you special contributors. 

  • To no surprise, my uphill journey led me to the studio, where I often found refuge and appreciation for my internal struggles through singing and engineering beats. I was fortunate enough to surround myself with some of the leading icons of our time. Not long after my obsession with mastering music turned into making music of my own, when I found myself working alongside icons Kamaiyah, YG, Hitboy, 808 Mafia, and Pierre Bourne, who ultimately helped me found my voice and new direction. 

  • Fans have respectfully compared my music to the likes of Kid Cudi, Ginuwine, Drake, and Kendrick Lamar (in case your already a fan).  I'm known by the fans for flowy sounds, warm lyrics, and soulful pitch. What I enjoy most is capturing the love and kindness R&B was always intended to bring in an age where there is too much division among each other. 

  • This campaign is for my debut music video "Used To", and this project is important to me because I want the world to experience more love and kindness. I think it's time we share more soul, less divisiveness, more love, and less hatred. Simple as that.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're looking for a minimum of $3,500, and 100% of the proceeds whether the goal is met or not will go directly towards the music video production. We're working with a trusted industry-recognized production crew.
  • Our production team: AJ Favicchio & Miles Cable 
    • Projects include: Jaden Smith - Fallen, Billy Ellish - Bellyache, Bea Miller - To The Grave
    • More here: https://www.saucedigital.co/projects // insta: @milesandaj
    • Stylist: Julian "Milli" Doster
  • Here's how the costs estimated break down for the music video to be a success: 
    • $2k+ production (lenses, lights, site location cost, etc.)
    • $1k directing fee
    • $500 edit
    • $500 styling  
  • What you will receive in return, other than being my day 1's, is an exclusive invitation to my video launch party, contributor video credits, signed merchandise, and special shout-outs across social media!

Challenges

  • We have faith and conviction that we can create this music video with the support of you, our fans, and those who want to bring the world more love and kindness!
  • There are always inherent challenges in video production if we're over budget or our timeline isn't met, but I can assure you our team is equipped to push through by providing you transparent updates every step of the way (weekly updates). 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us spread the word by sharing a post like this  "#Mikelangelinos by Funding @Mikel_angelo debut music video "Used To" on Twitter or Instagram or even Facebook!"
  • Any support above that would simply exceed our expectations!

Peace & Love,

Mikelangelo 

PS: If you want to learn more about Mikelangelo's music, collaborate, upcoming appearances, or just want to help join our growing team, don’t hesitate to reach-out.

  • Business Manager: Joseph McKenna
  • joseph@mikelangelomusik.com
  • LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/mckennajoseph/
  • Website under construction: https://www.mikelangelomusik.com/

Admittedly, I've been crafting my own music over the last few years in stealth mode, but was always scared to release it (until now). Nonetheless, I'm really looking forward to finally being able to share my songs and feelings with all of you special contributors. 
To no surprise, my uphill journey led me to the studio, where I often found refuge and appreciation for my internal struggles through singing and engineering beats. I was fortunate enough to surround myself with some of the leading icons of our time. Not long after my obsession with mastering music turned into making music of my own, when I found myself working alongside icons Kamaiyah, YG, Hitboy, 808 Mafia, and Pierre Bourne, who ultimately helped me found my voice and new direction. 
Fans have respectfully compared my music to the likes of Kid Cudi, Ginuwine, Drake, and Kendrick Lamar (in case your already a fan).  I'm known by the fans for flowy sounds, warm lyrics, and soulful pitch. What I enjoy most is capturing the love and kindness R&B was always intended to bring in an age where there is too much division among each other. 
This campaign is for my debut music video "Used To", and this project is important to me because I want the world to experience more love and kindness. I think it's time we share more soul, less divisiveness, more love, and less hatred. Simple as that.

Any support above that would simply exceed our expectations!

story:
BIO

•Nikki Allen is a singer/songwriter/musician whose artistic style crosses many genres, from R&B, Pop, Hip/Hop to Contemporary Jazz.  Her five octave vocal range and sultry voice is not only unique and soothing, but satisfying to the soul.

•Straight Outta Chicago, Nikki landed in LA and began immediately working her talents, touring and performing with mainstream artists like Jon B., and working with artists like Angie Stone, and Mary J. Blige just to name a few.  Nikki later toured Asia on her own accord, not only as a singer but as a musician.  As a songwriter, she has teamed up with jazz great Jeff Lorber and producers Zack Harmon and Chris Troy.  Nikki has since released her first CD entitled, “The One” in which she wrote the majority of the songs, five of which were chosen for the Grammy ballot.

•Currently, Nikki has released her version of the Christmas song and “Sound of Music” cover, “My Favorite Things”, which is quickly becoming a holiday favorite as it plays on radio stations in Singapore, England, Miami and Chicago for starters.   Award-winning radio host Rick Party, (Hot 105 Miami) had this to say, “Not only is it a hit, but it's from my favorite all time movie, "The Sound of Music”!

•2018 will be an even bigger year for Nikki as she plans to release her sophomore CD this summer, further solidifying her place as both writer and artist among the very best to ever do it.

THE PROJECT

This project aptly entitled, “Dangerous” is filled with 10 amazing tracks produced by Tyler “King Gas” Gaston, Peter Rafelson, and Damone Arnold thus far.  The flavor is R&B/Hip Hop seasoned with Nikki’s sultry vocals along with some amazing featured mainstream artists like Dave Hollister (committed)  and Ty Dolla $ign (tentative).

 

THE GOAL

GRAND TOTAL:
$52,790

 

•Production Costs:

              •Producer fees

              •Studio Rental fees

               •Mixing and Mastering fees

•Total:  $10,740

•Marketing and Promotion Costs:

              •Social Media Campaign   

              •Digital Marketing Campaign

              •PR Services

•Total:  $5,700 

•Distribution and Radio:  $35,000

•Creative Costs:

             •Photo Shoot

             •Album artwork/graphics

             •Glam Squad

Total:  $1,350 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

BE A SPONSOR

If you want to be a sponsor, click here to be directed to the sponsorship proposal deck!

Other Ways You Can Help:

BE A SPONSOR
If you want to be a sponsor, click here to be directed to the sponsorship proposal deck!

story:
This project is the recording of the 6th studio album of original songs entitled Maps - Burned or Lost by Ottawa folk/progressive rock band Sills & Smith set for world-wide release in January 2018. The album features 14 melodic new songs written by Frank Smith (words, music) and Jeremy Sills (music) and is recorded and produced by Phillip Victor Bova at Bova Sound. All of the composers, musicians and singers on this album are from Ottawa, Canada and area. The album is a nearly 70 minute cohesive song cycle addressing the fragility of human relationships and touching on social justice/human rights themes that have been a hallmark of the band's output to date. The music moves from pastoral folk, to trippy indie rock, to forays into progressive rock. Jeremy Sills and Frank Smith are acclaimed songwriters registered with SOCAN.

Sills & Smith, fronted by Ottawa singer-songwriters Jeremy Sills and Frank Smith, has independently released five previous studio albums of music that boldly blend and bend elements of folk, alternative rock, progressive rock, with hints of blues and jazz. Please contribute to our campaign and help us defray some of the expenses of studio and session musician costs. You can help us for as little as a $10 for Maps - Burned or Lost in digital format or for $20 for the beautiful digipak edition of the album -- designed by Grace Smith -- including mailing costs. Plus, we are offering cool swag/art: a limited edition Maps art card and a high quality full colour Maps silk screened t-shirt in your size. For a donation of $150 you get The Complete Sills & Smith (all six studio albums, including 2 copies of Maps - Burned or Lost), a Maps t-shirt and art card!

To give us a boost, spread the word about our fundraising campaign by sharing on your Facebook page and/or other social media.

The players/singers on Sills & Smith, Maps - Burned and Lost:

The new album Maps- Burned and Lost features the talents of Frank Smith (vocals), Jeremy Sills (vocals, acoustic guitars, piano, trumpet), Phil Bova (electric bass, keyboards and strings, hammond organ, tambourine, producer/recording engineer), T. Bruce Wittet (drums/percussion), Don Wallace (electric guitars), Jesse Stewart (various percussion instruments), Jim McDowell (organs), Marianne Dumas (keyboards/percussion), Petr Cancura (mandolin), Brian Tansley (saxophone, flute).

Praise for Sills & Smith:

“The musical capabilities of Sills & Smith are such that ‘Echoes In Time’ isn’t just a really good album, it is a great one and one that I must heartily recommend to any lover of great music and excellent songwriting.” Martin Hutchinson - Progradar

“No matter where Sills & Smith travel on Echoes in Time, though, the duo always hover around that same mid-'70s arena rock era, oftentimes stripping some of the "progressive" out of their brand of prog rock. Overall, Sills & Smith come off as seasoned and focused songwriters and distinguished instrumentalists on Echoes in Time. (Independent) - Get It” Daniel Sylvester - Exclaim

“Sills & Smith are an alternative rock band based out of Ottawa who released their fourth full-length record, Etched, in August 2014. If you like intelligent, folk-influenced alternative rock in the vein of The Tragically Hip, then the 13 eclectic tracks that make up Etched will be a perfect fit for you.” Lisa Fiorilli - Confront Magazine

“I've been listening to these guys since 2012's No Way Out, No Way In, and I still can't figure out which one sounds like Warren Zevon. But the world-weariness of his voice brings additional authenticity. Taken collectively, these songs make Echoes in Time Sills & Smith's best album yet.” Michael Popke - Sea of Tranquility

"Sills and Smith have made Etched an obvious labour of love, and this effort permeates the entire album." Tristin Norenberg-Goodmanson - Earshot - The National Campus Community Radio Report

“This Ottawa band is growing by leaps and bounds with each new song. Living On An Island - Sounds like: A plea.” Larry Lootsteen - Alan Cross - A Journal of Musical Things

story:
Let's get Reinventing!

I strongly believe in the power of choral music.  There's something transcendental about the unity of human voices and we believe we're at the forefront of something really special when it comes to "Reinventions". 

Here is the Reinventions album track list:

1. I Get Around - Beach Boys (1964)

2. Jolene - Dolly Parton (1974)

3. When Doves Cry - Prince (1984)

4. Don't Dream It's Over - Crowded House (1986)

5. This Woman's Work - Kate Bush (1988)

6. Black Hole Sun - Soundgarden (1994)

7. Frozen - Madonna (1998)

8. Hey Ya - Outkast (2003)

9. We Found Love - Rihanna/Calvin Harris (2011)

Our mission is to take this eclectic group of classic songs and reframe them in an ethereal choral setting that brings powerful new meaning and beauty for listeners.

Love it! How can I help?

We're very close to getting this out in the universe for people to enjoy.  Many people involved are offering their time, talents and services at a reduced rate because they believe in this project. All we need now is your support to cover some of our expenses.  Here's where your contributions will be going:

  • Recording and rehearsal space (the stunning St Paul's Episcopal in Brooklyn) [$300]
  • Sound Engineer services including mastering (by the amazing MP Kuo) [$2000] 
  • Art design for the album cover (by the talented Damien Dunstan) [$400]
  • Mechanical Licensing costs for digital release (to cover royalties for the original artists) [$600]
  • Misc. costs such as food and transport for the singers [$200]

 

If you would love to support us but can't contribute financially, please consider sharing with family, friends and pop/choir lovers alike!

story:
Common Ground Voices is a peace building project with the mission to find common ground between Israelis and Palestinians through music. Music touches most humans in a profound way, it goes directly to the heart. To create art walls need to come down and creating together automatically creates an openness and builds lasting connections. We see the things which unites us more clearly, rather than what divides us, which often comes to our eyes first. Through this project we aim to rebuild relationships, trust and, above all, love between Palestinians and Israelis.

In our work we combine both Hebrew and Arab music to create something new and innovative together: the foundation of a new combined culture, and the foundation for a lasting peace. Each residency is nothing short of a transformative experience that often changes perspectives and lives both for the participants and the audience.

The scope of the choir has now reached far beyond the Middle East. Inspired by Common Ground Voices, members of the choir has developed similar projects in other conflict zones. The first one, called La Frontera, took place on either side of the border between the United States and Mexico following the Trump Declaration on the construction of the wall between Mexico and the US.  Common Ground Voices has performed for and with prisoners, choral singers from around the world, migrant workers, Ultra-Orthodox communities, decision makers and royalty.  

Since its establishment in 2016 the choir meets once or twice a year in Jerusalem a week long residency. Without knowing each other beforehand, the singers participate in voice development, exploring language and tonality of music from each other’s musical culture, empowerment, dialogue with different communities (Ultra-Orthodox Jews, prisoners, refugees, etc.) and social outreach projects. A concert concludes each intensive week long session.

Support our next residency in August 2019 in Acco where we will have the opportunity to sing with and inspire thousands of people.

story:
Hi there! My name is Darren Cementina, and I’m a singer/actor/songwriter from Scranton, Pennsylvania, currently pursuing performing arts in NYC. I am raising funds to record and release my first EP!

Ever since high school, music has always been an outlet and an escape. Moving to the city and meeting so many talented, amazing artists and performers has inspired me to take up songwriting again. Earlier this year, in collaboration with producer/arranger Jovon Barnes, I was lucky enough to release my debut single "Piece of My Heart," which took me years to finish and find the right sound for. Check it out below:

Finding that sound helped me fall in love with music all over again. I’ve now written a handful of new, original material that I’m ready to share with the world—but I need your help to do it!

Letters in a Bottle will feature "Piece of My Heart" and four new, original songs. Quality isn't cheap though; I need around $1,700 to see this project to completion. The financial breakdown is as follows:

  • Studio rental fees ($600)
  • Mixing and mastering fees ($300)
  • Hiring live musicians ($800)

Donating different amounts will earn you varying perks such as personalized thank you’s, signed posters, T-shirt’s, early access to songs from the EP, and even free tickets to the album release party in NYC in the spring! All funds will go to producing the EP in its full capacity; nothing more.

I will be totally honest, this whole process is very new to both me and Jovon. But that's why I’m asking for your help: getting into a professional studio with an engineer and live instrumentation will really bring my music to life with the best quality possible. I’m very passionate about each and every one of these songs, and I truly believe many others will enjoy what I have to share. I just need a little help getting there. 

Any amount helps! And even if you yourself can’t directly donate, you can still help out. Feel free to share this campaign on your own social media pages and platforms, and tell anyone and everyone you think would be willing to help us get this project up on its feet. I’m really excited to get started! Thank you for time and consideration, and I hope you’ll join me on this journey. 

Much love,

- D

story:
Help support Ottawa songwriter Steve St. Pierre record, release, promote, stress and agonize over his upcoming full-length release 'Dimes.'

Steve St. Pierre is a songwriter from Ottawa, Ontario, CANADA (and he still feels it's unfortunate that he has to name the country, alas, people are daft). He's been writing and performing long enough that music is still exciting and beautiful and amazing, but not long enough that people know exactly who he is or what he's about.

St. Pierre performed major festivals inside and outside of his hometown, including Ottawa Bluesfest, NXNE, CMW and has nearly sold out the legendary Horseshoe Tavern. Yes, he will cling onto that 'nearly' and will until the day he dies. 

'Dimes' is a collection of songs that finally make sense, and at the age of 35, they couldn't come too soon. Honest, maybe a little too much at times, and lush thank you to the assistance of his producer Stephen Clarke (Ottawa rock royalty — he's going to hate that I put that in there). 

Your support will bring 'Dimes' to life. From recording through production, release, promotion and touring and and and. Records cost an unfortunate amount of money if you want to make them work, and this one deserves all the work we can put behind it. 

In the spirit of not really loving the tiered reward system, this crowdfunding campaign is going to be flat. No matter what you support, you get access to the same perks as everyone else. So - what are those perks?

 

 

They will grow with time and with donations, but as it stands everyone gets a cleverly-designed lighter, a genre-touting t-shirt AND a vinyl copy of Dimes once it becomes available. Throughout the process, you'll get access to demos and videos and and and. But the more people donate, the more stuff we get to make. Tote bags? Sure. Pins? Why not?! Temporary tattoos? WHO WANTS MY FACE ON THEIR ASS?!

No matter if you can afford $10, if you can afford the whole $5K; Everyone. Gets. The. Same. Thing. Capitalism is real.

story:
Short Summary

Friends and collaborate colleagues Tyler W. Simpson (a multi-award winning Music Education + Percussive Performance graduate, Composer, Conductor, Educator, and frequent consumer of the coffee) and Preston R. Garza (accredited in advanced Ableton Audio Production & Recording from the LA Recording Connection, Composer,  Percussionist, and Proud Father) are joining together to form TwoMinds Percussion© - a four part compositional series that aims to expand and emphasize the role of percussion within art and music alike. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Up to this point, we already have the following pre-production stages completed: 

  • Scripting for each video
  • Compositions themselves (including drafted Audio / Notation)
  • Live performance recordings of both Staged(?) and Elemental Drumming (feat. former lead cast-member of Broadway's STOMP, John Angeles)
  • Cast / Performers for each respective video 

 

As you might know, creating a high quality music-video of any style can be quite costly, ranging into the tens of thousands of dollars for a single video. The requested funding will aid with both the production / post production period of the series. This will include: 

  • Videography / Video Editing 
  • Audio Recording 
  • Costume Design / Makeup 
  • Stage Setting
  • Venue Rental (if applicable) 
  • Guest-artist Commission 

 

We are budgeting $1200 / composition, totaling to $4800, with an estimated 80% of the funds going towards the AV / Editing department. 

If we exceed our goal:

  • Any excess funds will go to the improvement of each individual video by enhancing the editorial process (via bringing in more knowledgeable staff).
  • We love the potential of finalizing the series with a fifth and final piece, if the funds allow it! 
  • In addition, we would love to have a free-to-attend live performance of select pieces; perhaps even a charity concert!

 

To top it off, we have A LOT of cool perks to show our gratitude - from signed drumheads / photos of the cast, to being invited to the production set as a performer! 

 

*3% of all funds raised, regardless of goal met or not, will be donated to the "Boys & Girls Clubs of America" in the form of new musical instruments to promote musical education for young children*

 

The Impact

By contributing to this project, you are:

  • Bringing new, creative music into the world.
  • Aiding in the cross-recognition of the arts as a whole, promoting it's importance in an educational setting. 
  • Allowing for "the doors" to open, enabling the involved artists to continue to create new content. 
  • Constructing a bridged community between each of the respective arts. 
  • Providing musical education opportunities to children in the "Boys & Girls Clubs of America." *see above percentile 

 

A bit about the Pieces  

BarTalk - In this 25+ person flashmob inspired percussion ensemble, we are gathering at your local pub / bar to drum on some bar essentials! This broadway-percussion inspired piece will be the most theatric, cinematic piece that we have to offer!   

Staged(?) - Gradually transformed into a departmental-wide collaborative project, the students of Texas Wesleyan University’s Department of Music came together for this fun and energetic piece. Performed entirely in the dark, the piece is designed to stirclty utilize the different sounds made from any given performance hall, all being percussive by nature. Our hope is to pair with a larger percussive organization to eventually create the Staged(?) series, allowing us to travel from University to University across the nation to work with each department's students, allowing them to create their own unique composition following the same concept. 

Elemental Drumming - In collaboration with former lead cast-member of Broadway's percussive spectacular STOMP, we are turning a junkyard into a percussionist's playground. From plastics and metallics, to drumming on water-shooting tom-toms with our sticks ablaze, the piece brings a bit of Broadway to the South! 

Vortex - Using the Cor-ten steel, 67 ft x 21 ft  x 20 ft sound chamber by Richard Serra (located at the Modern art Museum of Fort Worth), we are turning physical art into a living, breathing instrument. Along with adding in theatrical cosmetology to the performance, it's basically art-ception. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share, share, share! Please aid us in spreading this campaign like a wildfire! 
  • Follow these links to like / subscribe to both Preston and Tyler's respective Youtube channels so that you can track each of our projects :)
  • Are you an aspiring artist (digital animation, illustration, makeup / costume, etc.), musician, videographer, or sound engineer? Feel free to reach out to see if there is a position to fill for this project! 

 

Thank you in advance for any and all support - you all are the reason that we are allowed   to peruse our dreams.

Elemental Drumming - In collaboration with former lead cast-member of Broadway's percussive spectacular STOMP, we are turning a junkyard into a percussionist's playground. From plastics and metallics, to drumming on water-shooting tom-toms with our sticks ablaze, the piece brings a bit of Broadway to the South! 

Vortex - Using the Cor-ten steel, 67 ft x 21 ft  x 20 ft sound chamber by Richard Serra (located at the Modern art Museum of Fort Worth), we are turning physical art into a living, breathing instrument. Along with adding in theatrical cosmetology to the performance, it's basically art-ception. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share! Please aid us in spreading this campaign like a wildfire! 
Follow these links to like / subscribe to both Preston and Tyler's respective Youtube channels so that you can track each of our projects :)
Are you an aspiring artist (digital animation, illustration, makeup / costume, etc.), musician, videographer, or sound engineer? Feel free to reach out to see if there is a position to fill for this project! 

 
Thank you in advance for any and all support - you all are the reason that we are allowed   to peruse our dreams.

story:
Slavo Rican Assembly - our first album


Dear reader,
Thank you for stopping by.

Slavo Rican Assembly is a group of devoted, passionate musicians, who met at the global crossroads that is New York City.

First, a short story about the concept's and the band's  genesis:

My name is Jan Kus (pronounced Yahn Koos), and I am an award-winning, Slovenian-born, NYC-based saxophonist, composer, producer, and bandleader. Since as early as I can remember, I've always been immensely fascinated by  music from all the corners of the world, every style and any genre, as long as it was sincere and heartfelt. I've always had a feel for Latin music, and my childhood stays in Sarajevo, Bosnia, with my extended family infused me with the "Balkan blues", or "sevdah" as it is called.

Fast forward for some years, and, as fate would have it, I crossed paths with Puerto Rican bassist, Dan Martínez, during our music studies in NYC. Through our friendship and musical connection, I became a sort of an "adopted" brother of the young generation of the city's thriving Puerto Rican musical community, most notably as a member of the esteemed Fernando Garcîa Band.

What started as a kind of a word play, a  joke based on my untypical background for a bomba, salsa and rumba playing Latin Jazz saxophonist, grew stronger during my two trips to Puerto Rico in 2014 and 2018, and finally flourished fully into a deep and profound musical concept - Slavo Rican!
Slavic and Puerto Rican, Balkan and Caribbean, a sound that aims to connect with your spirit in various ways, by being melancholic and groovy at the same time, feeling ethereal, yet grounded.

It has been my TREMENDOUS honor  to have some of New York City's finest musicians from both sides of the Slavo Rican equation collaborate with me on this crazy scientists' formula of mine. :)

The group features Aleksandra Denda from Serbia on vocals, Žan Tetičkovič aka Jean John from Slovenia on drums, Puerto Ricans Dan Martínez on bass, Victor Pablo on percussion, and Gabriel Vicéns on guitar, along with Ahmed Alom Vega from Cuba on the piano and keyboards.

Through the bands' collective talents and efforts, I can honestly say that the music started growing FAR beyond my wildest dreams in our three years of existence so far, so it was a pretty easy, and very inspiring task to keep writing and writing new pieces for the group, until we got to a point where we now have enough material to probably record three albums at this point!
It is with great joy and sense of fulfillment that I see the group starting to make some noise on the NYC music scene, where we regularly perform at various notable venues across town.

MORE INFO ABOUT THE BAND IS AVAILABLE HERE:
Our website: www.jankusmusic.com/slavorican
Our Instagram page: https://www.instagram.com/slavorican/
Our Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/SlavoRican/

The group's chemistry and family-like bond  both on and off-stage, is also at an impressive high, which was on full display during our highly successful Summer 2019 tour of Slovenia, where we performed at some of the most acclaimed European musical festivals, next to names like Snarky Puppy and Kenny Garrett, to a highly enthusiastic response from our audiences.
That response honestly means THE WORLD to me, since I feel this is the first time in my life I have truly cracked the code of writing something that speaks equally to my group's musicians, and to listeners from ALL WALKS OF LIFE, regardless of their musical knowledge or background, and across a wide variety of cultures, as well.
 

There is a quote from Ken Wilber that I hold very dear to my heart, and it goes:

"At integral consciousness we begin to be able to create new tribal connections, but this time they are more memetic than genetic, more organized around ideas than blood relations. We’re able to experience the juice of being deeply bonded to all kinds of people in ways that are not exclusive but expansive."

I believe that with this group's unique musical concept, and with the chemistry of this specific group of musicians, we have a chance to achieve that!

We recently released our debut single to many heartfelt and MUCH APPRECIATED compliments from our listeners, but considering all of the above, it is now HIGH TIME for us to head into the studio and record the rest of our FIRST ALBUM!
...
To be able to achieve that, however, we could really use your support.
Making an album these days is not cheap, since the old model of labels covering the costs of production are essentially over, and the musicians are left with kind of  the DIY (do it yourself) model. The expenses of making an album are more throughly broken down below.

We would really love to document this part of our musical journey forever, before the magic fades away, and making an album will SURELY give new breath to our creativity, as well as open many doors for us in our continuation of our common musical path.Most importantly, it  would also give YOU, our dear listeners, a chance to listen to our music every time when you feel like you might need some Slavo Rican medicine for your SOUL in this busy and overwhelming world we live in. :)


 

What We Need & What You Get
 

COSTS

As I mentioned earlier, here are the costs of making an album broken down.
The money we are trying to raise will be used towards the following steps in the process of the creation of the album:

-Studio time

-Editing, Post-Production, Mixing, Mastering

-Musicians' fees

-Creation of promotional materials

-Artwork

-Printing of the album (of the disc and/or download cards)

-Publicity expenses

 

We are doing our best to keep all of these at a minimum, but believe us, 10000$ is really the minimum when you're trying to make all of that happen, especially at a level of high quality for a project of this magnitude. 


REWARDS (PERKS)

In return for your generous contribution, we will reward you with some pretty unique and interesting perks, such as:

 

-Signed copies of the album

-Extra footage from  the recording session and our Summer 2019 tour

-Concert tickets and VIP hangout with the band at our potential CD release show

-Private lessons with our band members

-Rehearsal access

-Bonus tracks

-Private in house concerts!!
AND MORE!

 

The Impact


I like to believe that art has the capacity to, if not change the world, at least nudge it towards being a little better, a little more united, a little more connected, a little less estranged, a little more heartfelt, and a little less self centered.
And, out of all the arts, music is probably the one that can bridge the biggest gaps, since it speaks equally to the body, the soul, and the mind, and is not bound by a specific language, but rather speaks in a common, universal tongue, the deepest expression of the truth of the human condition.

Given the state of the world today, with all the political, socio-economical, tribalistic, and ecological tensions across numerous divides going on, I would humbly hope that a project like ours can, by using our media of communication, which is sound, touch a few hearts, open a few minds, or illuminate a few souls and demonstrate that AUTHENTIC connection between fellow humans from different backgrounds IS POSSIBLE. And, not only is it possible, but it can, by bringing together what might seem like two separate entities at first, create something new and profound, something deep and soulful and true - a sum that is far greater than its original parts. (NOT like Hawaii Pizza!!! ;))))

I would also like to point out that we did a campaign similar to this one 4 years ago for my first album as a leader, Jan Kus Quartet - Faith, and that it was actually that album, made possible by our backers contributions (THANK YOU!), that planted the seeds and set the stage for this current project.
The album was also very well received by the general public as well as by various music critics and taste makers, as it topped several American and Canadian jazz charts for weeks, and in doing so opened many doors for our future musical development.




Risks & Challenges


Me and the other members of the band have a very wide network of friends and colleagues, spawning over 4 continents, so there is definitely enough people out there to make this happen. But, what we need now is ACTION*!
So please take the 5 minutes to make your contribution, and even if you contribute a small amount, I'm sure we can raise our full goal of  10000$ by the end of the campaign, if we all contribute at least a bit! (this is the beauty of crowd-funding campaigns in my opinion - people working together to help create something new and positive)


That's why it is even more important for us that you KEEP SPREADING THE WORD
about this project, even after you have made your contribution. 
 

We are confident that we have a GREAT product and a great project. We thank you in advance for being a part of it.

In the event that we do not meet our target goal, we will endeavor to find the remaining balance from other sources, so you can be confident that your donation WILL MAKE a difference and help make our dream come true!
If we, however, exceed our set goal, I personally guarantee you that we will invest every last dollar collected into further promotion of this band and its music....I have many, MANY ideas. :)))

Thank you.

*We understand that there may be technical difficulties in making your financial contributions online, especially from abroad. If you encounter such difficulties or wish to discuss other ways to contribute, please contact us at jankus.jk@gmail.com
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support this protection, but, for whatever reason, can't make a financial contribution, we're glad to let you know there are OTHER WAYS TO HELP THIS PROJECT! :)

This is a crowd-funding campaign - so, the bigger the crowd, the more funds we can potentially get. Please help us by spreading the word  - share the campaign link, forward the emails, and invite your friends to support the project. Your help would mean a lot to us!

A sincere THANK YOU for your time,
Or, as we like to say in our band - Muchas Hvalas (Thank you very much in SLAVORICANESE :)) )



Have a beautiful day,
Blessings,

Jan Kus and the Slavo Rican Assembly crew

story:
WHO WE ARE

Learn about San Antonio's newest chamber ensemble.

The San Antonio Harmonie Ensemble (a.k.a. SAHarmonie) is a group of like-minded musicians with a passion for performing chamber music at the highest level. All of the performers and conductors call San Antonio home and are proud to share their talents with the Alamo City. Brett A. Richardson serves as Conductor and Artistic Director along with Associate Conductor, Joe Samuel. Read about the outstanding personnel here.

What is Harmoniemusik?

Harmonie is a German word that, in the context of the history of music, designates an ensemble of wind instruments (usually about five to eight players) employed by an aristocratic patron, particularly during the Classical era of the 18th century. The Harmonie would be employed for outdoor or recreational music, or as a wind section of an orchestra. Music composed for Harmonie is often called Harmoniemusik. Via Roger Hellyer, Grove Music, 2006.


WHY WE ARE RAISING FUNDS

San Antonio's vibrant music culture needed an ensemble of this nature. Here's what it takes to get it off the ground:

  • $350 - Leather bound music folders to protect the repertoire
  • $250 - Website domain name and maintenance
  • $300 - Production of paper programs, pencils, paper, office supplies
  • $300 - (2) Receptions following the concerts to welcome our attendees

As we are in the process of becoming a 501(c)3 tax-exempt organization, your donation would not be tax-deductible at the moment - but appreciated immensely! 


THE IMPACT

With your donation, SAHarmonie can:

  • Bring to San Antonio high-level performances of historically important works and music from a diverse composer group.
  • Provide an outlet for area musicians to perform music in a chamber setting.
  • Keep our concerts admission free.
     

COUNTDOWN TO CONCERT

We are hoping to fund our campaign with a Crowdfunding Kickoff to our Debut Concert on 10.29.19. Let's all work together to provide REAL MUSIC, performed by REAL PEOPLE, FROM THE GROUND UP. Supporters like you can be a part of the genesis of one San Antonio's outstanding chamber groups.
 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  1. Like our social media pages on Facebook and Instagram @SAHarmonieEnsemble.
  2. Share our concerts on your own social media platforms.
  3. Invite friends and family to attend our concerts!
  4. Come to our concerts and listen to some of the best music written by our most important composers.

story:
Who Am I?

I am March, a songwriter/artist/musician from the village of Claygate, Surrey. I have just moved back home after living in Southampton for four years, a place that holds lots of the memories behind and the delivery of these songs. I have been writing and performing now for 6 or so years, with some of my recent highlights being playing at Glastonbury Fest '19, doing a BBC Introducing Live Lounge (watch here) and writing and releasing an EP 'Wear Me Down'. I previously released an album 'Giving in to You' under the name Kitty O'Neal which you can listen to here. I am very proud of this work, but have taken a slightly different direction which I am very excited about - you can read more about this (and my name change) in a blog post on my website here. My new EP 'Wear Me Down' is available for streaming on Bandcamp here and Spotify here. 

After organising a short 2-week UK tour and spending my first year out of university trying to gig as much as possible, I entered into a phase of feeling rather musically uninspired, physically and mentally burnt out from working pretty hard at my day job (I was a co-ordinator at a quirky non-profit, volunteer run arts hub/vegetarian cafe called The Art House), and it took a while to get back into the flow of writing. 2018 held quite a lot of personal challenges, but by the end of the year I was full to the brim of stories, thoughts, conversations and reflections and so I finally returned home to my creative zone and have been on a little creating adventure ever since. I have taken the time to read books about creativity, writing, humans, history, the planet, dreams (where I have found a fair bit of inspiration for my new songs). I have listened to a lot of new music, met many new people from all walks of life in my job, lived with and surrounded myself with like-minded creatives, and played a lot of really cool shows all over the place. My new songs take inspiration from all of this information I have taken in, and all of the experiences I have had in the last year, making it a pretty personal selection of songs which I would love to put together on a record. 

Because it is personal, I feel very protective over this work and it feels really special to me to potentially have the opportunity to record and release it. I am doing this completely independently, I don't have a record label but I do have all the power (mua ha ha) and I love the idea of being able to communicate and connect directly with the people who want to listen to my music. This means there is no support, managerial or financial, behind me which is why I have turned to you guys and IndieGoGo. The only funds I have to pursue creative projects like recording this album are what I can put in myself, which has proven difficult in the past, and I would really appreciate the help. In fact, without any help from supporters I just wouldn't be able to do any of this. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

If you're unsure about what a crowdfunder is, essentially it is just pre-ordering the album before I actually make it. That way, I can use the money raised to make the album now. There are also lots of other little treats that I have come up with, exclusive to you guys, which means I can connect with you in lots of other ways. (For example I have created some handmade rewards, the option to hold a house concert, download my unheard demos and more...)

I plan to dry-hire a studio space (this means hiring a space where you can take your own engineer and gear) which means I can work with my best friends on this project. I am going to be working with my bud Dan Keen (studio engineer/producer/composer) and some other musical pals and session musicians (not giving too much away yet!), making this a very collaborative project.

£5000 may sound like a lot of money to somebody who doesn't hang out in this industry, but actually I am doing this as DIY as possible and other projects of the same manner would probably be more like double this. I'm willing to put in as much of my own money (and time, love, willpower, energy, oomph), but really need to raise as much of this amount as possible to create the album that I hear in my head. The main costs are studio hire, recording fees, session musicians, mixing, mastering, pressing, PR...you get the idea! I want to give these songs the respect and professionalism that they deserve, and I trust that you'll be able to hear the difference when I do this right.

The Impact

If you support me, I can make this album and continue trying to do the only thing I know how to do well! I have nearly everything ready to go - the songs are almost there, the humans I want to involve are beside me most days, I have a timeline in my head, I'm working on launch and tour plans...I just need some funds to help me get going. 

Risks & Challenges

I am totally confident that I will deliver all of your rewards. One way or another this album is going to get recorded. There is always a risk of a little extra cost here and there, perhaps an extra day needed in the studio, but it's nothing a couple of hours of busking won't fix. I trust in the process and have faith that I will get this out to you by the end of 2020. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand completely that some of you may not be able to help me financially. I would be eternally grateful if you could share this campaign around to your friends who may be able to help, and spread the word of a new album from March.

And that's all there is to it.

I have been writing and performing now for 6 or so years, with some of my recent highlights being playing at Glastonbury Fest '19, doing a BBC Introducing Live Lounge (watch here) and writing and releasing an EP 'Wear Me Down'. I previously released an album 'Giving in to You' under the name Kitty O'Neal which you can listen to here. I am very proud of this work, but have taken a slightly different direction which I am very excited about - you can read more about this (and my name change) in a blog post on my website here. My new EP 'Wear Me Down' is available for streaming on Bandcamp here and Spotify here. 
After organising a short 2-week UK tour and spending my first year out of university trying to gig as much as possible, I entered into a phase of feeling rather musically uninspired, physically and mentally burnt out from working pretty hard at my day job (I was a co-ordinator at a quirky non-profit, volunteer run arts hub/vegetarian cafe called The Art House), and it took a while to get back into the flow of writing. 2018 held quite a lot of personal challenges, but by the end of the year I was full to the brim of stories, thoughts, conversations and reflections and so I finally returned home to my creative zone and have been on a little creating adventure ever since. I have taken the time to read books about creativity, writing, humans, history, the planet, dreams (where I have found a fair bit of inspiration for my new songs). I have listened to a lot of new music, met many new people from all walks of life in my job, lived with and surrounded myself with like-minded creatives, and played a lot of really cool shows all over the place. My new songs take inspiration from all of this information I have taken in, and all of the experiences I have had in the last year, making it a pretty personal selection of songs which I would love to put together on a record. 
Because it is personal, I feel very protective over this work and it feels really special to me to potentially have the opportunity to record and release it. I am doing this completely independently, I don't have a record label but I do have all the power (mua ha ha) and I love the idea of being able to communicate and connect directly with the people who want to listen to my music. This means there is no support, managerial or financial, behind me which is why I have turned to you guys and IndieGoGo. The only funds I have to pursue creative projects like recording this album are what I can put in myself, which has proven difficult in the past, and I would really appreciate the help. In fact, without any help from supporters I just wouldn't be able to do any of this. 
 

What I Need & What You Get
If you're unsure about what a crowdfunder is, essentially it is just pre-ordering the album before I actually make it. That way, I can use the money raised to make the album now. There are also lots of other little treats that I have come up with, exclusive to you guys, which means I can connect with you in lots of other ways. (For example I have created some handmade rewards, the option to hold a house concert, download my unheard demos and more...)
I plan to dry-hire a studio space (this means hiring a space where you can take your own engineer and gear) which means I can work with my best friends on this project. I am going to be working with my bud Dan Keen (studio engineer/producer/composer) and some other musical pals and session musicians (not giving too much away yet!), making this a very collaborative project.
£5000 may sound like a lot of money to somebody who doesn't hang out in this industry, but actually I am doing this as DIY as possible and other projects of the same manner would probably be more like double this. I'm willing to put in as much of my own money (and time, love, willpower, energy, oomph), but really need to raise as much of this amount as possible to create the album that I hear in my head. The main costs are studio hire, recording fees, session musicians, mixing, mastering, pressing, PR...you get the idea! I want to give these songs the respect and professionalism that they deserve, and I trust that you'll be able to hear the difference when I do this right.

The Impact
If you support me, I can make this album and continue trying to do the only thing I know how to do well! I have nearly everything ready to go - the songs are almost there, the humans I want to involve are beside me most days, I have a timeline in my head, I'm working on launch and tour plans...I just need some funds to help me get going. 

Risks & Challenges
I am totally confident that I will deliver all of your rewards. One way or another this album is going to get recorded. There is always a risk of a little extra cost here and there, perhaps an extra day needed in the studio, but it's nothing a couple of hours of busking won't fix. I trust in the process and have faith that I will get this out to you by the end of 2020. 

Other Ways You Can Help
I understand completely that some of you may not be able to help me financially. I would be eternally grateful if you could share this campaign around to your friends who may be able to help, and spread the word of a new album from March.
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Hello to all my friends, families, managers, coworkers and acquaintances as some of you know, I love to worship and sing new songs to our Father any chance I get, I love being in His presence and creating songs, and I would like to transition the worship experience I encounter every time into a LIVE WORSHIP ALBUM RECORDING ON THE 24TH OF OCT 2015. This has been a dream of mine and every time I thought about it, it seemed and still seems so impossible due to all the things that’s involved in getting it done, but after a long journey of ups and downs, though nothing is perfect yet, I am trusting the Lord and taking this step of faith for him to walk me through this journey.

All I have is Him “God”, His songs of worship, and your support to make this dream become a reality.  Each one of us has a purpose, a divine assignment, a specific task, a call by the Father himself to do something on his behalf. Though it’s encouraging and exciting to discover what that purpose is, at the same time, it’s A DAUNTING task trying to accomplish the very thing, that will define your purpose. Everyone needs a helping hand. And today I need your hand of support to get to the finish line.

My assignment for this worship encounter on Oct 24th 2015, is to usher everyone and anyone that is willing to go with me INTO HIS PRESENCE, and once we get before Him, my work is done and He the “LORD” will take over, depending on what the personal needs are. 

What We Need & What You Get

This live worship album recording will cost $25k to make! I know that is a lot of money...and it IS!!.  Making a live album recording is expensive!  but I have thought (and budgeted) long and hard, and at some point, I wanted to put this project off, but I feel like I’ve struck a good balance between being frugal and turning out a quality product for you to experience and also listen to!!  

Where is all this money going to go?  I’ll break down the list of costs here for you: 

  • Rental of Venue     $1,500
  • Music Production of 8-10 songs for Live recording
  • incl Instrumentalist and EXTRA studio time -    $8,000
  • Editing mixing/mastering of Music - 8 -10 songs    $1,600
  • Video Recording: DVD       $5,000
  • Sound Engineer for live recording      $4,300
  • Replicated DVD 4 Panel    $1,916
  • Replicated CD Digipacks 6 panel     $1,450
  • Art Work/ graphic design/CD&DVD Cover     $400
  • Pics/Photo-shoot     $200
  • Advertising  $400
  • Flyers/Posters $200

Made Music with Avid Worshiper Sleeve Shirt - Adult Shirts


  • Jnr. Sleeve shirt

Personalized birth pillow

Personalized Record door mat.

Personalized Mix tap Pillow

I am so grateful for your support in this exciting season of my life. I can’t wait to share these songs and this new album with you and most of all, The experience of His Presence. 

The Impact

The live experience in worship and listening to the CD, I believe will save a soul, will give hope and life back to someone who is suicidal, to someone who thinks, all is lost and there is no God, or this God does not care enough for me. The songs will uplift one, will build one up, will encourage us to continue to keep on keeping on and not give up on life, the songs will restore a broken heart and put a smile on a face or may even cause you to sing again. 

Risks & Challenges

My story has been a faith journey, and the Lord has proved himself faithful in every chapter of this story. There are risks and challenges (and often times spiritual warfare) anytime there is an assignment to fulfill. But I completely believe that the Lord has lead ME here and this project will be finished and ready to ship in February for the  CD Album 2016. If we experience any kind of delays with the project, resources, shipping, fulfillment, etc. we will let all backers know immediately and will keep open communication.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help share this campaign with your friends, families, coworkers, anyone that will support us. Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Jazz needs AUDIENCES! 

Let's be real. Jazz music has been taking a back seat for far too long. The corporate world of record labels long ago decided that there was no profit in this free-spirited, non-conformist genre. So we are continually force-fed the product that the corporate music world prefers that we buy. It's time to start changing that. Jazz merits our inspired and enthusiastic help!

That's why we formed the Taos Jazz Bebop Society:

to awaken audiences to the creative richness and soul-satisfying JOYS of jazz. 
Taos Jazz Bebop Society is a 501c3 non-profit corporation with a mission:

That means attracting world-class jazz artists to Taos. Hosting visiting artist clinics and workshops for young people. Creating opportunities for experimentation with Jazz & Poetry events. And hosting jam sessions with aspiring local and visiting players in venues around town. 

Last year the Taos Jazz Bebop Society presented four major concerts with world-class artists including Tootie Heath, Doug Lawrence and Greg Abate. The first one was a tribute to the late, great alto player Frank Morgan who called Taos home. It starred Grace Kelly, his stunningly talented alto sax protégé, with sidemen she selected from Taos and nearby. And it was beautiful!  Now it's time to build on that.

November 18 through 21st… 


Our campaign goal is $15,000

The Frank Morgan Taos Jazz Festival is our first truly ambitious event…  four nights, four programs, in four great Taos venues. It's an enormous undertaking. We must attract audiences from near and far… requiring extensive promotion and advertising. Ticket sales alone can't cover these costs. The funds we raise will also help foot the bill for the artists, their transportation and lodging, equipment rentals and stage crews. We have a great little team… but we can't do this alone! We have already secured funding from Taos County, the Town of Taos, Taos Community Foundation and Kind World Foundation, as well as local private donors. They believe is us… now we're asking for your support! Please consider donating whatever you can. You can also help us by spreading the word… and sharing our campaign with your friends and fellow jazz lovers. It goes without saying that we also hope you'll join us for the Festival to enjoy the music you've made possible! 

Not only that… you will have our endless gratitude and one of our special thank you gifts: from a great-looking Taos Jazz Bebop Society T-shirt, to autographed Grace Kelly CDs, or the one-of-a-kind silver ring worn by Frank Morgan himself! Most importantly, you will be making it possible for us to continue with our work of building a thriving scene for jazz in northern New Mexico.

If you love jazz, help us to make sure it flourishes
in Taos, New Mexico!

Please visit us at www.taosjazz.org
